KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The austerity of this building's exterior does not mislead: as without, so within. Before her is a single great hall, nearly unadorned and filled solely with shelves of tomes and rows of copying desks. While the vaulted ceiling is impressive, no intricate designs detail its supports.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Yet even in spite of its aesthetic dearth, the pearly, glowing tree at the Archives' center shrouds the room in a dreamlike haze. A bark of marble white covers its thick limbs, limbs which creep about the entirety of the Archives, stretching out like some sylvan giant just waking from its lengthy slumber. From cracks in its aged hide, bulbous crystalline protrusions pulse with a pale, white incandescence, casting rays of light about the structure.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The handful of individuals reading or copying texts are dwarfed by the arboreal behemoth, and rendered seemingly insignificant in contrast.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X010!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Two people seem approachable: a grim-looking woman pacing the area with the bearing of authority; and the other, in contrast, is a bright-eyed, younger woman, sitting before a stack of freshly minted leather-bound volumes.

B.response_text: Talk to the severe looking Librarian

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos strolls around the Archives, from shelf to shelf and tome to tome. Yet, with so much of the space occupied by the tree, it seems as though there is a relative poverty of written resources in this place. Many of the shelves lie empty and Eidos estimates that only roughly half the space is being filled with tomes.\n\n\t\tDuring her exploration, she also finds hints of a storied past when the Archives were alive with decorations. The now all but barren walls, were clearly once painted with murals that have faded with the passage of time. Large swathes have been completely erased, but here and there a splash of color or a fleck of gilding betrays their former glory.

C.response_text: Examine the art on the wall

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos strolls around the Archives, from shelf to shelf and tome to tome. Yet, with so much of the space occupied by the tree, it seems as though there is a relative poverty of written resources in this place. Many of the shelves lie empty and Eidos estimates that only roughly half the space is being filled with tomes. Having sifted through the tomes previously, she likewise knows that none are of any interest to her.\n\n\t\tDuring her exploration, she also finds hints of a storied past when the Archives were alive with decorations. The now all but barren walls, were clearly once painted with murals that have faded with the passage of time. Large swathes have been completely erased, but here and there a splash of color or a fleck of gilding betrays their former glory.

B.response_text: Examine the art on the wall

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.101!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos finds herself alone in an isolated corner of the Archives as she begins to inspect the art.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.102!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Her eyes lock onto one of the more intact murals. At first, it appears to be a stylistic representation of the massive tree dominating this very hall. Yet, there are a great number of differences both subtle and profane. In the faded fresco, the tree's roots are visible, seeming to sprout from the body of a woman buried beneath the tree. Red veins run through the roots, up the trunk, and blossom forth from the branches as crimson leaves. These stand in contrast to the silvered foliage of the Archives' own tree.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X103!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Parsing and inferring from nearly invisible outlines, Eidos sees - or imagines - two crows: one near the roots, pecking at the corpse, and another perched high in the uppermost branches, staring at the viewer with its coal-black eyes. Above the lofty crow is a white circle, like a bleached halo beaming light down upon the scene.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.200!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Parsing and inferring from nearly invisible outlines, Eidos sees - or imagines - two crows: one near the roots, pecking at the corpse, and another perched high in the uppermost branches, staring at the viewer with its coal-black eyes. Above the lofty crow is a white circle, like a bleached halo beaming light down upon the scene.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.201!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Yet, Eidos stares with greater focus and greater resolve, to know the unknowable. Hiding within the fresco, she begins to parse the faint outlines of shapes drawn in a colorless ink. It looks as though there are a great number of them, working their way from the roots of the tree to the bleached halo atop it. Many of them are unrecognizable, but all feel familiar, kindred. However, only one speaks to her directly; superimposed over the white halo is the Glyph of Awareness, with which her Sigil of the same name now resonates.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X202!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Upon recognition, the wall divides and folds into smaller pieces like an imploding fractal, revealing a hidden chamber beyond. A chamber seemingly invisible to all but Eidos, for as she surveys the Archives, she finds that no one else reacts or even notices what has transpired.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.203!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Upon recognition, the wall divides and folds into smaller pieces like an imploding fractal, revealing a hidden chamber beyond. A chamber seemingly invisible to all but Eidos, for as she surveys the Archives, she finds that no one else reacts or even notices what has transpired.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.210!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos returns to the Archives proper. None appear to have taken notice of her disappearance; and all have their attention fixed firmly upon their work, just as they had prior to her departure, almost as if frozen in time.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X300!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos scrutinizes the tomes, both covers and bindings. She stares, perplexed, at the leatherbound volumes, much as a beast may gaze upon a masterpiece. And as they would be to the beast, likewise are the works indecipherable to her.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X302!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos scans through the leather-bound volumes. None seem to be of consequence until she arrives at one that catches her interest. A tome on Torma the Wayfarer's travels.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.3020!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Absorbing the knowledge of the Wayfarer, Eidos learns of a Jeran sojourn of antiquity.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.303!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos has learned all she can from these tomes. Only the desperately knowledge-starved would think to re-read works already read...

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!10.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Approaching the venue, Eidos witnesses a sea of onlookers surrounding the smoking ruins of the Archives. A row of guards shield the place, barring all unwanted elements from accessing the mound of rubble.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!10.X001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Murmurs of speculation can be heard all about as to how this might have occurred. "Famlicus" and "Tacribian saboteur" are the most frequently heard terms. But then, Eidos singles in on a nearby conversation between a youth and his elder...

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!10.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As she listens to the conversation, she becomes aware that some of the crowd have slowly turned around to take notice of her presence. The hackles on her neck rise as she realizes they are not merely looking at her, but rather at someone right behind her...

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!15.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Approaching the venue, Eidos now sees that the smoke has died down to isolate tendrils emanating from the smoldering ruins of the Archives. A row of guards yet shield the place, barring all unwanted elements from accessing the mound of rubble. Only a few stragglers remain to see the rescue efforts of the Tambulan guard, desperately moving cracked blocks of reddish stone and calling out to those possibly trapped beneath.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!15.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As she attempts to peek past the guards, she sees their focus now lies firmly on her, though somehow seeming to stare right through her to something beyond. The hackles on her neck rise as she realizes they are not merely looking at her, but rather at someone right behind her...

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0099.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly towards her. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.X000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.104!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.105!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!999.106!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.001!DARY!.dialogue_text: "I'm a mythographer from Dazir, now working here in Tambul - you know, famed archive and all."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.002!DARY!.dialogue_text: "You must've come for a similar reason!"

A.response_text: "I didn't realize this place was famous."

B.response_text: "How is this Archive different than any other?"

D.response_text: "What myths do you know about, then?"

E.response_text: "Mythographer? So that's the word for 'someone who wastes of time'."

F.response_text: "I'm writing my own myth: The Legend of Zelba!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.100!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Really?! I had dreamed of studying here ever since I was a little girl!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "I don't know what I would've done had Pakahron denied my application to work in the Scriptorium... might've just jumped off the cliff and into the Valley of Bones, I guess!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1001!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Dazir can stay closed for all I care, because Tambul has far more in the way of tomes - as you can see. And more tomes equals more knowledge!"

A.response_text: "Why is Tambul such a rich source of such information?"

E.response_text: "Have you learned anything useful?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.200!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Dazir is rich in historical records, both written and physical, but my homeland's scholarship is mostly focused on first hand accounts of the days before and immediately after the Great Awakening."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "I, however, gravitate more towards the oral and written traditions that postdate that period - which is where this archive distinguishes itself!"

A.response_text: "Why is Tambul such a rich source of such information?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.300!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Really!? But, Tambul is known as the oldest settlement in Kabu - in fact, it's quite likely that this is the site where Biracul first revealed His divine knowledge to the Kaban tribes..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.3000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Why, it's even possible that some of the records kept here even predate his arrival!"

D.response_text: "Aren't myths unreliable?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.4000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Though, my particular interest is to source the etymology of Tambul's oral tradition with some of the records found in the ruins maintained by Dazir."

D.response_text: "Aren't myths unreliable?"

E.response_text: "Have you learned anything useful?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.500!DARY!.dialogue_text: "I imagine if you're a jinnkissing anti-intellectual, then it probably is!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "But my question to you is, why would someone who chose to walk into an archive to state that study of the past is a waste of time?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5001!DARY!.dialogue_text: "That's a rhetorical question, of course... Oh dear, I don't have to act out what 'rhetorical' means with sock puppets now, do I?"

A.response_text: "Oh, then tell me: what's so great about Tambul?"

D.response_text: "Aren't myths unreliable?"

E.response_text: "Have you ever learned anything that's actually useful?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.600!DARY!.dialogue_text: "So, you are a writer of fictional myths?"

D.response_text: "Aren't all myths fictional?"

E.response_text: "What's it to you?"

F.response_text: "Verily so! The blood of gremlins, my ink; the sword, my quill!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.101!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Well, to start with, Tambul is known as the oldest settlement in Kabu - in fact, it's quite likely that this is the site where Biracul first revealed His divine knowledge to the Kaban tribes..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1010!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Why, it's even possible that some of the records kept here even predate his arrival!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.201!DARY!.dialogue_text: "An excellent question! For does not all learning begin with a question?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2010!DARY!.dialogue_text: "You see, documents and artifacts found in Dazir are ancient in the extreme - as they are what remain of the Vanquished before the Great Awakening. Trying to understand them is often quite difficult - and not just because of the language barrier!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2011!DARY!.dialogue_text: "It seems that even if we assume that the Vanquished were as human as we are, their way of thinking would be exceedingly alien to us!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2012!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Thus, my desired learning outcome is to see if Kaban myths can help bridge the gap between the past and present, between our ancestors and us."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.301!DARY!.dialogue_text: "I do! And I am an expert!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.401!DARY!.dialogue_text: "What backwards land do you hail from, outlander?! Myths are the most true accounts there are!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.4010!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Certainly more true to us than records kept by the Vanquished, at least..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.4011!DARY!.dialogue_text: "In any case, it's likely not possible we mortals could understand truth as it was seen before the Great Awakening."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.501!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Probably nothing that would be of interest to you."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.601!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Well, I hope it won't be necessary to do any 'writing' in here!"

F.response_text: "If you're a gremlin sympathizer, it might be..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.102!DARY!.dialogue_text: "You seem a kindred spirit whose thirst can be only quenched from the cup of knowledge!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1020!DARY!.dialogue_text: "If you have any questions, any at all, about mythological figures or creatures, I'd be happy to share my research with you some time!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X1021!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Until then, walk in the light of knowledge and understanding, friend!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X502!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Well, I had better get back to work... Enjoy the archive, and try not to eat any tomes."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X602!DARY!.dialogue_text: "...I think I had better get back to work."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X900!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Look, some of us have a job to do, so let the adults get back to work now, will you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Oooo! Hello again! Have any questions for me!? Creatures? Artifacts? Events? I should know something about everything!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Did you see the statue at the center of the atrium? The chimera?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1001!DARY!.dialogue_text: "There are a lot of myths about it in local legend!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.X1002!DARY!.dialogue_text: "It's said that the beast was born from the copulation of a dead Jinn and the blood of a thousand unborn children..."

A.response_text: "Do you know about any other creatures?"

B.response_text: "Are there any interesting events you can tell me about?"

C.response_text: "I see. Well, I guess that'll be all for now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1003!DARY!.dialogue_text: "It's said that the beast was born from the copulation of a dead Jinn and the blood of a thousand unborn children..."

A.response_text: "Do you know about any other creatures?"

B.response_text: "Have you ever heard of a wolf named Fenrir?"

C.response_text: "I see. Well, I guess that'll be all for now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.101!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Quite a few more! But I'm awfully busy at the moment, I'm afraid, and should get back to work!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1021!DARY!.dialogue_text: "The only wolf I remember hearing about was from a volume in Dazir... It spoke of many monsters, one of them being a monstrous wolf named G'Mawg, the Ravenous."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1022!DARY!.dialogue_text: "As I recall, it was a fearsome beast that was capable of consuming anything - and specifically had an appetite for other Jinns; though the only Jinn capable of birthing a creature such as this would be the Emerald Architect, likely as not!"

E.response_text: "Why would a Jinn create a Jinn-eater?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1023!DARY!.dialogue_text: "His exploits are never directly documented. So we're only really aware of his existence through tales of interactions with his creations."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.10230!DARY!.dialogue_text: "The only Jinn that is more furtive than him would be Obsidian Jinn, or here in Tambul referred to as 'Melinoe'."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.10231!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Fascinating, really... What else do you want to hear about?"

A.response_text: "Are there any interesting events you can tell me about?"

B.response_text: "I'd like to know something about artifacts."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1024!DARY!.dialogue_text: "The Jinns? Well, we're not sure how many there are, because direct evidence of their existence is scant."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.10240!DARY!.dialogue_text: "We have, however, deduced that there are anywhere from one to seven of them!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.10241!DARY!.dialogue_text: "It may be that it's a single Jinn wearing a multitude of masks or that there are multiple Jinns vying for a single throne."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.10242!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Fascinating, really... What else do you want to hear about?"

A.response_text: "Are there any interesting events you can tell me about?"

B.response_text: "I'd like to know something about artifacts."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.1025!DARY!.dialogue_text: "I know  it sounds strange, but I suppose it's fitting, given the Emerald Architect's penchant for creating unstoppable forces to deal with immovable objects."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.10250!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Fascinating, really... What else do you want to hear about?"

A.response_text: "Are there any interesting events you can tell me about?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.2000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "When Biracul traveled into the Wellspring to release the river that is now borne by the aqueducts, he discovered a great beast at the heart of the mountain: Gulganna!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.2001!DARY!.dialogue_text: "It's very likely that this warbeast was crafted by none other than the great mage-tactician Drago Gulga!"

A.response_text: "Do you know about any other events?"

C.response_text: "I see. Well, I guess that'll be all for now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.201!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Quite a few more! But I'm awfully busy, I'm afraid, and should get back to work..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.3000!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Well, the most famous by far is the ghelblade of Vanargand: Luin."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.X3001!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Wielded by the legendary Archmage Ark, Luin was used to both slay the beast Gurgadon in the Wellspring and to eviscerate that wretched Jinnwraith, Rikharr!"

A.response_text: "Do you know about any other artifacts?"

C.response_text: "I see. Well, I guess that'll be all for now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.3002!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Wielded by the legendary Archmage Ark, Luin was used to both slay the beast Gurgadon in the Wellspring and to eviscerate that wretched Jinnwraith, Rikharr!"

A.response_text: "Do you know about any other artifacts?"

B.response_text: "What else do you know about Luin?"

C.response_text: "I see. Well, I guess that'll be all for now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.301!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Quite a few more! But I'm awfully busy, I'm afraid, and should get back to work."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.3020!DARY!.dialogue_text: "For starters, it's theorized that Rikharr stole it from Ark to slay the Tacribian's Muninn tree - something they have never forgive the Dazirans for!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.3021!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Also, it's said that Luin gave the Archmage protection from the wraithglow in the wastes - though her Valvorthr didn't seem to fair so well, since they exhibited certain signs of... decay... before disappearing without a trace..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.3022!DARY!.dialogue_text: "In any event, I'm awfully busy now, I'm afraid, and should get back to work!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!1.X899!DARY!.dialogue_text: "Oh boy, do I love talking about this! Let's hope Biracul allows us to meet again!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X000!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls... Dary was always such a kind girl..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.001!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "Jinns take you, Kagin! Hold your tongue!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X0010!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "These were our friends and now they must wander the Graylands unguided!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.002!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "The world is chaotic; I mean, even that jinnstruck 'Prophet' made more sense than this tragedy does!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X0021!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: ...If Biracul truly watched over us, why would he let this happen?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.003!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "By that logic, maybe it's not Biracul's will..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0030!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "Maybe he's the heart to something else... something 'greater'..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0040!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "I'm just confused about the whole jinnkissing mess, y'know?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0041!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "First, the crisis with Wellspring and now this!?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.005!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "I think I'll just take a walk to clear my head up."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0050!ISMAT!.dialogue_text: "Give my regards to your family, young'n; I'll see you tomorrow."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X000!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "...and she took my shift so that I could go home and play with my kids!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X001!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "...I feel like a jinnlover for saying this, but I'm glad it wasn't me in there..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.002!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "I know it's a sin against Biracul to even think it, Ismat! But..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0020!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "I'm just so happy I get to go home and see my family tonight."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X0021!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "If I had gone to my shift in the Scriptorium, I would be the one wandering the Graylands... and my family would've ended up like ol' Cultivator Zebh's!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.003!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's will is beyond us, my friend... just like our will is beyond the heart that pumps our life-blood."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X0030!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "All we can do is trust in his plan."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X0040!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "...Take care you don't fall into the Jinns' embrace..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.005!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "Maybe you should go to the Temple to pray for guidance."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0050!KAGIN!.dialogue_text: "And I'll go home to my family and give thanks to Biracul for allowing me to be with them for a bit longer."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Hello, traveler. I'm Kaleki, Librarian of Tambul."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "How may I be of service to you?"

D.response_text: "I'm a friend of your master's..."

E.response_text: "Tell me something useful."

F.response_text: "I'll have the lunch special and apple pie for dessert."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.002!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "How may I be of service to you?"

B.response_text: "I was sent here by Pakahron to ask about my condition."

D.response_text: "I'm a friend of your master's..."

E.response_text: "Tell me something useful."

F.response_text: "I'll have the lunch special and apple pie for dessert."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.100!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "As a Librarian, it is my task to maintain the records of the township. I am likewise bound to study in the Ars Techne under the mage-leader of Tambul. Upon his death or retirement, I will take up the charge and appoint a new Librarian."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Does this account of my function suffice?"

E.response_text: "What secrets are you harboring here?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.200!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Ah, yes, about the memory issue, right?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Well, your case is without precedent, honestly. Obviously, humans are born bereft of memories as infants, but the general consensus is that it's because there were none there to begin with."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "You being born as an adult with no memories, well this is only seen among the Neverborn."

C.response_text: "Well, I guess I'll be leaving then."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2002!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry I couldn't be of more help."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.20020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Would you like to ask anything else?"

B.response_text: "Yes, I'd like to ask some more questions."

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2003!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Neverborn are Vanquished automata used for different tasks, ranging from protection to manipulation of dangerous physical objects - think of it as a soul-less being."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.20030!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "You clearly have a soul, so we can assume you're not a Neverborn. But, not even the Emerald Architect himself was capable of creating a homunculus, let alone a human - that's still firmly in the realm of fantasy."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.20031!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Consequently, I have no clue as to 'what' you are..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X300!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Come back if you have need of information."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.4000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "I thought you were a newcomer to this town; I must have been mistaken..."

B.response_text: "Explain the nature of this place to me."

D.response_text: "Indeed you were... You are to give me access to ALL of your records."

E.response_text: "What secrets are you harboring here?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.500!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "This library is home to a variety of information. I am uncertain what would be... 'useful'... to you."

D.response_text: "Pakahron said you are to give me access to ALL of your records."

E.response_text: "What secrets are you harboring here?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.600!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "This library is home to generations of records, meticulously copied and kept. We do not have, nor do we serve pie."

D.response_text: "Yes, of course! Pakahron said you are to give me access to ALL of your records."

E.response_text: "Oh? Then what secrets are you harboring here?"

F.response_text: "Oh. Well, do you at least have a recipe for apple pie?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.101!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "We do this to remember the words and directives of our ancestors. And as such, this library is our collective memory."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1010!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "It is through revealed knowledge that our people mastered the arts of hydroculture - just as the Dazirans learned of craft and Tacribians became proficient gatherer-scouts."

B.response_text: "I had heard the the Tacribians were warriors, not scouts."

E.response_text: "And why should you trust these records are factual?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.201!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Long ago, the Vanquished kept records within red crystals. We do not have the knowledge to solidify thoughts in this way, but we have inherited other means."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2010!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Through white crystals, the Muninn Prisms, we can shape the growth of the Muninn Trees. Etched into the very fibers of these plants is the wisdom of countless tomes."

B.response_text: "So I must rely on you for access to information?"

D.response_text: "Why do you work to store this information?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.401!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "You imply that I would hide things from you. That is not the function of a place such as this."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.4010!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "My purpose is to make the information contained within these Muninn Trees intelligible to you, not to conceal it."

B.response_text: "So I must rely on you for access to information?"

D.response_text: "What do you hope to gain by disseminating information?"

E.response_text: "And why should you trust these records are factual?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.501!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "There are no secrets here. This is an Archives, and as such, its function is to preserve information, not conceal it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5010!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "All knowledge herein is freely given, to the ."

D.response_text: "What do you hope to gain by disseminating information?"

E.response_text: "And why should you trust this knowledge is factual?"

F.response_text: "And what do you hope to gain by disseminating such information?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.102!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Biracul instructed us in the ways of civilization at the founding. It was he that trained the first mage-leaders in the ways of the Ars Techne and the Path of Awareness."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "You seem to have lots of questions, friend. Would you care to learn about something else?"

B.response_text: "Yes, I'm eager to learn all I can."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.202!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Naturally. The operation of the Muninn Prisms to both shape and decipher the data is a skill that can only be achieved by one skilled in the Ars Techne."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "In other words, a mage or Librarian that follows the Path of Awareness, described by the venerable Biracul of old."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2022!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "This is true in the present day. But we keepers of memory know that this was not always their function."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.20220!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "They took on their current mantle once the it became necessary to construct and man the Dawn Fortress for the protection of greater Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.402!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "An educated society benefits all who partake in it. By knowing of the past events that have shaped us all, we can apprehend that we are all one folk, with a unified purpose: the preservation and prosperity of human life."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.4020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "But enough pontification, would you care to ask about anything else?"

B.response_text: "Who is taught you all of this?"

D.response_text: "I wish to learn how to read these trees myself."

E.response_text: "Yes, is the knowledge you peddle even trustworthy?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.502!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "And where does such radical skepticism lead?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "We humans are limited in life span and awareness."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5021!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "If we do not trust in the accounts of our ancestors, if we choose to believe the world before our own eyes, what do we gain?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5022!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "If we choose to reinvent the wheel each generation, how do we progress?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.5023!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "As Biracul said: 'A city is built by the hands of the living and the dead. Be honorable to your ancestors, fair to your neighbors, and generous to those yet to come'."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X5024!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "But, I feel I should get back to work now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.602!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "What?! You were the one asking about pie!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.6020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: I don't even care about any of this!"

F.response_text: "If you don't, then why are you shouting? Ha! ParadoX, with a capital X!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.6021!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Paradox doesn't begin with... Oh, never mind!"

F.response_text: "No, you aren't!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "If it is knowledge you seek, then you have come to the right place."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "But there is a great depth and wide breadth to the records of the Muninn trees. What manner of information would be useful to you?"

D.response_text: "I wish to know of Techne."

E.response_text: "How can I become more powerful?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.100!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Then let me tell you about Rikharr, the Jinnwraith."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.1000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "He was a megalomaniac mage from Dazir who was a master of Techne - though his skills were ill-gotten."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.1001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Well, as the story goes, it got to the point where they had to remove him from his duties... Shall I continue?"

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.1002!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Excellent! Well, as you can imagine, not many were up to the task, until his Librarian, Ark, found Luin in the Wellspring. She cast Rikharr out into the Wasteland and unified the tribes, becoming the first Archmage."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.10020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "But Rikharr came back - with an army of draugnir in tow. Rikharr destroyed the golden Sun Keep, and took Ark to the Graylands with him when they fell into the Crescent Canyon."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.10021!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Amazing, wouldn't you say? Want to ask any more questions?"

B.response_text: "Yes, tell me something about Techne, please."

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.200!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Hmm, then maybe you'll be interested in our founding."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "The legendary heathen mage of Thiuda, Wulfias, led an army of Neverborn and magi to this region to do battle with the Ataraxia, our ancestors. Though our enemy, he was a respected commander."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Rumor has it he was looking for something important in Kabu and ended up in the Wellspring... Shall I continue?"

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2002!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Excellent! Where was I? Oh yes, looking for something."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2003!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "No one knows what he sought, but with someone as high profile as Wulfias, it must have held great significance..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2004!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "When he holed up in the Wellspring, he apparently mastered the Vanquished technology within - some even say it was he who left Luin there, though these claims are unsubstantiated."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2005!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "In any case, after entering the Wellspring, a horde of nomads from the southern lands laid siege to the sacred site and essentially starved Wulfias to death."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2006!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "An unfitting end for such an epic character, I say."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.2007!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "So, would you like to learn about anything else?"

B.response_text: "Yes, I wish to know of Techne."

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.300!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Well, then, I suppose that will do for today; it's time I returned to my duties of overseeing the copyists."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.3000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Please do look around the Archives and around Tambul itself. This place is rich in history, if you know where to look."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.4000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Well, the basics are that there are Readers and Writers - the latter being unheard of since the Great Awakening."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.4001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Readers are plentiful and all but the Unseen can learn to read Glyphs. The only catch is that it sometimes takes decades to learn to read a single Glyph... Shall I proceed?"

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.4003!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "You see, the difficulty of acquisition means that magi typically specialize in only a handful of Glyphs. But in learning a Glyph, one's mind is altered, irreversibly!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.4004!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Upon death, crystals emanate from a mage's body containing one or more of their Glyphs. Thus, when Pakahron passes on to the Graylands, I'll inherit at least one of his Glyphs, just as he inherited some of his Glyphs from his predecessor."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.4005!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "The Glyphs themselves are ultimately what enable Techne usage - Techne being the expression of the Glyph that allows us to achieve effects both constructive and destructive."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.4006!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Amazing, wouldn't you say? This is why I became a Librarian!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!2.500!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Practice is the only way to get better at anything. Now is there some other question you would like to ask?"

C.response_text: "No, thanks. I'll be on my way."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!3.X001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "I'm busy overseeing the Scriptorium copyists at the moment, but you're welcome to look around the Archives."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!3.002!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Look, outlander, like I said: I am quite busy."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!3.X0020!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "So, please, in the name of Ark, leave me to my work!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!5.X001!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Why don't you go look at the Gate of Celestial Judgment? It's said that walking through it brings good luck..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!6.X000!KALEKI!.dialogue_text: "Please, don't bother me again. I beg of you."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Most audacious indeed, returning to the scene of your crime..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Or perhaps you merely wished to ensure your task was complete?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.X0001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'll give you the opportunity to explain your intent for this destruction before your end - perhaps it will give you absolution in the Eye of Biracul."

A.response_text: "I didn't know the crystal would explode, Pakahron!"

B.response_text: "I'm sometimes overcome by odd, destructive impulses."

D.response_text: "...I'm insulted by this accusation!"

E.response_text: "I am beyond even death! You're a fool if you think I fear you."

F.response_text: "Roostor caws in mysterious ways."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.0002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'll give you the opportunity to explain your intent for this destruction before your end - perhaps it will give you absolution in the Eye of Biracul."

A.response_text: "I didn't think the crystal would kill anyone, Pakahron!"

B.response_text: "I'm sometimes overcome by odd, destructive impulses."

D.response_text: "...How was I to know that breaking a crystal would be destructive!?"

E.response_text: "I am beyond even death! You're a fool if you think I fear you."

F.response_text: "Roostor caws in mysterious ways."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.100!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Then I fell prey to mere chaos? To the whims of chance..?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "No, Melinoe's hand did not move yours, jinnspawn!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Whatever Jinns sent you to commit this act, you are about to join them in the Graylands."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Save your apologies for the innocent Tambulans you murdered!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.1003!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You'll soon have the opportunity to meet them, jinnspawn..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Carving out destruction like the Amethyst Jinn on merely a whim?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.2001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "By the time I'm finished, there will be no body of yours left to bury, jinnspawn!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.300!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Well, I intend to take your life as payment - though it's worth even less than the sand on which my Archives were built."

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.400!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "What, do you fancy yourself the Ruby Jinn?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ARCHIVES!0.500!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Then I will simply have to kill you an infinite number of times, jinnspawn."

F.response_text: "Whoa, bro, chill... Are we done here? Can I leave now?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
The heavy wood grates against the desert sand as the gates to Tambul close. Before Eidos is a large courtyard bustling with activity. Contrary to what the towering walls and mighty gates suggest, though, there is a scant and ill-equipped military presence.

		For the most part, the life of the townsfolk dominates the environs. Market merchants peddle wares; men pull carts transporting foodstuffs; women haul buckets of water and sacks of soil; children play, running about with great frivolity; older folk engage in lively conversation; and at the epicenter of all activity is a large, marble sculpture - some depiction of an unnamed hero slaying an unusual beast.

		Many within proximity to the gates take notice of Eidos. Some pretend to go about their business while cautiously drawing nearer to regard her, but none approach overtly. One of them in particular, a youthful, red-headed girl, stands staring for a moment, only to then run off down the street with great urgency.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Wishing to make a hasty retreat from this town, Eidos directs her feet toward the gates. Suddenly, an elderly man calls out to her, waddling towards her from the marble statue. Two spearsman respond to the old man's summons by stretching their spears out to form an X in front of her.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Standing near the gates of Tambul, there are few people who seem inclined to speak. The only approachable people are a soft-looking guard and an overly-friendly water vendor.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X200!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As she walks deeper into the township, Eidos attracts the attention of many a passerby. She strides down the street through a cloud of speculative whispers and inquiring gazes. Nearing the marble sculpture, it becomes clear that it is a fountain, jets of water both misting and bubbling from underneath.\n\n\t\tSuddenly, an elderly man calls out to her, as he waddles towards her.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.X000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the dusty Tambulan Atrium, just inside the gates. Some passersby give her a nod of welcome, though most seem content to politely ignore her presence. The smell of spices hangs thick in the air as goods are bartered and traded. The sound of voices raised in both labor and leisure is all but deafening. All about, folk can be seen engaged in the rush and activity of life.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.X001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the Tambul Atrium just inside the gates. Having been denied access to the township she has but two options: talk to one of the nearby citizens or simply leave.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The guards escort Eidos to the gates, signaling to their attendants with a nod to open them. The heavy wooden doors grind the sand beneath to even finer powder, revealing a blistering hellscape of flat, cracked earth, dusted in sparkling grains of sand beyond them. Eidos looks back once more into the Atrium. While many of the folk cast a mix of furtive, fearful and curious looks in her direction, there is one visage that is a mask of passionless intensity: Pakahron's piercing stare burns into her eyes like smoldering coals. In the sea of meek faces, he stands as a man alone.\n\n\t\tPassing through the gates, they immediately groan shut behind her.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: At a mere nod from the guard, the gate attendants take to their treadmills. Walking within large metal wheels, they drive a mechanism that winches the gates open. The heavy wooden doors grind the sand beneath to even finer powder, revealing a blistering hellscape of flat, cracked earth, dusted in sparkling grains of sand beyond them. The doors, thus open, give Eidos a clear path for her departure.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.X100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Standing near the gates of Tambul, there are few people who seem inclined to speak. The only approachable people are a soft-looking guard and an overly-friendly water vendor.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.101!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Standing near the gates of Tambul, there are few people who seem inclined to speak. The only approachable people are a soft-looking guard and an overly-friendly water vendor.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.X200!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: A large statue perched upon a fountain dominates the center of the Atrium. Eidos instantly gravitates towards the cool mist rising from jets of water spraying at its feet, hoping to offset the effects of the relentless sun. Upon closer inspection, what looked to be a statue of marble turns out to be some kind of metallic one instead - iron or steel, but white in hue. Remarkably, it lacks any sign of corrosion, despite its proximity to water. The metal bends and twists, depicting an armored hero locked in the throes of battle with a fantastical creature - some strange fusion of serpent, lion, and bird, and other unfamiliar creatures.\n\n\t\tThis statue seems to serve as a gathering place and most people around here seem engaged in lively conversation. However, a good number seem to merely be countering the midday heat with the fountain's misty coolness.

C.response_text: Go toward the Temple and the Residence District

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.X211!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: There are a great number of people milling about this area, most notably Pakahron, who can be seen engaging his folk in conversation. Eidos then chooses to speak with...

A.response_text: The old man with a bushy white beard, sitting near the fountain

B.response_text: The young girl with red hair

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!11.X221!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: There are a great number of people milling about this area. However, Pakahron is now notably absent. Eidos then chooses to speak with...

A.response_text: The old man with a bushy white beard, sitting near the fountain

B.response_text: The young girl with red hair

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!50.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the dusty Tambulan Atrium, just inside the gates. Some passersby give her a nod of welcome, though most seem content to politely ignore her presence. The smell of spices hangs thick in the air as goods are bartered and traded. The sound of voices raised in both labor and leisure is all but deafening. All about, folk can be seen engaged in the rush and activity of life.\n\n\t\tPerhaps mast jarring, however, is the slow-rising column of dust and smoke rising from where the Archive once stood.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0099.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Pakahron waddles gracelessly towards Eidos. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!100.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The voices and activity of the Atrium are suddenly silenced and eyes all around are trained upon Eidos.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!100.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The quiet is suddenly broken by shouts of outrage, fear and aggression.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!100.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As though summoned by an unheard call, the crowd of denizens advances upon her and before she can defend herself, she is seized from all around by their clutching hands.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!100.003!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Their faces a twisted mixture of fear and anger, the folk of Tambul easily subdue Eidos. Lifted from the ground, there is nothing she can do as they bear her from the Atrium directly toward the Silver Spire of the township.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.X000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.100!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.101!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.102!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.103!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.104!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.105!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!999.106!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You know what? I think you and this statue have something in common!"

A.response_text: "Oh yeah? What would that be, friend?"

D.response_text: "I doubt that."

E.response_text: "We're both indifferent to you?"

F.response_text: "Yep. We're both hard as a rock and weigh less than you'd think."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, I'm sure most in Kabu are baffled by your appearance - perhaps even the ol' mage-leader himself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But you clearly have the look of a Thiudan to me, and I'm pretty much the authority on ethnicity - if I may be so bold."

A.response_text: "How is it you know these things?"

D.response_text: "...How perceptive. Perhaps you could share more of your wisdom with me."

E.response_text: "I'm just baffled no one has drowned you in the fountain yet."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You see, I believe that both you and the fountain are from Thiuda!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.300!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Indeed, I do! I say you are both from Thiuda, are you not?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.400!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "We shall see! It's that you are both from Thiuda!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.500!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Hardly! But good guess, you little rascal!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "No, in truth, it's that you are both from Thiuda - beyond a shadow of a doubt!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "I mean, you clearly have the look of a Thiudan, and from the sharpness of your tongue, I'm just about certain!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.600!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Close! But I think it's that you're both from Thiuda!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "I'm sure most in Kabu are baffled by your appearance - perhaps even our ol' mage!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But you clearly have the look of a Thiudan to me, and I'm pretty much the authority on ethnicity - if I may be so bold."

F.response_text: "Actually, I come from a land down under."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.101!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Why it's well known! That is, at least, for those with the talent of knowing!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1010!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Thiuda is a land far to the North, beyond Jer and beyond even the Blade Mountains. There's even a lot of evidence of their artifacts here in Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1011!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "It follows, then, that there must have been numerous trade routes when the folk of Kabu were stronger, and not merely degenerate, as we are now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1012!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that be something? To see folk of the Northlands in the desert plains, just as common as migrating birds!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2011!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Thiuda is a land far to the North, beyond Jer and beyond even the Blade Mountains. There's even a lot of evidence of their artifacts here in Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2012!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "It follows, then, that there must have been numerous trade routes when the folk of Kabu were stronger, and not merely degenerate, as we are now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2013!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that be something? To see folk of the Northlands in the desert plains, just as common as migrating birds!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.3010!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Despite the remoteness of your homeland, there's certainly plenty of evidence of your people's artifacts here in Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.3011!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "It follows, then, that there must have been numerous trade routes when the folk of Kabu were stronger, and not merely degenerate, as we are now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.3012!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that be something? To see folk of the Northlands in the desert plains, just as common as migrating birds!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.401!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, it would honor me to educate a Thiudan!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4010!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Let's see... Ah yes! Despite the remoteness of your homeland, there's a lot of evidence of your people's artifacts here in Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4011!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "It follows, then, that there must have been numerous trade routes when the folk of Kabu were stronger, and not merely degenerate, as we are now."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4012!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that be something? To see folk of the Northlands in the desert plains, just as common as migrating birds!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.501!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Well, I knew your people had a reputation for being as cold as the land you hail from, but it seems the Thiudan fields are filled with sour plums and bitter melons!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5010!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But not to worry! I take no offense."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X5011!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "'Thra mis Skesir, Dyes mis dawk!', brave Thiudan!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.601!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Well, I knew your people had a reputation for being as enigmatic as the North Wind, but you've far exceeded my expectations!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X899!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Hail, brave Thiudan! 'Thra mis Skesir, Dyes mis dawk!'"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You return! Many are those foolish folk who doubt the endless bravery of the Thiudan heart, but they've traveled in neither step nor mind as I have!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "I knew you would come back to us!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.002!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "What further act of rage shall we witness?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.003!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Or have you merely arrived to see our reaction to the destruction of the Archives..?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.004!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "For even the most savage artist must have an audience, no?"

C.response_text: "Neither bravery nor rage have anything to do with it."

D.response_text: "...I don't know what you're talking about!"

E.response_text: "Is this some kind of threat!?"

F.response_text: "Few appreciate my art! My purity of expression in freestyle disco!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "And that's why you Thiudans are the greatest artists of all!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Unsullied by the burden of the mind, your nature is to destroy! To divide and conquer is your curse for jinnworship!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1002!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But I say to you, is not Biracul's gift of civility a curse as well?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1004!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You, incapable of understanding the artistry of your life; and me, incapable of being anything more than an appreciator thereof!"

A.response_text: "How can you praise an attack on your people?"

E.response_text: "I'm also capable of working my craft on blabbermouth old men..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "For art is life! And the artistic life is to live in accordance with one's nature. To express it with fiery passion, no?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "And that's why you Thiudans are the greatest artists of all! Unsullied by the burden of the mind!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2002!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Of course I have to praise Biracul for the gift of civility, but what a pair we make, no?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2003!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You, incapable of understanding the artistry of your life; and me, incapable of being anything more than an appreciator thereof!"

A.response_text: "How can you praise an attack on your people?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.300!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Of course! I merely put my own Kaban spin on it!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Even for a Tacribian, it would take blind rage or a jinncrazed mind to do what you accomplished without emotion or intellect!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "And that is why you Thiudans are the greatest artists of all!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3002!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Unsullied by the burden of the mind, your nature is to destroy; to divide and conquer is your curse for jinnworship."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3003!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But I say to you, is not Biracul's gift of civility a curse as well?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3004!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Cast me into the Valley! What a pair we make, no?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3005!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You, incapable of understanding the artistry of your life; and me, incapable of being anything more than an appreciator thereof."

D.response_text: "...I am not Thiudan and this was not my doing."

E.response_text: "I'm also capable of working my craft on blabbermouth old men..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.5000!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "I'm congratulating you on your aesthetic accomplishments! For who knows where this piece of yours will take our minds!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.5001!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Kaleki was a stolid bore and her Archive was filled with dead knowledge!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.5002!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But your actions have breathed fiery life back into our thoughts!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.101!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Ah! Well, that is our special capacity, as children of the First Settlement."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1010!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "You see, Biracul knew we needed the minds and perspectives of all folk; for all human expression is valid - even that of death."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1011!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Kaleki may have been a stolid bore in life, but you gave her a dazzling death, making her corpse a fragile charcoal sculpture!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1012!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Though, as a patron of the arts, I must warn you about returning to the Archive..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1013!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Pakahron is dull, as magi go, but even he can see the mark of a Thiudan artist. So, if he sees you there, you may have a fight on your hands!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.X1014!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "But then again, perhaps he can be your next canvas!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.201!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Isn't it clear? It's simply because I am the most learned man in all of Kabu! For I, above all, understand what lies beyond our narrow Kaban thought!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2010!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Biracul knew full well that we needed the minds and perspectives of all folk. Thus, it follows that all human expression is valid, even that of death."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.301!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, do not worry! I have no intention of thwarting you, Mistress of Thiuda!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.601!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Yes! I, above all, understand what lies beyond our narrow Kaban minds and can see the beauty in your works."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.X899!ABLAH!.dialogue_text: "Hail, brave Thiudan! 'Thra mis Skesir, Dyes mis dawk!'"

B.response_text: "Why did you run away when I entered Tambul?"

D.response_text: "So, are you Pakahron's little informant?"

E.response_text: "Did you tell your master I'm a dangerous foreigner?"

F.response_text: "I'm new here. Is this how you greet people?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.100!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "My name's Arghavan - not that it's any of your jinnlickin' business..."

A.response_text: "I thought I saw you run away to herald my arrival."

B.response_text: "You seem to be a surly child."

E.response_text: "It is now. Spy on me again and I'll cut out your tongue."

A.response_text: "I thought I saw you run away to herald my arrival."

B.response_text: "You seem to be a surly child."

D.response_text: "What other things have you reported to Pakahron?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4000!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "We're all his ears and eyes, everyone one of us!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4001!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "So go jump into the Valley, you draug-brained foreigner!"

B.response_text: "You seem to be a surly child."

D.response_text: "What other things have you reported to Pakahron?"

E.response_text: "Spy on me again and I'll cut out your tongue."

D.response_text: "What other things have you reported to Pakahron?"

E.response_text: "Spy on me again and I'll cut out your tongue."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6000!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "I hope you get tossed into the Valley!"

E.response_text: "Spy on me again and I'll cut out your tongue."

F.response_text: "Ok, let me try: 'Eat pig filth, you cretin!' How's that?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X101!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "If I did, I certainly wouldn't be telling you about it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X301!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "Good! I didn't want to talk to you anyway!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.401!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "If you keep bothering me, I'll tell Pakahron you're causing trouble!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X4010!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "So just go jump into the Valley by yourself, jinnlicker!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.501!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "Then do something about it! Kill me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5010!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "See? You're as useless as a dead crystal! You spineless coward!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X5011!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "I hope the Ruby Jinn rapes you!"

B.response_text: "I'd like to talk about what happened to your family."

D.response_text: "...I could help you, Arghavan, if you tell me about your family."

E.response_text: "So, your family's blood yet stains your hair after murdering them."

F.response_text: "You must like frogs, since your whole family croaked!"

A.response_text: "Then, at least tell me how can I help you."

E.response_text: "That's not up to you, child! Now tell me who did it."

A.response_text: "Then, at least tell me how can I help you."

C.response_text: "Then, you're on your own, I guess."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.X300!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "Then scram, jinnlicker and don't waste my time!"

C.response_text: "Then, you're on your own, I guess."

D.response_text: "Oh, dear child! You're not to blame! Is Pakahron hurting you..?"

E.response_text: "That's not up to you, child! Now tell me who did it."

A.response_text: "That's not for you to decide! Now tell me why did it!"

D.response_text: "But you weren't alone in killing them; a mage was involved, right?"

E.response_text: "Convenient you're the sole survivor, isn't it?"

F.response_text: "I thought kids loved jokes?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.X101!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "Please... just. He... My father... I can't!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.X000!ARGHAVAN!.dialogue_text: "Please... it's just.. He... My father... I can't!"

A.response_text: "Have there been any threats to your township as of late?"

D.response_text: "I've journeyed far. I would speak with your master."

E.response_text: "Why are you so clearly disinterested in protecting this place?"

A.response_text: "Have there been any threats to your township as of late?"

D.response_text: "Greetings, soldier! Care to answer a few questions for me?"

E.response_text: "Why are you so clearly disinterested in protecting this place?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.100!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Apologies, stranger, but protocol strictly prevents me from chatting with you."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.200!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Tambul. You can talk to Pakahron for more information."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X400!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Our mage-leader is further in the atrium near the fountain; he'll no doubt seek to speak with you."

A.response_text: "Why did you let me enter without asking who I was?"

D.response_text: "Al I meant was that you seem ill-prepared for defense..."

E.response_text: "I don't excuse weakness; I destroy it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.101!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "It's Biraculian custom to welcome all who come seeking food, water or friends; acceptance is part of the Path of Awareness."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X1010!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Now go about your business in the light of the Shining One, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.401!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you should discuss battle plans with our mage-leader; I'm sure he'd be interested in listening to the sage strategic advice of a vagrant fresh from nowhere..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X4010!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "He's at the center of the atrium further on."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.501!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Keep talking like that and you might just find yourself on the wrong end of our weak spears..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X5010!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Now go about your business, stranger; you're disrupting my duties."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X896!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry, lady, but protocol states no fraternizing while on duty."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.898!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Look, Pakahron typically abides at the heart of the atrium near the fountain."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X8980!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "And if you're not looking for him, then talk to someone else who isn't working..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X899!BAHADUR!.dialogue_text: "Was I not clear? I am not permitted to speak to you. Go about your business."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Hello there, stranger! Care for a drink? It can be thirsty work travelin' the desert alone!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.0000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "It's not got the kick of a good Jinn-Liquor, but water'll get the job done!"

D.response_text: "...And how much would this cost?"

E.response_text: "What would a mere water peddler know about traveling the desert?"

F.response_text: "Indeed! 'The Hero of Tomorrow' must first stay hydrated today!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.100!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "You know, stranger, here in Kabu an outsider is rarer than a kind-hearted Jinn..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Not that we aren't welcomin' of foreign folk, mind you! It's just hard to get here!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "And besides, the only thing you'll find here is boredom and sand!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Really difficult for a curious one such as myself to live in this place where not much happens."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1003!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Say, you wouldn't happen to have any news from... well, anywhere but Tambul at least! Perhaps we can exchange information..."

B.response_text: "Actually, I'm more interested in history than current events."

E.response_text: "No, but you'll tell me everything I want to know anyway."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.200!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Water's plentiful here, all thanks to the aqueduct! Flowin' in from the Wellspring up in the Duskfangs - though, you'd have a hard time seein' it now, since Khaa's closed the gates and all."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "We've had fewer visits from our neighbors even as of late. Y'know, due to the recent troubles..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But enough about us, maybe you carry some brighter news from... well, anywhere but Tambul, hopefully!"

B.response_text: "Actually, I'm more interested in history than current events."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.300!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Not thirsty after crossin' the Jenowin Plain?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.3001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you'd be more thirsty for some... information?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.3002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "If you've any news to tell, I'd be happy to make a trade..."

B.response_text: "Actually, I'm more interested in history than current events."

D.response_text: "I suppose that depends on how good your news is..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! By Biracul's beard, you must be as confused as those travelin' folk from years back! Came in a big floatin' contraption, filled with hot air, they said - pretty sure it was just some jinnlickin' Vanquished trickery, though! Pardon my language."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, in any case, they couldn't believe we had no gold, or coins, or whatever it was they wanted to trade for their trinkets. Good folk, they were, deep down. But savages, ignorant of the Path of Awareness nonetheless. No offense."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But in brief, we told 'em we could give some food and shelter in exchange for good company, but that's about all. Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4003!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Though, me personally, I was more interested in news from whatever corner of the world they came from than their company - always have been one to keep up to date!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4004!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Say, if you've heard some whispers from beyond these walls, I'd be interested in hearin' them - even willin' to respond in kind..."

D.response_text: "I suppose that depends on how interesting your 'whispers' are..."

E.response_text: "You will tell me what you know, now!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.500!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Quite a lot actually, seein' as how I assisted Torma the Venturer on some of his travels through Kabu..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, I've got tales to tell of every land - even those far beyond the Jenowin Plain!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps I could tell you of it, if you didn't mind givin' me some news of your travels in return..."

A.response_text: "I'll share what I know with you."

D.response_text: "Depends entirely on how good your information is..."

E.response_text: "How about I pay you back in pain instead?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.600!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, you fancy yourself a hero, eh?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I'd be most interested in hearin' what you've seen out there - I'm a bit of an aspirin' loremaster myself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Tell me about your exploits and I'll repay you in kind!"

F.response_text: "Oh, I've got plenty of news..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.101!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Fantastic! Then as a sign of good faith here's somethin' few yet know..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Logira is unhappy with Khlutt's war-mongerin', and is plannin' on challengin' him for leadership of the Tacribian League!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Mark my words! Someday soon, blood'll run on the stones of the Dawn Fortress!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1012!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Fantastic! Then as a sign of good faith here's somethin' few yet realize..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1013!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Ol' Famlaz features prominently in tales from the past, but I think the Ruby Jinn has been hauntin' the Jenowin Plain since even before the Great Awakenin'!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1014!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I'll tell you this much, the ruins of Old Tacriba out on the edge of the Jenowin used to be bustlin' with activity, but were abandoned right around the time a rust-colored foreign mage came and killed their Muninn."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1015!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "And now a foreign mage named Mifas'cul has shown up in Kabu, dressed in a blood-colored cloak. Been talkin' to mage Pakahron and Khaa from Dazir..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.201!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, I've got you covered there, too!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I know more of this land's history and lore than any livin' soul - havin' explored many ruins with the legendary Torma himself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "What do you say to an exchange of information?"

B.response_text: "Alright, I'll tell you what I know."

D.response_text: "Well, that depends entirely on how good you information is..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.301!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Hmmm! As silent as Melinoe herself, eh?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X3010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well that's fine, I s'pose. But do come back if you change your mind, kid!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.401!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Hmmm! Well, beggars can't be choosers can they? Alright, here's somethin' few yet know..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.501!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Ah! In that case let me tell you news of my friend, the Beast Lord of the Crescent Canyon!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Everyone knows he's a blood-thirsty savage, walkin' in the skin of a desert wolf by night and the guise of a man by day..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But accordin' to the latest rumors, he's now wearin' the skin of the last person who threatened me..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X5013!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Now, if you'll excuse me, I've got some water to attend to!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.601!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Really? Then go on! Share it with me!"

F.response_text: "I'm winning the war on gremlins, one bloody battle at a time..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6020!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, your story certainly is interestin', and I'd be a ruby-tongued liar if I didn't share somethin' equally useful with you!"

F.response_text: "Don't stick your tongue in weird places! I learned that the hard way..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6021!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I didn't sti... Well, anyways, rumor has it, Biracul has finally returned!"

F.response_text: "Could've just been me in a different book."
