KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6022!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Right... uh, well, he's said to walk among us in secret - in the guise of a chicken no less! His form cloaked from all but the ones who've walked the Path of Awareness to its furthest reaches..."

F.response_text: "Oh, you mean Roostor?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.603!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Ha ha! Biracul's beard, can you stay in character or what! Probably the best actress I've ever seen!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6030!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I think you've got a little bit of the Rubied Jinn in you - just make sure you don't let it go too far, kid!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6031!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Biggest problem, though, is that your foreign 'jocularity' will fall on deaf ears here in Kabu... bunch of backwards draug-brains with sticks up their arses, this lot - myself bein' the rare exception!"

F.response_text: "Are these sticks free? I'm asking for a friend..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X6032!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Ha! Good one! Anyway, it was nice chattin' with you, but perhaps you'd like to talk to that guard over there?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.890!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Water! Water! Fresh from the Wellspring! Come drink the tears of the Heathen!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.891!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, you're back! Any news from you, stranger?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.892!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Now if you'll excuse me, I need to go tell Pakahron about that jinnstruck Tacribian's plans!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.8920!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Maybe we'll exchange more news in the future!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.894!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Greetings! I hope you've learned some more 'reliable' news in your travels."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.8940!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But by Biracul's beard, I'd love to chat, though seems I'm busier than a rooster in a henhouse!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.895!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, you've returned! Richer in humility, I hope..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X8950!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But by Biracul's beard, though I'd love to chat, seems I'm busier than a Suyuti in a goat pen!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.899!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, you're back! Change your mind, did you?"

B.response_text: "Actually, I'd just like to ask something about your town."

D.response_text: "Maybe, but only if your information is any good..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.X000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, tell me, been to the Dawn Fortress yet?"

D.response_text: "...Yes, I have."

E.response_text: "Why do you ask?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.0000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, tell me, you been to the Dawn Fortress lately?"

D.response_text: "Why do you ask?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "A pity. I'd dance with a Jinn to know more of Khlutt's plans..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "It's the settlement across the Crescent Canyon, past the Moon Tower over yonder."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.0020!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Though I'm afraid it's somewhat of a one-way trip these days, given current tensions."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.0041!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Y'know, it's almost as if they weren't even worried about dyin' of thirst or somethin'..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.005!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, what happens there in the next few days will sculpt the future of Kabu itself. Either they succeed and Dazir falls or the other way around..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.100!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Seriously?! It's a wonder you even made it back here - quite the adventure that must've been!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "What news of Khlutt and his people?!"

D.response_text: "...Khlutt plans not only to raze Dazir, but Tambul as well!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.101!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "You don't say... I take it you refused to help! Gotta thank you for your prudence, stranger!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.401!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, screw me sideways with a toothpick! Pardon the language. I really gotta go tell our mage!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.4010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But first, lemme share somethin' with you - so you don't think me a ruby-tongued deceiver!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.102!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Dazir's Librarian was seen wanderin' the Valley of Bones a few days ago, but hasn't been seen since... and given how that place is about as welcomin' of people as a Daziran is of criticism, next he's seen, he'll probably be fit to join the Bone Pile..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1020!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Dazir's Librarian was seen wanderin' the Valley of Bones a few days ago, but hasn't been seen since... and given how that place is about as welcomin' of people as a Daziran is of criticism, next he's seen, he'll probably be fit to join the Bone Pile..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.X000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Thought as much... What about Dazir then, been there? Before they closed the gates, that is."

D.response_text: "...Yes, I have."

E.response_text: "What's so special about Dazir?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.0000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Thought as much... What about Dazir then, been there? Before they closed the gates, that is."

D.response_text: "...No, I haven't."

E.response_text: "Why do you ask?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Unfortunate, but understandable - y'know, since Khaa closed their gates after the Wellspring mishap."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "They're the settlement at the foot of the Duskfangs, out west of here. They're the ones in charge of keepin' our water flowin' - not doin' such a great job lately, though!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.004!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Really? Huh... wonder why Khaa made an exception in your case..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.0040!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, what of the Dazirans? What's goin' on in there?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.0042!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Almost as if they weren't even worried about their upcomin' date with the pointy ends of the Tacribians' spears..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.005!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, Khaa's closed their gates - fearin' a Tacribian reprisal for cuttin' off the water. Which means, they've been as silent as Melinoe the last few days."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.100!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Really? Well, you must be special for Khaa to have made an exception in your case..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, what of the Dazirans? What's goin' on in there?"

A.response_text: "Khaa asked me restore the flow of water to the Dawn Fortress."

D.response_text: "...Khaa seeks to blame the situation on Tambul!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.101!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Is that so? Perhaps that would ease tensions..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I'm convinced the crusty ol' jinnkisser is up to somethin'! Thousands of years and not once has the water ever stopped flowin'..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1012!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, in any case, thank you, stranger! You upheld your end of the bargain. So how 'bout I let you in on somethin' else I heard recently?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.401!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I'd only be less surprised if you told me he was ol' Famlaz in disguise! That guileful jinnkisser'll get what's comin' to him!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.4010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I gotta thank you for this news, stranger! So now let me share somethin' with you - fair is fair, after all!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.102!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The situation between Dazir and the Dawn Fortress is no accident..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1020!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "You see, Khaa is a jealous man, but he's jealous of no man more than Khlutt!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1021!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Rumor has it, Khlutt belonged to a secret sect of jinnworshippin' magi, has all sorts of un-Biraculian powers and the like!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1022!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "He's said to be able to pass through walls... Oh! And to exist in many places at once! All that and an amethyst load of other terrifyin' feats of Technocraft."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!2.1023!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Khaa'd love to have half that knowledge even, and I'd wager my weight in Jinn-Liquor that it's what led to this Wellspring situation! Probably a botched threat."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, gotta say, time flies by doesn't it?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Should be gettin' back to my work! I'm busier than a bunny in sprin' - if you catch my drift! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.003!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, come back if you see anythin' interestin'!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!40.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!40.001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Ha! Fine compared to a pimple on Famlaz's ruby arse!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!40.0010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Most borin' place in all of Kabu!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!40.0011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Besides, I'm already up-to-date of the goin's on here - doubt Pakahron can even take a piss with me knowin' about it!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!40.0012!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, just come back when you've seen some of the wider world. I'd be happy to speak more with you then."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!41.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!42.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!43.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

A.response_text: "Across the Wasteland, to the city of Ur'Ruk."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!412.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!413.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

B.response_text: "Across the Wasteland, to the city of Ur'Ruk."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!423.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

B.response_text: "Across the Wasteland, to the city of Ur'Ruk."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4123.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Where've you been explorin' then, Torma Jr.?"

C.response_text: "Across the Wasteland, to the city of Ur'Ruk."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Our village idiot... er... 'poet' is over in the Residence District, kid. He'd be about the only one to believe a tale like that!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Not even a Jinn'd cross the Wasteland, much less some Torma wannabe!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Even our 'poet' knows that out in the Wastes you got one of two choices: die or go draug - and even though you're not much to look at, can't say you're fit to marry a draug... or that you're ready for ol' Boz neither!"

A.response_text: "But, there were people living out there!"

B.response_text: "You're obviously not as well-informed as you think you are."

D.response_text: "Then I suppose my information will be quite valuable..."

E.response_text: "Nothing new. I routinely do the impossible."

F.response_text: "The draugs aren't interested in marriage. Trust me."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Our village idiot... er... 'poet' is over in the Residence District, kid. He'd be about the only one to believe a tale like that!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0110!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Not even a Jinn'd cross the Wasteland, much less some Torma wannabe!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0111!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Even our 'poet' knows that out in the Wastes you got one of two choices: die or go draug - and even though you're not much to look at, can't say you're fit to marry a draug... or that you're ready for ol' Boz neither!"

A.response_text: "Well, I spoke with their leader, Hazanna."

B.response_text: "Did Pakahron really exile the Unseen to Ur'Ruk?"

C.response_text: "Well, then tell Hazanna and the others it's impossible."

D.response_text: "Then my information of the Unseen in Ur'Ruk is quite valuable..."

E.response_text: "Apparently, Hazanna isn't as weak as you lot."

F.response_text: "Draugs aren't very good lovers. Trust me."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0120!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "She's still alive?! I didn't think it'd be possible..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0121!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But maybe she did it after all, that jinnkisser! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0122!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The magi did always say that with their curse, even the Graylands would reject the Unseen, so..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0123!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But never mind that! Go on! Tell me, what's become of the exiled!?"

D.response_text: "I'm not at liberty to say... at least, not without 'incentive'."

E.response_text: "You think the Tacribians are dangerous? Wait 'til the Unseen come knocking."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.111!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Our village idiot... er... 'poet' is over in the Residence District, kid. He'd be about the only one to believe a tale like that!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.1110!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Not even a Jinn'd cross the Wasteland, much less some Torma wannabe!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.1111!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Even our 'poet' knows that out in the Wastes you got one of two choices: die or go draug - and even though you're not much to look at, can't say you're fit to marry a draug... or that you're ready for ol' Boz neither!"

A.response_text: "I spoke with a man named Radan there."

B.response_text: "Did Pakahron really exile the Unseen to Ur'Ruk?"

C.response_text: "Well, the tell Radan and the others it's impossible."

D.response_text: "Then my information of the Unseen living in Ur'Ruk is quite valuable..."

E.response_text: "Apparently, Hazanna isn't as weak as you."

F.response_text: "Draugs aren't very good lovers. Trust me."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.1000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "That means that jinnkisser is still alive... He's gotta be older than Vanargand at this point..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.1001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The magi did always say that with their curse, even the Graylands would reject the Unseen, so..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.1002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But never mind that! Go on! Tell me, what's become of the exiled!?"

A.response_text: "They live under the yolk of Hazanna."

B.response_text: "They said they were victims of a dark mage named Ormenos."

C.response_text: "They reside in the Vanquished ruins at the edge of the Wastes."

D.response_text: "I'm not at liberty to say... at least, not without 'incentive'."

E.response_text: "You think the Tacribians are dangerous? Wait 'til the Unseen come knocking."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.200!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Biracul balls! Did you say the Unseen are in Ur'Ruk?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.2000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "They're still alive?! I wouldn't've thought it possible..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.2001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The magi did always say that with their curse, even the Graylands would reject the Unseen, so..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.2002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But never mind that! Go on! Tell me, what's become of the exiled!?"

A.response_text: "They live under the yolk of Hazanna."

B.response_text: "They said they were victims of a dark mage named Ormenos."

C.response_text: "They reside in the Vanquished ruins at the edge of the Wastes."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.3000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "That means that jinnkisser is still alive... He's gotta be older than Vanargand at this point..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.3001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The magi did always say that with their curse, even the Graylands would reject the Unseen, so..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.3002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But never mind that! Go on! Tell me, what's become of the exiled!?"

B.response_text: "They said they were victims of a dark mage named Ormenos."

C.response_text: "They reside in the Vanquished ruins at the edge of the Wastes."

D.response_text: "I'm not at liberty to say... at least, not without 'incentive'."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.400!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Biracul balls! Did you say the Unseen are in Ur'Ruk?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.4000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Then they're still alive? I wouldn't've thought it possible..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.4001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The magi did always say that with their curse, even the Graylands would reject the Unseen, so..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.4002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But never mind that! Go on! Tell me, what's become of the exiled!?"

C.response_text: "They reside in the Vanquished ruins at the edge of the Wastes."

D.response_text: "I'm not at liberty to say... at least, not without 'incentive'."

E.response_text: "You think the Tacribians are dangerous? Wait 'til the Unseen come knocking."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.5000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "She still lives?! I wouldn't've thought it possible..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.5001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But maybe she did it after all, that jinnkisser! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.5002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The magi did always say that with their curse, even the Graylands would reject the Unseen, so..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.5003!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But never mind that! Go on! Tell me, what's become of the exiled!?"

A.response_text: "They live like whipped dogs, licking Hazanna's boots."

D.response_text: "I'm not at liberty to say... at least, not without 'incentive'."

E.response_text: "You think the Tacribians are dangerous? Wait 'til the Unseen come knocking."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.101!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, I guess Pakahron wasn't kiddin'... Without the Trueflesh, the Wasteland strips away the mind until its unknown even to itself..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.1010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Hazanna was a meek and mild idealist back when we were young; back when I knew her..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.201!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, Khaa was right in sayin' not even the lowest of us would envy the Unseen..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.2010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Archma... er, Kambesh knew it too when he exiled that jinntouched Ormenos."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.301!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "What a nightmare the Wastes must be if it drove them there..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.3010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I remember hearin' that the Jinnwraith himself was an echo of the Vanquished and their sin against the One."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.401!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, all right, you little jinnkisser! Listen up, now!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.4010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "A Tambulan-born agent of Khaa has returned to this city - Dysmas, the chucklin' jinnspawn. No tellin' what his purpose here is, but he's never to be trusted, you hear?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.4011!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Now, it's your turn, kid! Share what you know of the Unseen!"

C.response_text: "They reside in the Vanquished ruins at the edge of the Wastes."

D.response_text: "I hear they became victims of a dark mage named Ormenos."

E.response_text: "You think the Tacribians are dangerous? Wait 'til the Unseen come knocking."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.501!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, I guess Pakahron wasn't kiddin'... Without the Trueflesh, the Wasteland strips away the mind until its unknown even to itself..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.5010!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But I doubt you got ears for the past."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.800!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But I s'pose that's to be expected; the Wasteland is nothin' but a world of perversion, after all."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.801!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Yet, I find it strange to think that life in the Waste is even possible."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.802!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I'll throw in an extra piece of news for you... so old it's already expired, but you might like it nonetheless."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.803!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "It's true the Unseen were exiled. Everyone knows why, too. They stirred up all sorts of trouble with their conspiracy theories involvin' Khaa and Pakahron's roles in Kambesh's death after all..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.804!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But there're still many more Kabans who long for the era of the Archmage that weren't cast out..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.806!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "And I'll tell you what, this is the true reason for their animosity towards the Kabans this side of the canyon."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.807!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Not that they don't got a right to be upset, mind you. You see, Kambesh pledged to unify all of the townships and fulfill the 'Ark's Covenant' after the defeat of the Jinnwraith..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.808!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But now that hope rests in the Bone Pile alongside Kambesh."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.809!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "In any case, kid, it's none too safe to speak about this under the watchful eye of our mage. So you take care you don't run afoul of Biracul's favor by confrontin' him!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.810!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Pakahron's a shepherd to his flock, but a hunter to the wolves. He ever sees you as a threat, and you might be the first to envy the Unseen..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.811!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But you didn't hear that from me."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.X812!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Now if you'll excuse me, I got some water to attend to! Biracul guide you, kid!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.900!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "If all you've to share are lies, then can't see a reason to listen further."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.X901!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Go peddle your Jinn's whispers to the children on the street, outlander!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.991!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Biracul smile on you, kid... I'm afraid I'm all out of news, but there's still plenty of water."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.X9990!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Next thing you know you'll be tryin' to tell me Biracul's been sleepin' with Famlaz..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "About Tambul? The least interesting place in all Kabu?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "If you had even a scrap of news about some other place - ANY place other than this borin' dung heap - well, then I'd be on it like a Suyuti on a goat!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.002!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But, whatever sows your fields, I guess. Ask away, kid!"

A.response_text: "Do you have any inns or taverns where people gather?"

B.response_text: "How did Tambul first come to exist?"

C.response_text: "On second thought, maybe I should just go."

D.response_text: "Any dangerous characters I should steer clear of?"

E.response_text: "Boring dung heap? That answers everything I need to know."

F.response_text: "Well, there's an obvious cure to 'spice' things up! You in?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.100!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "An inn? A tavern? What in Biracul's name are those?"

A.response_text: "Oh, well, they're places where out-of-towners can mix with locals."

B.response_text: "It's a place where foreigners can stay."

E.response_text: "I should've known better than to ask the blind for sight..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.101!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh! If that's the case, the Atrium is the best place for that! Silly girls ask silly questions, I s'pose."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.120!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Now that you mention it, I think I heard the village fool... er... 'poet', mention that in one of his 'performances'... Said he read it in some old tome, said that foreign towns had places like those..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.121!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "And here I thought he was just channelin' his inner idiot to come up with nonsense. Turns out the joke's on me! Oh, well, guess we can't all be Vanargands, eh?"

B.response_text: "Well, why don't people travel to Kabu?"

C.response_text: "So I take it there are no inns, then."

D.response_text: "I guess 'village idiot' is a now shared title, then..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.122!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "You jokin', kid? Kabu is sky-high on some plateau with the Duskfangs at its back! The last people to visit had to fly up here in some bizarre Vanquished airship!"

D.response_text: "Maybe Biracul isolated you from the world to curb the spread of stupidity..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.123!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "In recent memory, I guess there's been a handful of 'em..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.124!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "That famous 'Prophet' came with the airship years back, but those jinnlickin' sons goats left him here! Not sure where that damned fellow wandered off to now, but all that jinnstruck nonsense about great calamities ahead really shook some folks up. Kabu still hasn't really recovered from that, to be honest."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.125!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But the last people to come before that was Archma... uh... Kambesh. And along with him that jinntouched horror, Ormenos - gotta say, I'm glad that one's dancing with the Jinns! What a creep he was..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.126!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Oh, and they brought that gorgeous boy with 'em, oh what was his name? Theskian..? Well, somethin' like that. It was a long time ago, back when I was just bloomin' - not that I'm passed my prime now, mind you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.127!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But look at me, yappin' away, not knowin' when to shut my trap like some Daziran Artisan!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.130!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So, yeah, no inns, no travelers, nothin' of note in this miserable little town!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.131!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls, it's depressin' talkin' to you, kid! Bein' constantly reminded of how dull this place is!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.132!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Probably best if you're on your way. I'd tell you to enjoy the town, but I don't it's possible to!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.133!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "High time I got back to my soul crushin' duties!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.140!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, we'll let Akkeber know you're not good at sharin', then. Congrats, the title's all yours now!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.141!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Certainly not! Biracul doesn't make mistakes, and with you runnin' rampant out there wouldn't it mean he failed to stop the spread?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.150!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Without a doubt! Maybe you should go make friends with Akkeber out in the Residence District. He also likes live in a world of make believe..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.200!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So you want a history lesson, do you? Well, you asked the right person! I'm probably the only one in Tambul to know the true origins of Kabu!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.201!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Right, so everyone knows that Biracul was the founder of Kabu, set up the townships, divided the labors and all such stuff. But!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.202!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "I found out, not long ago, that the two remainin' Muninn trees in Kabu both came from the same source, far across the Jenowin Plain in abandoned Tacriba!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.203!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Back before the Tacribians abandoned their role in the Biraculian system and migrated out to the Dawn Fortress. Y'know, they actually used to be responsible for minin' raw materials - stuff the Dazirans would later use for buildin' and whatnot."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.204!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "In any case, they were also responsible for somethin' else..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.206!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "And apparently the Muninn they let the rust-colored mage kill was the original Muninn, first in the world!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.207!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Turns out, some of its memories remain in the Muninn over in Dazir!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.208!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, why bring it up? Because before Kabu was Kabu, it was somethin'... bigger. Something more important!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.209!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The final thing my source over in Dazir said was that somethin' 'unprecedented' happened out at the edge of the wastes... somethin' leadin' to the Great Awakenin' itself..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.300!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Riiight... Okay, well, best be on your way then, kid!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.400!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Dangerous? Kid, this is the least dangerous place in the world!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.401!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Maybe if this were Dazir, you'd have to worry about some backstabbin' jinnkisser. Or if it were the Dawn Fortress you'd have to look out for draugs, but here..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.402!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, hold on, I can think of one person I'd tell you steer clear of..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.403!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "If you ever happen to meet a man named Dysmas, don't trust him..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.404!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But look at me and my jinnwhisperin' mouth! I should get back to work!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.500!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "You don't know the half of it, kid! Let me tell you..."

A.response_text: "Well, boring and peaceful is better than war-torn and chaotic, right?"

D.response_text: "You complain, an awful lot..."

E.response_text: "I already know what I need to. I don't care about the rest."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.510!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, when you put it that way... I guess you're right. Huh."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.511!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "The Shining One always talked about how a change in perspective could cause the awakenin' of Awareness. I guess this is what He meant..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.540!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "And you give silly, unsolicited opinions. Guess we both have some character flaws to work on then, eh?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.550!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Riight... You realize the only Jinn anyone respects is the Emerald one, right? And I can tell you it ain't because of his ignorance..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.551!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "But what am I sayin'? You don't care! Why am I castin' pearls before a swine?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.600!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "This civil servant has been around too long to agree to some scheme before hearin' what it's about first!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.601!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "So go on! What's this red-tinged plot of yours, you little jinnlickin' rascal you!"

F.response_text: "Well, you see, we'd... -wishper, whisper, whisper-"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.602!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Huh? Look, kid, just sayin' 'whisper, whisper, whisper' doesn't count as covertly sharin' your plan with me!"

F.response_text: "Oh by Roostor's Comb, do I have to spell it out for you?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!5.603!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Why, yes you do! I'm not inside that jinnstruck skull of yours! How else would I know what you meant when you said we could 'spice' this borin' dung heap up?"

F.response_text: "Okay, fine! All we've gotta do is... -hmmm, psst, cough, psst-"
"Got it? Good! We start recruiting tomorrow at the crack of dawn!"

A.response_text: "I'm sorry... I don't know what's wrong with me..."

F.response_text: "Operation 'Spice Girls' we'll call it!"
"Move over, Akkeber! There's a new act in town!"
"Hey! You've been awfully quite since you turned around!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!9.000!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Well, I must say, time flies by doesn't it?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!9.X001!NIYOOSH!.dialogue_text: "Afraid I gotta get back to my work! Biracul guide you, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Greetings stranger! You've entered the township of Tambul, and I am its mage-leader, Pakahron."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Fear not, for though we haven't met before, you're among friends here!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I must say, you don't have the look of a Daziran, and only a Jinn could cross the Duskfangs and survive..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.0010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You don't dress as we Kabans do and since you obviously have the rare talent to operate the Farcaster, I can only surmise you must be a foreign mage come from afar."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.0011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "In any event, when some of my citizens witnessed your arrival, they informed me immediately so that I could perhaps learn more of our new visitor."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.0012!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "So I'm quite curious: where do you hail from and what brings you to Kabu?"

A.response_text: "I awoke in an underground chamber somewhere in the desert."

D.response_text: "How is it that your spies escaped my notice, 'friend'?"

E.response_text: "My business is my own."

F.response_text: "I come from a land down under."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.100!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Truly? This is strange, as I must admit, I can't imagine where in the Jenowin Plain that might be - save the long abandoned ruins of Old Tacriba..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I don't suppose you know how you came to be there do you?"

A.response_text: "I don't, sorry. But maybe I can start anew here, if I can learn your ways."

B.response_text: "I have no memory before waking there."

E.response_text: "You are a prying old man, aren't you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X200!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Biracul be praised, you've an inquisitive mind!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "A mage studies the Ars Techne, in essence, natural law. This allows us to understand and manipulate the physical and metaphysical through proper control of the mind."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "For instance, I'm capable of peering into the minds of others, a skill I sometimes use to determine if visitors are a threat to us..."

A.response_text: "I see. And what of your people?"

C.response_text: "I intend no harm to your people."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's beard! How is it that you can use a Techne advanced beyond any living mage, and yet you know not what a mage even is!?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2003!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I wonder if what we call a mage is simply known by another name in your foreign school of Technocrafts..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2004!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "In any case, a mage studies the Ars Techne, in essence, natural law. This allows us to understand and manipulate the physical and metaphysical through proper control of the mind."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.2005!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "For instance, I'm capable of peering into the minds of others, a skill I sometimes use to determine if visitors are a threat to us..."

A.response_text: "I see. And what of your people?"

C.response_text: "I intend no harm to your people."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.300!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "A noble aspiration! However, these are uncertain times... and as the leader of this township, I must determine whether your words are at odds with your thoughts."

B.response_text: "I'm uncertain of who I am or how I came to be here."

C.response_text: "My words and thoughts align; no harm do I intend."

D.response_text: "Is it through your mage powers that you command your subjects..?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.400!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You misunderstand us! The individuals who reported this to me were merely curious and could not help but notice - you are quite unlike us humble Kabans."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, it's my duty as mage to determine if you represent a threat to us or our way of life."

C.response_text: "I give you my word: I seek to live and let live."

D.response_text: "How is it you command such loyal followers, Pakahron..?"

E.response_text: "I see little reason to trust one so prying and suspicious."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.500!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "This is an undeniable truth... as undeniable as my responsibility to know the nature of your visit to protect my people."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You have my assurance that your purpose will remain a secret if you wish it so, but I must know it before I set you loose among the lambs of my flock, stranger."

A.response_text: "I just want to explore the town and talk to your people."

D.response_text: "Is it through your mage powers that you command these people?"

E.response_text: "I see little reason to trust one so prying and suspicious."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.600!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You speak in riddles! Perhaps you are yet another prophet, come to spread your own brand of 'Awareness'?"

C.response_text: "Not exactly. I won't trouble you or your people."

D.response_text: "Worried you'll lose command of your precious town?"

F.response_text: "I am! I come to preach the good word of Roostor to you heathens."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.101!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Your curiosity about others is laudable, stranger! However, before allowing you access, it's my responsibility to determine if you are a threat to our peaceful way of life."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You wouldn't mind if I used my Truesight to look into the nature of your visit here, would you?"

E.response_text: "So peace comes at the cost of privacy?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.201!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you suffered an accident which robbed you of your memory... Well, it's within my power to look into your mind and see any hidden memories that you may have lost access to. Shall I?"

B.response_text: "Proceed, I'm eager to learn all I can."

C.response_text: "Could you use this power to destroy my mind?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.301!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I wish that I could trust you, my friend. But my people have a right to security and they look to me to provide it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.3010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You wouldn't mind if I used my Truesight to look into the nature of your visit here, would you?"

B.response_text: "Proceed, verify my integrity if you must."

C.response_text: "Could you use this power to destroy my mind?"

D.response_text: "But! But... what of my right to privacy?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.401!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Biracul be praised! I command no one and nothing, stranger! These people here follow me of their own accord."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "We follow Biraculian traditions in our township, and respect the individual's right to determine their own destiny. But it's my sacred duty to ensure that these rights aren't violated."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Therefore, I must insist on using my Truesight to ascertain your unfiltered intentions in our township."

C.response_text: "Could you use this power to destroy my mind?"

D.response_text: "Respect every individual's rights... except for the foreigner's."

E.response_text: "Why read my thoughts if you really are so tolerant?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.501!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I understand life outside civilization must be trying, and that it has likely soured you to even those who mean you no harm. Likewise, I assure you that we are in fact a tolerant people."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "That said, in light of recent troubles, I cannot afford to take any chances. As such, I ask that you allow me to use my Truesight to ascertain your unfiltered intentions in our township."

D.response_text: "So forfeit any right to privacy and let you invade my mind? Tolerant indeed..."

E.response_text: "Hypocrisy. Tolerant people do not discriminate against strangers."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.601!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Oh? I've never heard of that particular deity..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Does he have much in common with the fabled Famlaz, Jinn king of buzzards?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.6011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "If you allow me to search inside your mind, I could get a better understanding of this 'Rooster' you speak of, stranger."

F.response_text: "You're in for a pleasant surprise!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.102!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Unfortunately, yes. I'm sad to say, too many foreigners have caused us harm in the past. The wounds yet unhealed by waning memory..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "While I realize most outsiders are benevolent, I cannot take this risk again; I must insist on looking into your mind."

A.response_text: "I give you my word that I'll bring Tambul no harm, but I cannot permit this."

B.response_text: "I've nothing to hide; confirm that I speak the truth."

E.response_text: "I refuse subjection to the judgment of false benevolence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X122!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Unfortunately, yes. I'm sad to say, too many foreigners have caused us harm in the past. The wounds yet unhealed by waning memory..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1220!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "While I realize most outsiders are benevolent, I cannot take this risk again; I must insist on looking into your mind."

B.response_text: "Then do it. I also wish to know what happened to me."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.122!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Unfortunately, yes. I'm sad to say, too many foreigners have caused us harm in the past. The wounds yet unhealed by waning memory..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.1221!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "While I realize most outsiders are benevolent, I cannot take this risk again; I must insist on looking into your mind."

B.response_text: "Then do it. I also wish to know what happened to me."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X302!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Admittedly, it would be within my power to alter your mind. However, you needn't fear, as I've sworn an oath in Biracul's name to only use my abilities for reading thoughts, and only when given permission to do so."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.302!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Admittedly it would be within my power to alter your mind. However, you needn't fear, as I've sworn an oath in Biracul's name to only use my abilities for reading thoughts, and only when given permission to do so."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X322!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Admittedly it would be within my power to alter your mind. However, you needn't fear, as I've sworn an oath in Biracul's name to only use my abilities for reading thoughts, and only when given permission to do so."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.322!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Admittedly it would be within my power to alter your mind. However, you needn't fear, as I've sworn an oath in Biracul's name to only use my abilities for reading thoughts, and only when given permission to do so."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X402!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You are within your rights to refuse, stranger. However, if you don't submit yourself to my scrutiny, I am within my rights to deny you entry into our township."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "That said, we won't turn you away empty handed; a small parcel of food and a filled waterskin will serve to show we accepted you in the light of the Shining One and saw you off in its afterglow."

E.response_text: "I refuse subjection to the judgment of false benevolence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.402!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You are within your rights to refuse, stranger. However, if you don't submit yourself to my scrutiny, I am within my rights to deny you entry into our township."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.4021!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "That said, we won't turn you away empty handed; a small parcel of food and a filled waterskin will serve to show we accepted you in the light of the Shining One and saw you off in its afterglow."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

E.response_text: "I refuse subjection to the judgment of false benevolence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.X502!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "There are limits to tolerance, stranger. Those who cannot respect the rights of others are not welcome within these walls; and those who willingly violate these rights are exiled into the Wasteland."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Punishment is not something I take pride in, but such measures are necessary for the continuation of civilization."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5021!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "As such, I must either peer into your mind, or you must depart immediately."

E.response_text: "I refuse subjection to the judgment of false benevolence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.502!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "There are limits to tolerance, stranger. Those who cannot respect the rights of others are not welcome within these walls; and those who willingly violate these rights are exiled into the Wasteland."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5022!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Punishment is not something I take pride in, but such measures are necessary for the continuation of civilization."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5023!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "As such, I must either peer into your mind, or you must depart immediately."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

E.response_text: "I refuse subjection to the judgment of false benevolence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.602!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "A surprise..? Likely as not this is true - though I fear it won't be nearly as pleasant as you claim..."

F.response_text: "Let 'er rip!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.303!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Then, I will see to it you're fed and restored. Though, if you return here, I'm afraid the gates will remain closed for you henceforth."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.503!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I must admit... you humble me stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5030!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You have a spirit of the kind I have often admired..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5032!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Very well. Perhaps I am guilty of betraying the teachings of Biracul on tolerance. I hereby permit you to rest within these walls."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!0.5033!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "But a warning: do not mistake my lenience for weakness; for should you do harm to my people, it will be revisited upon you tenfold!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Greetings stranger! You've entered the township of Tambul, and I am its mage-leader, Pakahron."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Fear not, for though we have not met before, you are among friends here."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.0001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I must say, you don't have the look of a Daziran, and only a Jinn could cross the Duskfangs and survive..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.X0002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "So, I'm curious: where do you hail from and what brings you to Kabu?"

A.response_text: "I awoke in an underground chamber somewhere in the desert."

B.response_text: "I heard a disturbing accusation about you."

D.response_text: "My friend Mifas'cul does not speak very highly of you, Pakahron..."

E.response_text: "I met a man named Mifas'cul while in the desert, ring a bell?"

F.response_text: "I come from a land down under!"

D.response_text: "What is my silence worth to you?"

E.response_text: "I know of your crimes; now prepare to answer for them."

F.response_text: "Well, yes it is; otherwise I wouldn't have said it, dummy..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.101!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "It is. Of course, my sole purpose was to prevent the possibility of conflict by turning Kabu into a land of plenty!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I thought the crops that Mifas'cul promised would bring about a new age - an irony that they only led to a loss of life."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.1011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, I cannot allow you to undo my life's work; you are a liability that only death can resolve, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.201!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I understand you seek answers; I would, too, were our positions reversed."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "But now you must pay the price for these answers; one who knows what you know cannot be allowed to walk freely."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.2011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You will not undo all I have worked for..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You speak words that would spell my doom and now wish to remain uninvolved?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Well, I must say, I haven't met anyone as naive as you since that gullible draug-brain Thetian!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3012!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "No child, had you truly wished to remain uninvolved, you would have strayed far from my doorstep."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.3013!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You will not undo my life's work; you'll dance with the Jinns in the Graylands tonight, instead!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.401!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I suppose it'll simply cost me a few moments of my time to kill you."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.4010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You and I both know that no price can guarantee your silence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.501!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I thought this day might come, and I have not sat idle in waiting for it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.5010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Mifas'cul has no monopoly on occult Techne, stranger. But I'm afraid you'll have to be the first to taste the punishment I've prepared for that foreigner jinnspawn."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.601!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You've no idea of the gravity of the situation you find yourself in, do you?"

F.response_text: "The mighty Roostor laughs in the face of gravity!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.6010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "No... that's not what 'gravity' means in this context... Agh! Do not distract me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!1.6011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'll not allow you to undo my life's work! You'll dance with the Jinns in the Graylands tonight, stranger."

F.response_text: "Do they offer free lessons? My Foxtrot is a bit unpolished..."
"No, my soul will just find a new body, amigo. Joke's on you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Your mind seems free of taint and deformity..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.0001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "But how peculiar... The structure of it, it's... unlike any I've witnessed before."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.0002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Frankly, your mind more closely resembles a Neverborn's than a human's... Though you're undeniably human..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.0004!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Though ultimately, what's more important is that you appear to harbor my people no ill will; I thank you for your cooperation, stranger."

A.response_text: "Now would you mind telling me about Kabu?"

B.response_text: "Tell me something about the history of your town."

D.response_text: "Yes, yes, of course. Now tell me about your enemies."

E.response_text: "Tell me who controls the region."

F.response_text: "That's not what my father told me."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.X020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Your mind seems free of taint and deformity... But now I will look into your memories..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.021!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I see your journey. And before this, your awakening. And..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.022!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Curious. Before this event I cannot detect... any memories whatsoever."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.023!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Yes, very strange... I can't say I've ever encountered anyone with such a profound and thorough memory erasure..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.024!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Though, it doesn't resemble an erasure. It almost seems as though there were no memories to begin with..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.0240!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, what's even more striking is the structure of your mind... it's unlike any I've witnessed before; and frankly, it more closely resembles a Neverborn's than a human's, though you're undeniably human..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.X025!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Despite the obvious... irregularities... in your speech, I would say your mind is generally healthy."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.026!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Though, despite a rather thorough inspection, I can't seem to detect even hints of memories prior to your awakening in a Vanquished chamber - which I assume is Old Tacriba?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.027!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, even more striking is the structure of your mind... it's unlike any I've witnessed before; and frankly, it more closely resembles a Neverborn's than a human's, though you're undeniably human..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.028!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "In any event, your mind seems both free from deformity and animosity toward our people."

A.response_text: "Free deformities? Where do I sign up!?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.030!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry, my friend. I thought I might be able to assist you, or at least shed some light on your problem."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.031!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Kaleki, the Librarian of Tambul, is well versed in history. Perhaps she has heard of individuals that shared this ailment. You would do well to seek her counsel."

A.response_text: "And that I will, but would you mind telling me a little about Kabu?"

B.response_text: "Tell me something about the history of your town."

D.response_text: "Yes, yes, of course. Now tell me about your enemies."

E.response_text: "I don't care. Just tell me, who controls the region?"

F.response_text: "It sounds as though my past involved blunt force trauma to the head."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.100!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Certainly, stranger. You see, the people of Dazir have mastered the arts of mechanical manipulation for the purposes of diverting water to areas where it was needed."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.1000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "And the people of Tacriba live at Kabu's Eastern perimeter, across the canyon. They use their martial skills to protect us all from the threats of the Wasteland - though, I fear that this arrangement might soon end."

A.response_text: "What do you mean, it might end?"

E.response_text: "You weaken yourselves by depending on others."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.200!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "At the time of the founding, we had a great leader named Biracul, the Shining One."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "He gave us the order and structure our ancestors lacked, providing the means through which we could collectively contribute to a common effort. Though sadly, some seek to abandon this cooperative path for personal gain."

A.response_text: "Oh? Are you currently in conflict with your neighbors?"

D.response_text: "So who are your leaders?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.400!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'm not certain that 'enemy' is the correct term. I suppose the three contingents of this area have their own directives and characteristics, as mandated by our founder. But we were never intended to be enemies."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "The folk of Dazir have a mastery of craft and the intellect to provide the tools of survival."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "The Tacribian League challenges existential threats and secures our way of life."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "And I suppose Tambul, beyond providing sustenance, seeks to create a space of empathy and understanding."

D.response_text: "So who're the current leaders?"

E.response_text: "It sounds as if you're too interdependent to be strong."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.500!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Well, no one does! We all contribute to the welfare of the whole, as Biracul willed it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You see, without our crops all contingents would starve, and without water from the Daziran Wellspring, well... I suppose we're already witnessing how taught that pulls the noose..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "But even the Tacribians are essential - impulsive though they may be! They've been guarding us from the threat of another drauglord for centuries!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "That's why this whole Wellspring fiasco threatens our very survival."

D.response_text: "So who're the current leaders?"

E.response_text: "It sounds as if you're too interdependent to be strong."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.600!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry if that is so. As said by Biracul, the founder, 'Ours is a world of harshness and cruelty; we must bear it together, our brothers our shield, our sisters our sword'."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I only fear it'll get harsher if our current crisis remains unresolved for too long."

F.response_text: "I feel a quest coming on..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.101!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "A crisis looms that threatens the peace we have enjoyed for centuries..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.1010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You see, the mage of Tacriba has announced a declaration of war with Dazir."

E.response_text: "What kind of threat do these Tacribians pose?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.201!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Biracul is purported to have been a mage of great power, from a distant land."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Previously, all peoples of the region were merely competing tribes. But he gave us the ability to pursue a better life, the ability to cooperate."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Legend states that he wandered into the Wasteland and was never seen again."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2012!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "While we've followed his path for generations, a violent dispute between our two neighbors threatens to bring down all we've worked for."

D.response_text: "Who leads these two groups?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.X301!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Oh, yes, by all means. Biracul guide you, Eidos."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.401!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Each contingent is guided by a mage such as myself."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I guide this township, while Dazir and the Dawn Fortress are led by magi Khaa and Khlutt, respectively."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "As magi, we avail ourselves of a Techne referred to as 'Truesight', enabling us to better understand our people and each other through direct contact with their minds."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4012!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Of course, having empathic philosophers as magi has served us well for generations, but it's not without its problems..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4013!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Even we fall prey to defects of personality, and such faults have brought magi, past and present, into conflict."

D.response_text: "Describe these magi to me."

E.response_text: "What kind of threat do these Tacribians pose?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.501!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I beg to differ! The only weakness is human fallibility."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Cooperation is a requirement for all humans, and as we advance, we face new challenges of cooperation."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5011!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "At the moment, the Tacribians have advanced to the point where their martial abilities threaten all of us. However, even they are yet beholden to the abilities of Dazir; for even the fiercest warrior needs water to slake his thirst."

A.response_text: "So there's a problem between these two groups?"

D.response_text: "Who leads these two groups?"

E.response_text: "What kind of threat do these Tacribians pose?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.601!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I confess, it's indeed my hope that you would assists us. A crisis looms that threatens the peace we have enjoyed for centuries..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6010!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You see, the mage of Tacriba has announced a declaration of war with Dazir."

F.response_text: "The poor fools. The only real enemy is the gremlin menace."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.102!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I believe the root problem is a lack of communication and understanding."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.1020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Even I can't comprehend the true nature of Tacriba's grievances - the fiasco with the Wellspring was merely the errant lightning bolt that ignited this brushfire."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.1021!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Yet if only they agreed to a more thorough dialogue, I believe we could find peaceful ways to resolve this issue!"

B.response_text: "You say nothing of your part; am I to believe you're blameless?"

E.response_text: "Clearly you need stronger leadership to prevent these petty disputes."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.202!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "The folk of Dazir, mistakingly regard the Tacribians as barbarous and uncivilized. Meanwhile, the Tacribians have become increasingly intolerant of this arrogance, to the point of considering Daziran genocide - worse is that this is a conflict centuries in the making."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, I believe that a dialogue can and must be opened between them."

A.response_text: "How can we get the two parties to reconcile?"

B.response_text: "You say nothing of your part; am I to believe you're blameless?"

D.response_text: "It sounds as if Khlutt is the major obstacle to overcome."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.402!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Despite being somewhat weak in the Ars Techne, Khaa has considerable knowledge of the learning of the Vanquished; it was perhaps this combination of curiosity and ineptitude that led to the Wellspring's corruption."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, you need only look at his reaction to see he fears Khlutt. Never have the gates to Dazir been more resolutely shut."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4021!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Khaa may hide behind his wall now, but Khlutt is a relentless hunter. When he finds a way across the canyon, he'll paint the walls of Dazir with blood."

B.response_text: "You say nothing of your part; am I to believe you're blameless?"

D.response_text: "It sounds as if Khlutt is the major obstacle to overcome."

E.response_text: "You need stronger leadership to bring these rogues to heel."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.502!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "For now they're deterred from assaulting either of our townships; for the Tacribians dwell across the canyon and beyond the Gate of Celestial Judgment."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, Khlutt is a crafty man; he'll no doubt find a way to assault Dazir, and when he does, he'll paint the walls of Dazir with blood."

D.response_text: "It sounds as if Khlutt is the major obstacle to overcome."

E.response_text: "The problem isn't a lack of communication; it's an excess of voices."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.602!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "That may be... a belief in your homeland. But I believe the root problem is a lack of communication and understanding."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Even I can't comprehend the true nature of Tacriba's grievances - the fiasco with the Wellspring was merely the errant lightning bolt that ignited this brushfire."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6021!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Yet if only they agreed to a more thorough dialogue, I believe we could find peaceful ways to resolve this issue!"

F.response_text: "You sound two puffs away from bringing out a guitar and some bongos."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.103!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Arbitration. And I believe one such as you is ideally suited to act as arbitrator."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.1030!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "The other contingents are mistrusting even of myself. But a third party, impartial and without allegiance might well be easier for them to accept as a mediator."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.1031!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "If you could act as an emissary for this cause, perhaps we can yet avert a crisis possibly worse than the return of Rikharr would be."

A.response_text: "I'll act as arbitrator; I'll leave immediately to speak with their leaders."

B.response_text: "We must first understand the cause before addressing its effects."

E.response_text: "I don't see how that would be effective. Force must be met with force."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.203!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Heavens, no! In Biracul's name, we're all guilty in some way or another!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2030!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "But Biracul is forgiving and we are to emulate his virtues."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2031!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "In any case, the issue at hand doesn't involve Tambul directly. Thus, we should focus on how to improve relations between Dazir and Tacriba instead!"

A.response_text: "Then I can act as arbitrator between the two factions."

B.response_text: "Curing the symptoms will not cure the disease."

C.response_text: "I think it best an outsider doesn't get involved in your affairs."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.403!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Khlutt is a duly appointed official. While he can be... severe, I still think he should be reasoned with - though in truth, none in Kabu are strong enough to deal with him in any other way."

C.response_text: "Regardless, this sounds like it's none of my business."

D.response_text: "I suppose I could attempt arbitration, but I'd need an incentive..."

E.response_text: "Reason is all you're capable of, but violence is all the Tacribians know."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.503!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I'm not sure if I share your appraisal of the situation."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5030!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Our contingents already have strong leaders, each voicing the concerns of their people. What we lack is a medium through which our voices can be heard and our concerns discussed."

A.response_text: "Fine. Then, I'll act as arbitrator; I'll leave immediately to speak with their leaders."

D.response_text: "I suppose I could, but I would need an incentive."

E.response_text: "I don't see how that would be effective. Force must be met with force."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.603!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "If by that... you mean I wish for arbitration, then you're indeed correct. And I thought you might be well suited to the task."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6030!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You see, the other contingents are mistrusting even of myself. But, a third party, impartial and without allegiance, might well be easier for them to accept as a mediator."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6031!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "If you could act as an emissary for this cause, Tambul, and indeed all the people of Kabu, would be forever in your debt."

F.response_text: "No! Only the Jade Monkey can restore peace to the land."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.104!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Thank you, stranger! Regardless of the outcome, our people are forever in your debt!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.204!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "While I see your point, time is limited. We cannot continue to supply the Dawn Fortress with rations of water and they will surely not wait for Khaa to fix the Wellspring."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2040!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "However, this is ultimately our own problem and I will bother you no longer to help us resolve it."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.2041!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I hereby grant you access to our township; may you find the answers you seek."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.304!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I understand you're trepidatious about becoming involved in the affairs of strangers. However, I don't exaggerate when I say that lives hang in the balance."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.3040!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "An outsider like you could be the key to solving these tensions..."

B.response_text: "I'll speak with the leaders, though I cannot make any promises."

C.response_text: "Just as I intend you no harm, I likewise feel no obligation towards you."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I could... though I'd need to be amply rewarded."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.404!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You would have our eternal gratitude. But if that's insufficient, then I believe I could share with you my research on a certain Techne, as a reward for braving the dangers of such a task."

C.response_text: "I agree to your terms and will speak to these two leaders."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I could use this knowledge for the task ahead..."

E.response_text: "I see no reason to complete your task for such a pittance."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.504!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "It's true that the Tacribians follow Khlutt's war-mongering directives without question, but I cannot approve of violence."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5040!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "If you mean to walk such a path, then you do so without my blessing and are not welcome here."

A.response_text: "Fine. I'll try a more diplomatic approach."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can find other means... But of what benefit would it be to me?"

E.response_text: "The approval of a coward means nothing to me."

F.response_text: "Stolen by the Gremlin King. I'll return it - and peace! - to your kingdom."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.305!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "...I see. Well, I hope your time in Tambul shows you the meaning of Biracul's blessed words, 'Kindness to strangers is kindness to the Self. There is no Other to the All-Seeing Eye.'"

A.response_text: "Perhaps it will. Am I free to walk around now?"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.405!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Although I wish you were helping us for more altruistic reasons, I'm grateful that you'll come to our aid."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.445!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I see now that you seek only power and personal advantage. I cannot trust one such as you, either as emissary or as guest."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.4450!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "You will collect your water and depart from my township immediately, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.505!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Such tyranny flies in the face of everything I've worked for! And now I regret having shared my thoughts with you."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.5050!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Collect your water and begone, stranger. You have no place among us!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.605!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "While I don't fully understand your intent, I find your... passion for success laudable."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!3.6050!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "I hereby grant you access to our township. May you find the... monkey you seek."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard! Now I apologize, but I'm terribly busy!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Please go about your business and leave me to mine."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.X001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Stranger, please, for the love of Ark, let me be so that I may think!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.002!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Stranger, look upon the many sights of Tambul... at the other end of town! The Hydroponic Farm, the Archives and the Moon Tower are all in that direction."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.X0020!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Now for the last time: leave me be!"

F.response_text: "Please, just..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!4.003!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "That does it! Guards! Escort this jinnloving outlander to the gates and lock them firmly behind her!"

E.response_text: Attack

F.response_text: Comply

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!9.000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Ah... I see that you failed to mention your meeting with Mifas'cul in the desert..."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!9.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "It brings me no pleasure to snuff the flame of your life's candle, child. However, for the sake of my research, you must die."

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!10.000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "But your mind... It's unreadable. Then you are an Inscrutable!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!10.0000!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "We'll not allow another Kharrspawn to slither among us!"

KABU!TAMBUL!ATRIUM!10.0001!PAKAHRON!.dialogue_text: "Guards! Seize her and take her to the Dawn Fortress immediately!"

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos shuffles her feet over the cracked, peeling skin of the earth, while cloudless skies offer no shelter from the sweltering heat of the sun. Water flows through these flats like wisdom from an idiot - and appears to have done so for centuries. No fauna, no flora, not even a dried out tumbleweed in sight.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Then, through the heat-born distortions clawing their way skyward, she spots a massive bulwark rising up from the ground. Hundreds of buildings hide behind these walls, shyly poking the tips their roofs above the ramparts. The blinding spire Eidos chases juts up near the fortress' seam with the canyon's edge; and beyond it, spanning the canyon, is a massive bridge that looks to be floating midair.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X0002!DESC.dialogue_text:
As she nears the walls, her eyes center upon wooden doors roughly twenty paces wide and several times her height. Reinforced with bands of iron, the doors devoutly stand as unmoving guardians.

		Yet at her arrival, the helmeted visages of two watchmen appear atop the wall. They study her closely, inquiring about her intentions with their gazes.

		Weighing her options, Eidos looks west, noticing for the first time the deep ruts of a road leading to another settlement, nestled into the foot of the mountains. Eastward, leads along the city walls in the direction of the silver spire and a distant canyon beyond.

A.response_text: Go west to the other settlement

B.response_text: Go east along the city walls to the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0003!DESCR.dialogue_text:
As she nears the walls, her eyes center upon wooden doors roughly twenty paces wide and several times her height. Reinforced with bands of iron, the doors devoutly stand as unmoving guardians.

		Yet at her arrival, the helmeted visages of two watchmen appear atop the wall. They study her closely, inquiring about her intentions with their gazes.

		Weighing her options, Eidos looks west, noticing the deep ruts of the road leading to Dazir, nestled into the foot of the mountains. Eastward, leads along the city walls in the direction of the silver spire and a distant canyon beyond.

B.response_text: Go east along the city walls to the Moon Tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X001!DESCR.dialogue_text: At her approach, the gates immediately begin to grate the earth beneath their feet, opening with a raspy moan. A handful of spearmen stand at the entrance, but do not block her passage. Neither the guards atop the walls nor those within them ask her name or purpose, though all present watch Eidos with attentive stares as she passes through the gates.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos traipses through the dusty plains towards the heavy wooden gates of Tambul, firmly locked in place. The guards, alarmed at Eidos' resurrection, summon Pakahron immediately. Upon his arrival, Pakahron whispers something to the guards and walks off, confident in his gates' ability to bar any undesirables from entering.\n\n\t\tOne thing is clear: these gates will no longer open for Eidos.

A.response_text: Go west to the other settlement

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos traipses through the dusty plains towards the heavy wooden gates of Tambul, firmly locked in place. The guards, alarmed at Eidos' resurrection, summon Pakahron immediately. Upon his arrival, Pakahron whispers something to the guards and walks off, confident in his gates' ability to bar any undesirables from entering.\n\n\t\tOne thing is clear: these gates will no longer open for Eidos.

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0020!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos traipses through the dusty plains towards the heavy wooden gates of Tambul, firmly locked in place. A guard recognizes the mage-slayer's approach and rushes to alert the others. Like cowering, frantic chickens, they run about eventually disappearing below the ramparts, far from Eidos' view.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X0021!DESC.dialogue_text: Silence falls upon the gates and the Atrium beyond, all in a desperate hope to avoid Eidos' attention. If fear and tension were edible, this would be a feast fit for a king.\n\n\t\tOne thing is very clear: these gates will no longer open willing for Eidos.

A.response_text: Go west to the other settlement

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0022!DESCR.dialogue_text: Silence falls upon the gates and the Atrium beyond, all in a desperate hope to avoid Eidos' attention. If fear and tension were edible, this would be a feast fit for a king.\n\n\t\tOne thing is very clear: these gates will no longer open willing for Eidos.

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X100!DESCR.dialogue_text: The gates groan as they close behind her, heavy wood on sand. Eidos stands outside first gazing east, seeing the Moon Tower trying to light the sky ablaze. Then she directs her vision to the west, where deep-carved ruts lead toward another settlement, nestled at the foot of the mountains.

A.response_text: Go west to the other settlement

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The gates groan as they close behind her, heavy wood on sand. Eidos stands outside first gazing east, seeing the Moon Tower trying to light the sky ablaze. Then she directs her vision to the west, where deep-carved ruts lead toward the township of Dazir, nestled at the foot of the mountains.

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The gates groan as they quickly close, heavy wood on sand. They slam shut with the echoing finality of a judge's gavel, as if restating Pakahron's sentence of exile and barring her from further entry.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X0030!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos now stands outside first gazing east, seeing the Moon Tower trying to light the sky ablaze. Then she directs her vision to the west, where deep-carved ruts lead toward another settlement, nestled at the foot of the mountains.

A.response_text: Go west to the other settlement

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0031!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos now stands outside first gazing east, seeing the Moon Tower trying to light the sky ablaze. Then she directs her vision to the west, where deep-carved ruts lead toward the township of Dazir, nestled at the foot of the mountains.

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.004!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches, the heat-born distortions of the air obscure the walls of Tambul beyond. Then, in the space of a thought, a black mass careens down upon her from the sky like a swarm of locusts.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X0040!DESC.dialogue_text: Arrows. Scores of them. And as iron to a magnet, the sharpened tips find her supple skin, ripping into her flesh. Her legs lose all strength, and she falls to her knees.\n\n\t\tEidos now observes that the guards of Dazir stand shoulder-to-shoulder with those of Tambul. This alliance suggests her chances of interacting with the citizenry of either township have decreased significantly.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0041!DESCR.dialogue_text: Blood draining from her honeycombed body, consciousness subsiding, her ghost makes its exodus from her Falseflesh.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0042!DESCR.dialogue_text: Arrows. Scores of them. And as iron to a magnet, the sharpened tips find her supple skin. Yet, the arrowheads chip and the shafts snap in twain as they collide with the diamond-hard covering Luin grants her.\n\n\t\tEidos now observes that the guards of Dazir stand shoulder-to-shoulder with those of Tambul. This alliance suggests her chances of interacting with the citizenry of either township have decreased significantly.

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower
