KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.005!DESCRI.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches, the heat-born distortions of the air obscure the walls of Tambul beyond. Then, in the space of a thought, a black mass careens down upon her from the sky like a swarm of locusts.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.X0050!DESC.dialogue_text: Arrows. Scores of them. And as iron to a magnet, the sharpened tips find her supple skin, ripping into her flesh. Her legs lose all strength, and she falls to her knees.\n\n\t\tSuddenly, it dawns on her that news of her interactions with the Tacribian mage must have spread...

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0051!DESCR.dialogue_text: Blood draining from her honeycombed body, consciousness subsiding, her ghost makes its exodus from her Falseflesh.

KABU!TAMBUL!GATES OF TAMBUL!0.0052!DESCR.dialogue_text: Arrows. Scores of them. And as iron to a magnet, the sharpened tips find her supple skin. Yet, the arrowheads chip and the shafts snap in twain as they collide with the diamond-hard covering Luin grants her.\n\n\t\tSuddenly, it dawns on her that news of her interactions with the Tacribian mage must have spread...

B.response_text: Go east along the walls towards the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Leaving the humble dwellings of the residence area, Eidos walks up a wide lane towards the northern part of the town. Any image of a pacifistic society is shattered by the abundance of armed guards patrolling the area. There is likewise an absence of wandering, chatting townsfolk, giving the distinct impression that exploration here is discouraged.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.0000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Continuing northbound for fifty paces, she finds the air grows sweeter by the step and a massive glassed dome comes into view. The entire structure appears to cover a submerged garden hundreds of paces in diameter. Eidos descends the stairs leading to the facility's entrance.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.0001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Her skin becomes sticky and beads of sweat form on her brow as she enters the expansive greenhouse. The sudden rise in humidity brings a sensation of swimming through an invisible mist. From this high vantage point she sees plant beds spread out across the entire floor several stories below, with bobbing white dots that must be workers hustling about harvesting here, sowing there. A complex series of stairwells appear to link the levels.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.0002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Descending the nearest staircase, Eidos notes that a strict order governs everything. There are multiple tiers, scores of sections and hundreds of workers. Each section hosts clearly delineated crops, all tended to according to their needs. Temperatures vary from tier to tier, as does humidity, and all conditions are held in homeostatic perfection.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X0010!DESC.dialogue_text: While most are engrossed in their work, a few catch Eidos' attention.

A.response_text: The cheerful worker who is singing to himself

B.response_text: An older man with a thoughtful look on his face

C.response_text: A sullen looking woman of middle age

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X0011!DESC.dialogue_text: While most are engrossed in their work, a few catch Eidos' attention. Though the singing farmer is now noticeably absent.

A.response_text: An older man with a thoughtful look on his face

B.response_text: A sullen looking woman of middle age

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Their interaction at an end, Eidos is left alone to reflect upon her surroundings. Sweet, humid air fills her lungs and gives her racing mind a moment of respite. A veritable sea of plants spreads out before her eyes, a sea of green, with flecks of colorful fruits and vegetables peppered throughout. All is silent but for the song of the nearby worker ringing gently around this section of the farm.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Set on leaving, Eidos first feels compelled to inhale deeply one last time. High on the air's purity, she cants her head toward the naked dome above and peering up into the cloudless sky recalls the dry and stale air awaiting her outside this oasis.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Suddenly she notices the daylight moon staring back at her like some rheumy celestial eye, unblinking and ever-vigilant. Though yet within this man-made haven, protected by its glassy shield, this hint of greater mysteries without beckons her. She feels it, the birth of a formless thought, an epiphany. It struggles wildly, thrashing about in the ocean of ideas, trying to breach the surface of consciousness like a drowning man desperate for air.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: A crash, a clang, metal on stone. An embarrassed worker collects his fallen bucket and hurries off about his business, hoping all would forget his unseemly clumsiness - and soon enough all will. However, the unformed truth Eidos nearly stumbled upon now seems to have vanished along with the graceless worker. Try as she may, she can recall nothing of it.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.004!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Working her way through the steps that led her here, she attempts to reconstruct the moment. She had walked up the stairs, breathed in the sweet air, looked skyward, was looked upon by the moon and then...

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X005!DESCR.dialogue_text: Then she remembers she had decided to leave the farm area. That must have been it. Trivial and anti-climactic, she settles on this theory; for allowing the possibility of it to be something else might drive her mad. As such, her feet automatically begin to shift towards the exit and out into the world.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!10.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: A searing pain arrests Eidos as she feels her very brain being cut open, though bloodlessly so. Her naked thoughts exposed to the prying intellect of Pakahron, Eidos knows that he sees it all, absorbs it all, experiences it as though it were his very own actions. And thus, what was once uniquely Eidos' has now become communal property.\n\n\t\tThe illusory operation has left unprotected the sole safe haven Eidos possessed. If this is what the denizens under a mage experience, it is no wonder they show such obedience, since their privacy depends on the mage's whims.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!10.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Though clearly it is irrelevant at this point, this sensation of violation is secondary to the imminent danger Eidos now faces, as the mage is aware of her ill-gotten knowledge. She now senses, through the lingering mental link, that he is less than thrilled with her actions.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0099.000!DES.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly through the farmgrounds towards her. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired.\n\n\t\tWithout a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!100.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Guards form a circle of spears around Eidos, as two unarmed men slowly move in to restrain her.

E.response_text: Attack

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!100.001!DESC.dialogue_text: The two guards firmly take hold of both her arms, snaking one theirs underneath each of hers. The pressure place upon her shoulder causes her to lurch forward into a deep bow. Feeling that she intends not to resist, they loosen their grip slightly and begin to march her out into the town.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.X000!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.001!DESC.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.100!DESC.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.101!DESC.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.102!DESC.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.103!DESC.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.104!DESC.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.105!DESC.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!999.106!DESC.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X000!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "'It's a dust-cursed life, full of toil and strife, we vagabonds undergo!\n\t\tAnd our tents are lain on the Jenowin Plain, how hard the winds do blow!'"

D.response_text: "Do you know any other songs?"

E.response_text: "Stop that racket!"

F.response_text: "This jam is amplified, so just glide..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.100!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I think it's an old song about wanderers out in the desert. Oh, y'know, nomads."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1000!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "All folk of Kabu were once a tribal people, y'know."

E.response_text: "Maybe it would sound better sung by someone with talent."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.200!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Oh, just an old tune I heard from my mother while growin' up, likely about desert nomads."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.2000!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I think it's an ancient Kaban song, from our ancestors long ago. All folk of Kabu were once a wanderin' people, y'know."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.400!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I know lots! Any in particular you're interested in?"

C.response_text: "Please sing the rest of this one."

D.response_text: "Why don't you sing one about me?"

E.response_text: "Know any about a singing fool who had his tongue ripped out?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.500!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry. Just singing a little tune about life in the desert, y'know, to pass the time."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.5000!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you'd like to hear a different song? Singin' actually makes work a joy!"

D.response_text: "Why don't you sing one about me?"

E.response_text: "Killing is my work, and I find it joyful enough without song."

F.response_text: "You listen to every word I say!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.101!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I s'pose it's because it gives me a sense of continuity, a connection to the past or some such."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "They say some of the songs we are sin' are older even than the records kept in the Archives!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X1011!KAMB.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that be amazing? My mother was a livin' chronicle... and now so I am!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.201!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I s'pose it's possible! They say some of the songs we sing are older even than the records kept in the Archives!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X2010!KAMB.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that be amazing? My mother was a livin' chronicle... and now so I am!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.301!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "'Because we're homeward bound, from the void-scorched ground where the phantoms have their rule.\n\t\tAnd we are ever in run, from the three-faced one, as we search for Biracul!'"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X3010!KAMB.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard, I do love that song!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.401!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "There's a girl standin' here, And it would now appear, that she wants a song 'bout she.\n\t\tBut what she don't understand, is that I'm Tambulan, and would rather be killed by bees!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X501!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I see. Maybe I'll take the advice of Biracul and 'Listen to the song of heaven, not the whistles of man.'"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.601!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "'I, every verb you heard I play snaps a vertebrae.\n\t\tYou try to cover, a hover me, a roast, a fake, a flag, then I run a post, toast, I'm the most.'"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.6010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "'D-E-F's how it goes: no X's or O's or tic-tac-toes.\n\t\tL-T-D knows, this ain't a game; I'm on a mission...'"

F.response_text: "Call me a hip-hop tic-tactician!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.602!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "'I rap just like a slab of clay, that's shapeless.\n\t\tChampagne, no shimmer, no glass, is tasteless.\n\t\tA universe without light is lightless.'"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.6020!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "'That's why I always take time to write this.\n\t\tI mold it in my hands before I start chiselin'.\n\t\tCould be a rain or brainstorm or drizzlin'...'"

B.response_text: "I.P. Freely in da house! Watch yo drawers party people..."

F.response_text: "Sun could be shinin', sun could be showerin'!"
"Flowerin'!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.604!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "'My lyrics are awesome an', tunin' from human, bloomin' an' blossomin'.\n\t\tBlowing' away blockades and barricades, make ya black and blue.\n\t\tFrom the blast to the blaze, it's a bloodsport, bloods builds up back...'"

A.response_text: "I make your mom become a furry..."

F.response_text: "I make your vision go blurry!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.605!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "'...while your brain goes black into oblivion, Beats from box to box to bates, rocks from blocks and blocks'"

F.response_text: "Let your backbone slide!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.606!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I must say, stranger, never I've heard someone spit rhymes so eloquently dope in all my days of growin' cabbage in the desert!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X6060!KAMB.dialogue_text: "I bestow upon you, the Techne of Keepin' It Real."

F.response_text: "I bet THIS will come in handy! Word!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X607!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "'It's who you are, not the where you went.'"

F.response_text: "...we all originate from the same descent!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X609!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Sorry stranger, not feelin' your flow! I'll have to continue solo."

F.response_text: "Harsh, bro."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X892!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "'Kambin, Song Librarian of Tambul'. I like the sound of that!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X894!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Gotta work! These vegetables aren't gonna grow themselves!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X000!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "'It's a dust-cursed life, full of toil and strife, we vagabonds undergo!\n\t\tAnd our tents are lain on the Jenowin Plain, how hard the winds do blow!'"

A.response_text: "Your wife is concerned about you, Kambin."

B.response_text: "Kambin, do you know why you're having nightmares?"

D.response_text: "Tell me of your dreams, Kambin..."

E.response_text: "I heard you had a disease of the mind."

F.response_text: "Word on the street is, you be trippin'."

B.response_text: "I'm not sure singing will cure your mind."

E.response_text: "I waste my time. Perhaps I'll just tell Pakahron of your malady."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.200!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Wha.. What!? Why would you think I'm havin' nightmares!?"

B.response_text: "Look, I'm not sure singing will solve your problem."

D.response_text: "...I can see into your thoughts, and I find them disturbing."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.400!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Wha.. What!? Why would you think I'm havin' nightmares!?"

B.response_text: "Do you know why you're having nightmares?"

D.response_text: "...I can see into your thoughts, and I find them disturbing."

E.response_text: "I waste my time. Perhaps I'll just tell Pakahron of your malady."

D.response_text: "...Like your mage, I can see into your disturbed thoughts."

E.response_text: "I waste my time. Perhaps I'll just tell Pakahron of your malady."
"I waste my time. Perhaps I'll just tell Pakahron of your malady."

F.response_text: "Don't worry, insanity is a common condition, even among NPCs."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.101!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Oh, Biracul save me! I'm sorry, but I'm sworn to secrecy! I cannot speak of it on pain of death!"

A.response_text: "But your mind must be healed, Kambin."

E.response_text: "You'll break your silence or I'll break you."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.201!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Oh, Biracul save me! I'm sorry, but I was sworn to secrecy. I cannot speak of it on pain of death!"

D.response_text: "Make it worth my while, and I'll tell no one of your weakness..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.401!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Oh, Biracul save me! Please, for the sake of my wife!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.4010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I'm sworn to secrecy, and if Pakahron suspects I cannot keep my vow..."

B.response_text: "Tell me everything and only then will I keep my silence."

D.response_text: "If you make it worth my while..."

E.response_text: "You'll break your silence or I'll break you."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.501!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "Oh, Biracul save me! Please, for the sake of my wife!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.5010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I was sworn to secrecy, and if Pakahron suspects I cannot keep my vow..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.5011!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I beg you, tell no one. I will not tell anyone anything!"

A.response_text: "I will not. But your mind must be healed."

D.response_text: "If you make it worth my while..."

E.response_text: "Either your silence breaks, or you do. Your choice."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.6010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Oh, I'm sorry, I'm sworn to secrecy!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.6011!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I cannot speak of it on pain of death!"

F.response_text: "Hey, it's a fantasy adventure. It's okay to be a loon!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.103!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "No! No, it is too late for that."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.1030!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Don't worry, my friend, I'll be alright in time."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.403!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "There is nothing I can give you, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X4032!KAMB.dialogue_text: "Nothing but my wife, my songs and... my dreams."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X603!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "You're too kind, stranger, but there's no excuse for my weakness."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X898!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Do as you will, stranger; it won't matter soon enough."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X899!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "I'll be doin' no more singin', I s'pose; no need for joy in these fields."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.000!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "'It's a dust-cursed life, full of toil and strife, we vagabonds undergo!\n\t\tAnd our tents are lain on the Jenowin Plain, how hard the winds do blow!'"

A.response_text: "I seem to recall a lady named Kaleko who sang this song, too."

B.response_text: "Kambin, do you know why you're having nightmares?"

D.response_text: "Tell me of your dreams, Kambin..."

E.response_text: "Your singing would be more pleasing if you set the volume to zero."

F.response_text: "Word on the street is, you be trippin'."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.1000!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "And you say she sang this tune?"

A.response_text: "In Ur'Ruk. I also told Kaleko you were singing the very same song!"

B.response_text: "I met her in Ur'Ruk where she gave me a tome."

E.response_text: "Perhaps it's because I saw her corpse rotting in the Wastes..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.1010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Leave it to mom to pick me up when I need it most..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.1011!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "Even if it ain't true, I remember my mother's strength of will; seems not even the jinncursed Wastes could stop her! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.X1013!KAMB.dialogue_text: "This means more to me than you could ever truly know."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.501!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "...I've scarce reason to believe she'd have survived the Wastes."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.5010!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "But, I'll say this much: your brutality and lack of empathy give me about as much reason to trust your ruby-tongued lies."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.X5011!KAMB.dialogue_text: "My songs'll give me the warmth of love that you'll never know."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!3.000!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "You know what, outlander? I think I'm gonna make it happen!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!3.001!KAMBIN.dialogue_text: "I'm gonna spread the gift of song at the Tacribian amphitheater!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!3.X002!KAMBI.dialogue_text: "For my mother and... And for peace in Kabu!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Oh! Hello there! Come to look upon the bounty of Tambul, have you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.0000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "I imagine this whole place must be quite a sight for you - overwhelming even!"

A.response_text: "Why are you growing such large quantities of food?"

B.response_text: "How are you capable of such feats?"

D.response_text: "Why aren't you protecting these riches?"

E.response_text: "Why would I find the work of farmers impressive?"

F.response_text: "You've seen one hydroponics facility, you've seen 'em all."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.100!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Since the founding, Tambul has always been the cornucopia for the people of Kabu. The prosperity of one is to the good of all and vice versa!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "It would be foolish indeed to grow only enough for ourselves."

A.response_text: "Do the other folk of Kabu reciprocate?"

B.response_text: "So your founder was a farmer philosopher?"

E.response_text: "What a magical Utopia you must live in to be so trusting..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.200!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "The wisdom was imparted to us by none other than the Shining One himself! He gifted all peoples of Tambul with the knowledge to not only sustain themselves, but to provide for their neighbors."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.2000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "The prosperity of one is to the good of all and vice versa. Thus, it would be foolish indeed to grow only enough for ourselves."

A.response_text: "Do the other folk of Kabu reciprocate?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.300!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "You suppose? Ha! Look about you, my friend! We are not mere farmers; we are sustainers, the very givers of life!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.3000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Ours is a sacred charge, and through the learning of Biracul, we have attained mastery over plant life!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.3001!NOURI.dialogue_text: "But it is through the wisdom of our mage that we provide sustenance to all folk of Kabu - including you, stranger."

D.response_text: "And I am to believe Pakahron is infallible?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.400!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "We are! The walls are impregnable, and none are permitted to come and go without the approval of the mage."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.4000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "I doubt we would be having this pleasant conversation if Pakahron had not approved your presence here."

D.response_text: "And I'm to believe Pakahron is infallible?"

E.response_text: "What a magical Utopia you must live in to be so trusting..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.5000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Ours is a sacred charge, and through the learning of Biracul, we have attained mastery over plant life."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.5001!NOURI.dialogue_text: "But through the wisdom of our mage we, provide sustenance to all folk of Kabu - including you, stranger."

A.response_text: "Do the other folk of Kabu reciprocate?"

D.response_text: "Sounds like you deify your mage..."

E.response_text: "I'm unimpressed by your flimsy Utopia."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.600!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Ha! Surely you jest. Look about you, my friend! We are not mere farmers; we are sustainers, the very givers of life!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.6000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Ours is a sacred charge, and through the learning of Biracul, we have attained mastery over plant life."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.6001!NOURI.dialogue_text: "But it is through the wisdom of our mage we provide sustenance to all folk of Kabu - including you, stranger."

F.response_text: "Where's your tie-dyed shirt and hemp necklace?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.101!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "I will admit, there have been difficulties of late. But in the words of the Shining One himself:"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1010!NOURI.dialogue_text: "'Humans are flawed and miserable creatures, blindly consuming, dividing and multiplying like so many unseen cells. But when these beings are brought into harmony, they give rise to something that is perfect. Something beyond their simple, corporeal shells.'"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1011!NOURI.dialogue_text: "It is to this beyondness that we must dedicate yourselves."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X1012!NOUR.dialogue_text: "May you walk in His light, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.201!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps it could be said so. But listen to the Shining One's words and decide for yourself:"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.301!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Indeed, it is so. But listen to the Shining One's words and decide for yourself:"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.401!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Of course not. But the Awareness of Biracul is no deception! Listen to His words and judge for yourself:"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X601!NOURI.dialogue_text: "That is not the sort of attire common in these parts. However, perhaps some can be obtained from a traveling merchant."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.000!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Welcome! Come to admire the work of Tambul, have you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.0000!NOURI.dialogue_text: "I imagine this whole place must be quite a sight for you - overwhelming even!"

A.response_text: "Why are you growing such large quantities of food?"

B.response_text: "Is it true that folk have perished from your crops?"

D.response_text: "I've heard disturbing rumors about your labors..."

E.response_text: "Indeed. I understand your crops are sown with treachery and lies."

F.response_text: "You've seen one hydroponics facility, you've seen 'em all."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X001!NOURI.dialogue_text: "...Ahhh! Such a treat it is to smell this air, to feel its cool embrace upon us!"

A.response_text: "Indeed! But I'd like to talk about the deaths from the crops."

B.response_text: "Is it true that folk have perished from your crops?"

D.response_text: "I've heard disturbing rumors about your labors..."

E.response_text: "Indeed. I understand your crops are sown with treachery and lies."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.200!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Wha... What!? How do you know about that..?"

B.response_text: "What matters is whether the accusation is true."

D.response_text: "The question is, how will you buy my silence?"

E.response_text: "I ask the questions here!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.400!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Wha... What?!... I mean, what do you mean?"

D.response_text: "The question is, how will you buy my silence?"

E.response_text: "Do not insult me with more lies."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.101!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "That jinnlover still walks among us?! And you have his counsel?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.1010!NOURI.dialogue_text: "I warn you, stranger, he's as deceitful as the Ruby Jinn himself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.1011!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Never speak his name again! Or you'll bring doom to us all!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.1012!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Now Jinns take you away from my sight, before I call the guards!"

A.response_text: "It is you who are guilty of collusion."

E.response_text: "You're right to fear me. Who is Mifas'cul? I will not ask again."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X201!NOURI.dialogue_text: "You have no proof of anything but your word, and I assure you none would take the word of a stranger over a Tambulan Cultivator!"

D.response_text: "This isn't over."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.201!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "You have no proof of anything but your word, and I assure you none would take the word of a stranger over a Tambulan Cultivator!"

D.response_text: "Kambin's suicide speaks for itself."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X401!NOURI.dialogue_text: "You have no proof of anything but your word, and I assure you none would take the word of a stranger over a Tambulan Cultivator!"

D.response_text: "This isn't over."

E.response_text: "Spill it! What do you know about Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.401!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "You have no proof of anything but your word, and I assure you none would take the word of a stranger over a Tambulan Cultivator!"

D.response_text: "Kambin's suicide speaks for itself."

E.response_text: "Spill it! What do you know about Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X501!NOURI.dialogue_text: "It is we who were deceived by that ruby-tongued devil! But I will say no more."

D.response_text: "This isn't over."

E.response_text: "You'll speak until I tell you to stop. Now who's this Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.501!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "It is we who were deceived by that jinntongued devil! But I will say no more."

D.response_text: "Kambin's suicide speaks for itself."

E.response_text: "You'll speak until I tell you to stop. Now who's this Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.102!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "I know nothing of what you speak! I cannot even recall the dusted stranger's face... except for in my dreams."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X1020!NOUR.dialogue_text: "Now just leave me be, please; I have nothing more to say."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.4020!NOURI.dialogue_text: "You're lying! I know he fell ill, but..."

A.response_text: "Farrin said he ingested Redgrain. What does that mean?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.502!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "I don't know who he is. I... I cannot even remember his face... except for in my dreams."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.403!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Then, he's truly... gone. Just like Zebh..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.4030!NOURI.dialogue_text: "...The dreams must've overwhelmed him. Oh, I wish Zebh would've listened to me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!1.X4031!NOUR.dialogue_text: "I wish Pakahron had never taken the 'help' of that jinncursed Mifas'cul!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.001!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Hello, my friend! Bask in the sweetness that is the bounty of Kabu!"

A.response_text: "Indeed! But I'd like to talk about the deaths from the crops."

B.response_text: "Is it true that folk have perished from your crops?"

D.response_text: "I've heard disturbing rumors about your labors..."

E.response_text: "Indeed. I understand your crops are sown with treachery and lies."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.200!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "What? How do you know about that?"

A.response_text: "I read about Redgrain in the Moon Tower."

B.response_text: "What matters is whether the accusation is true."

E.response_text: "I tire of your deceit!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.400!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "What?!... I mean, what do you mean?"

A.response_text: "I read about Redgrain in the Moon Tower."

D.response_text: "The question is, how will you buy my silence?"

E.response_text: "Do not insult me with more thinly-veiled lies!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.101!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "Then, you entered the Moon Tower and stole the mage-leader's private documents?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.1010!NOURI.dialogue_text: "You must also know of Mifas'cul's involvement... or rather his 'instigation'."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.1011!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Well, I tell you he's as deceitful as the Ruby Jinn himself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.1012!NOURI.dialogue_text: "But all of this has nothing to do with me! So Jinns take you from my sight before I call the guards!"

E.response_text: "You're right to fear me. Now tell me who Mifas'cul."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.X201!NOURI.dialogue_text: "False, categorically false! Pakahron is surely already aware of your misdeeds by now and he will find you!"

D.response_text: "This isn't over."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.201!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "False, categorically false! Pakahron is surely already aware of your misdeeds by now and he will find you! And I will say no more."

D.response_text: "Kambin's suicide speaks for itself."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.X401!NOURI.dialogue_text: "It need not be purchased. Pakahron is surely already aware of your misdeeds by now and he will find you!"

D.response_text: "This isn't over."

E.response_text: "You'll shut up when I tell you to! Now speak! Who is Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.401!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "It need not be purchased. Pakahron is surely already aware of your misdeeds by now and he will find you!"

D.response_text: "Kambin's suicide speaks for itself."

E.response_text: "You'll shut up when I tell you to! Now speak! Who is Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.X501!NOURI.dialogue_text: "It is we who were deceived by that ruby-tongued devil! But I will say no more."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.5010!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Pakahron already draws near and you will answer for trespassing in the Moon Tower!"

D.response_text: "This is not over."

E.response_text: "You'll shut up when I tell you to! Now speak! Who is Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.501!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "It is we who were deceived by that ruby-tongued devil! But I will say no more."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.5011!NOURI.dialogue_text: "Pakahron already draws near and you will answer for trespassing in the Moon Tower!"

D.response_text: "Kambin's suicide speaks for itself."

E.response_text: "You'll shut up when I tell you to! Now speak! Who is Mifas'cul?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!3.000!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "I spoke not a word! I swear it on Biracul's name!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!3.001!NOURI!.dialogue_text: "You know I'd never betray you! I've been loyal to you even during the reign of Kambesh!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.000!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "Well now, Nouri, I see that you're talking to the foreigner..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X001!PAKAH.dialogue_text: "What might you have been chatting about then?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.002!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "We shall discuss this later, Nouri... extensively."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.003!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "But for now, more pressing matters demand my attention. Isn't that right, Eidos?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.004!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "It appears as though I was remiss to allow you entrance into Tambul, child."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X0040!PAKA.dialogue_text: "But we'll soon see what unholy deeds you now aim to accomplish."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.0041!PAKAH.dialogue_text: "But we'll soon see what unholy deeds you now aim to accomplish."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X100!PAKAH.dialogue_text: "As you think, so do I; as you perceive, so do I; all known to you is known to me..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X101!PAKAH.dialogue_text: "As you think, so do I; as you perceive, so do I; all known to you is known to me..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X102!PAKAH.dialogue_text: "Through your eyes, I see; through your ears hear; joined in the Spiral, we become one..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.504!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "It stands to reason that you would seek to harm the civilized people of Kabu! Then I will cast you out into the wastes where you can do no harm!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.505!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "Guards! Seize her and take her to the Dawn Fortress immediately! She is to be exiled at once!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.001!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "Not only that, but you seem to have been spending some time in my private study at the Moon Tower."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!2.002!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "I declare you an enemy of Tambul... an enemy to all Kaban people!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!3.000!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "So you seem to have been spending some time in my private study at the Moon Tower."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!4.001!PAKAHR.dialogue_text: "I won't allow some jinnloving foreigner to hinder my research!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.000!REBA!.dialogue_text: "What are you doing in the hydroponics area? You must be really bored if this place is interesting to you."

A.response_text: "I'm interested in learning about your people."

B.response_text: "But don't you depend on this place to survive?"

D.response_text: "Is there a place around here more interesting?"

E.response_text: "Perhaps I'll liven it up with some violence."

F.response_text: "'Hydrophonics?' Aren't we fancy?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.100!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Really? Why would you be interested in me?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1000!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I've worked hard all my life and all I ever amounted to was a lowly Cultivator."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1001!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I couldn't handle the artisan training in Dazir and now I ended up here... as a total failure."

A.response_text: "I don't think you're a failure! You feed everyone with your work!"

B.response_text: "Why are you such a negative person?"

E.response_text: "I should kill you and spare your fellows from your pointless laments."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.200!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Yes. And all it does is remind me of how pointless my life is."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.2000!REBA!.dialogue_text: "It makes me sick to think of all the jinnlicking fools who sit happily chewing on these carrots, watered with my tears."

A.response_text: "Your life isn't pointless! You feed everyone with your work!"

B.response_text: "Why are you such a negative person?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.300!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Yeah, you're right; you didn't really say that, did you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.3000!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I'm just a draug-brained fool, always making stupid mistakes like that. I guess that's why I'm sitting here tending to these bean poles - but I'll probably muck this up sooner or later, too..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.3001!REBA!.dialogue_text: "My father, back in Dazir, always said I had the brain of a bean - guess he was right..."

B.response_text: "Why are you such a negative person?"

D.response_text: "So, you have knowledge of Dazir?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.400!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Oh, I see. You want to leave, don't you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.4001!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I mean, no one wants to talk to me - not even my own brother back in Dazir."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.4002!REBA!.dialogue_text: "That's how I wound up here, friendless and futureless..."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.4003!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I had so much ambition back in Dazir, so much passion, but fate robbed me of those and left me with nothing."

D.response_text: "So, you have knowledge of Dazir?"

E.response_text: "I should kill you and spare your fellows from your pointless laments."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.500!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I hope you do! Biracul knows, my face might look better with some bruises on it."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.5000!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I'm so ugly, all I was fit for was tending to the potatoes my face so clearly resembles."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.5001!REBA!.dialogue_text: "If I wasn't such a coward, I'd go back to Dazir and take what's coming to me."

A.response_text: "Look, you feed everyone! Without you, society would collapse."

D.response_text: "So, you have knowledge of Dazir?"

E.response_text: "I should kill you and spare your fellows from your pointless laments."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.600!REBA!.dialogue_text: "No, I said 'hydroponics'. But Biracul knows, I could use some phonics lessons."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.6000!REBA!.dialogue_text: "In my youth, I attempted to become a Daziran artisan. But it turned out like everything else I've ever done: a complete disaster."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.6001!REBA!.dialogue_text: "That'll be how people will remember me, as the miserable failure that I am and always will be."

F.response_text: "Well, I'll forget all about you in five minutes, and I guess others will too!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1010!REBA!.dialogue_text: "No one has ever said that to me before! Thank you so much!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1011!REBA!.dialogue_text: "With this encouragement, I think I just might have the strength to keep on tending these plants."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.1012!REBA!.dialogue_text: "People need me! And now I think I need you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X1013!REBA.dialogue_text: "I would pay you back, but, like I said, I'm a complete loser; so, I don't know anything useful."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X401!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Well, obviously I'm well-read, but why should I tell you anything? You don't care at all about me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X501!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Just make it quick and painless, and be thorough about it - I don't want to fail at dying, too."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X601!REBA!.dialogue_text: "What? You're such a terrible monster! Why would you say something like that!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.8910!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I thought you were a kind person!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.8911!REBA!.dialogue_text: "If you hated me so much, the least you could have done is tell me to my face that you never want to see me again!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X8912!REBA.dialogue_text: "I must have been the Jinn's fool to think you cared for me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X895!REBA!.dialogue_text: "I'm such a worthless wretch... Please pay me no more mind."

KABU!TAMBUL!HYDROPONIC FARM!0.X899!REBA!.dialogue_text: "Jinns take you! I've nothing more to say."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos walks towards the silver spire towering over the township of Tambul. From this vantage point, it is difficult to tell how this structure was built. By all appearances, it is composed of a number of interlocking plates, though there are no signs of rivets or welds - the seams are more aesthetic choice than pragmatic necessity.\n\n\t\tThis brilliant spire stands in stark contrast to the fortification that surrounds it. Blocks of sandstone form a modest keep around the tower, with walls both thick and high. The gates leading from the residential area and into the keep stand open, implying all have access to it.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Walking within the fort structure, Eidos detects two points of interest: the tower proper to the left, and to the right, the ethereal gate leading out onto Heaven's Bridge.

B.response_text: Explore to the right and to the bridge

C.response_text: Explore to the left and towards the tower entrance

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the keep entrance. One of three locations awaits her immediate attention: the Moon Tower, Heaven's Bridge, or the residential area.

B.response_text: Explore to the right and to the bridge

C.response_text: Explore to the left and towards the tower entrance

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text:
Walking through the keep structure, Eidos enters a courtyard. The shimmering, doorless gate here permits a limited view of the canyon. While the sight of this deep scar in the earth’s skin is truly breath-taking, it is eclipsed by the feat of unfathomable engineering spanning it, Heaven's Bridge.

		Likely wrought by the same hands responsible for the Moon Tower, this bridge too consists of perfectly interlocking metallic pieces, like scales on an impossibly large serpent. Stretching out across the chasm, it slithers through the air absent any support structures and yet miraculously remains solid and unmoving.

		The sight is made even stranger by virtue of the massive archway hanging over the bridge entrance. There is some kind of visual distortion bending light at the threshold, as if a thin film of superheated air hung suspended between the metal pillars.

		Eidos sees that the courtyard wraps around the tower and that there is a staircase leading to the top of the ramparts overlooking the canyon.

C.response_text: Climb the stairs to the top of the wall

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos moves to walk through the transparent distortion in the gateway. A guard frantically scrambles to get her attention, grabbing her by the arm and firmly pulling her away from the gate.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guard quickly searches the ground for a loose stone and picks it up, only to then ceremoniously cast it through the distortion. It connects with the shimmering air, causing a violent reaction to take place. The rock dissolves from within, leaving not a single trace the thing had ever existed.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Deciding not to cross at this time, Eidos turns back.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.103!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Though a one-way trip it may be, perhaps it will be worth the journey.

A.response_text: Continue on to the Dawn Fortress

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.199!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: At the gates, the guards bind Eidos' hands behind her back with a rather dry and abrasive length of cord. Then, they cover her head with a burlap sack, blocking out all light except for the meager rays that pass through the gaps in the weaving.\n\n\t\tShe hears whispers around her of townfolk murmuring about "Inscrutable", "the Wasteland", "Draugs", "Ormenos" and "Rikharr". Then a guard brutishly shoves her indicating that their slow march to her exile has begun.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.201!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Walking through the keep structure, Eidos finally comes to see the base of the tower. Up close, the staggering size of the tower is more evident than ever. So wide is it, that its circular base seems to draw a straight line in either direction. So unfathomably tall is it, that its top appears to taper to a single point upwards into infinity.\n\n\t\tThe tower, however, is less inviting than the keep, as its front door is closed and flanked by guards. Eidos sees no way to access the bridge from here, but soon spies what appears to be a path leading around to the back of the tower.

B.response_text: Explore the far side of the tower

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.300!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
Circumnavigating the base for several minutes, she notes the third or fourth stories begin to sprout hundreds of windows, giving it the unsettling semblance of a metallic honeycomb. Within the span of a hundred paces, she stumbles upon a narrow stairway leading up.

		She climbs and climbs until she reaches a landing atop the walls, and the vistas it affords.

		Casting her gaze out over the canyon, she absorbs the wonders of the landscape both natural and artificial. To the east, a sprawling fortress stands between her and a black point melting into the horizon. To the north of the inky dot is a sea of sparkling white. To the south, nothing but dust and sand.

		A gentle breeze blows in from the west, cooling her sun-baked skin and carrying with it the desert's lifeless scent.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X301!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Disrupting the serenity of the scene is the sound of somewhat muffled, scratching footsteps.

B.response_text: Search for the source of the sound

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.302!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Surveying the region more closely, she sees nothing resembling life beyond city walls. They are locked in an ocean of sandy desolation. To the north beyond the sand, appears to be what could be far off hills, or unreachably distant mountains. To the south, nothing but dust and sand.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.303!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos frantically hunts for the source to the left and then the right, spotting nothing, as the wind howls by mockingly. Cocking an eyebrow, she decides to blame it on the mischievous wind.\n\n\t\tWith a sigh of relief, she cranes her neck and begins to rub out the tension. Only then does she notice that a rope dangles down from an opened window, wagging its tail excitedly as a man climbs towards the opening.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X311!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: In a flash, the man slips away over the edge of the landing, leaving nothing behind but an open window and a mystery.

B.response_text: Climb up and into the window

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.312!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: At Eidos' call for the guards, while the man tries to slither away over the landing. However, below awaits a group of nearby spearsmen alerted by Eidos' call. The guards promptly restrain and bind him."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.3120!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The trapped man glowers at Eidos as the guards escort him away. This is the look of a man who does not soon forget slights against him.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.313!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: After a moment, the man rushes to the window and slides down the length of rope. His pursuers, hot on his trail, soon appear at the window. He hops over the edge of the landing, and right into a group of guards alerted by Eidos' call. They proceed to violently restrain and bind him.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X321!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Mere moments later, the man emerges and slides down his rope, right in front of Eidos. With only the slightest bit of surprise detectable upon his face, he regards her, calculating, assessing, scheming.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.331!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos clumsily climbs up the rope, gripping with all her might, attempting not to become a victim of gravity and the ground's conspiracy against her.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.X100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos returns to Heaven's Bridge and thus, the destructive gate.

B.response_text: Climb the stairs to the top of the wall

F.response_text: Return to the keep entrance

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.300!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As the commotion settles down, she renews her inspection of the surroundings. To the southeast, still within the walls of Tambul, she sees a covered portion on the ramparts, standing in stark contrast to its naked neighbors.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.3000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As this thought fades into memory, she hears the tolling of a thick bell. Once. Twice. And on the third ring, a body, stiff as a corpse, appears to fly out from the covered area and into the canyon below. The ghastly sight sears itself into her retinas, leaving a temporary, flashing impression replaying itself over and over in her until it too fades.

B.response_text: Stay and watch to see if something happens

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.3001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Blinking away the last few specks of the afterimage, Eidos stares down at the roof like a hawk eyeing its noon meal. Watching, waiting, expecting. She overreacts to the slightest sounds or visuals suggesting motion. Constantly vigilant..."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.3002!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: "But nothing happens. No bells, no flying bodies, nothing. It is then she realizes all she can do is resume her journey.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.301!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Eidos scales back down to the landing with as little grace as she ascended - a miracle she did not slip and fall, truly. Her muscles taught with tension and overexertion, she plops down, back against the tower, to catch her breath. Gradually recuperating strength, she begins to breathe with greater ease. And soon she has gathered the strength to rise and start her descent.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.302!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Once on the landing, Eidos looks out over all the familiar sights. The canyon out east, the fortress at the end of the bridge, that inky spot in the middle of the dust and sand, and the sparkling white north of it. Suddenly curious about the window, Eidos looks up and sees only a flat, seamless scale in its place, almost as if its very existence had been stricken from reality.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!77.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Night has fallen upon the region of Kabu and only a handful of torches and crystals illuminate scattered patches of the ramparts. Assala scales the walls with a simian-like grace, disappearing over the top. Moments later, a length of rope crawls down the wall and Assala signals Eidos to grab hold. Upon doing so, Eidos is rapidly hoisted up to the top by Assala's absurd strength. The two, now standing in the Tambulan mortuary, begin to slowly descend toward the gate via a cramped stairwell.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!77.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Assala signals Eidos to hold her position as she glides over to subdue the solitary guard manning the gate. Her hand quietly slips over the guard's mouth as her knife silently slips across his neck. Before his limp Falseflesh hits the ground, Assala is already moving to disarm the gate. She removes the amethyst controlling the barrier from its casing. In complete silence, the barrier disappears, affording them the chance to steal across the bridge towards the Sun Keep and the Dawn Fortress beyond.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0099.000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly through the Keep towards her. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.X000!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.100!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.101!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.102!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.103!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.104!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.105!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!999.106!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X000!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls! You almost got yourself dissolved, lady!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.000!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Get it now?! That could've been you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.001!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Look, I don't know where you came from, but it's obvious you're not from around Kabu, at least."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.X0010!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "So lemme explain two things to you."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.0011!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Number one, the Tacribians on the other side of the bridge're on the brink of committing a Daziran genocide, something to do with a water dispute - but I don't know, nor do I care to find out the details of their conflict..."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.0012!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Which brings me to number two, if you wanna cross, we'll lower the barrier, but I'm afraid you won't be coming back in after that."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.0013!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Pakahron made it abundantly clear to us that, even if Biracul himself came a-knocking, nothing gets in from the other side. So with that in mind, it's your call, lady."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.X000!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "You're back again? Don't tell me you plan on crossing..."

F.response_text: "On second thought, I'll just remain in Tambul, for now."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!2.X000!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "The water problem has been solved, but for the time being, Pakahron has said to keep the gate up and now no one gets in OR out through here. So move along, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!3.X000!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Look, outlander, I'm not exactly itching to have a conversation, so please leave."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!10.001!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Jinns take you from me, you lunatic!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!10.X002!BRUS!.dialogue_text: "Just leave, before I push you through the barrier myself!"

B.response_text: "Why'd you climb the tower through the window?"

C.response_text: "I heard nothing and saw even less. Just leave please."

D.response_text: "I wonder what the guards would have to say about your acrobatics..?"

E.response_text: "Tell me why you went in there."

F.response_text: "Find any gremlins, Darling?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.001!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I don't suppose you'd believe me if I said I was afraid of low places and sought some relief up high?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.0010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "No? Well, perhaps you might just consider letting me off with a warning; you see, my family is expecting me home for supper..."

A.response_text: "I'm afraid we'll have to let the guards and Pakahron decide."

B.response_text: "You can conceal your reasons from me, but what about Pakahron?"

C.response_text: "Fine. Leave, as long as I won't be involved."

D.response_text: "Surely me turning a blind eye must be worth something?"

E.response_text: "I'll just have to kill you and go find out for myself."

F.response_text: "Heights are majestic for they are the domain of Roostor!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!0.002!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I'm sure they'd be impressed by this itinerant acrobat's feats of climbing, just as you surely are!"

D.response_text: "Wait!"

E.response_text: "Stop now or I'll tear you limb from limb!"

A.response_text: "You're Dysmas, right? What brings you to the tower?"

B.response_text: "I remember you. What were you doing inside the tower?"

C.response_text: "Fine. Leave, as long as I won't be involved."

D.response_text: "What the guards would have to say about your acrobatics, Dysmas, was it?"

E.response_text: "I remember you from Dazir, you ape. Tell me why you went in there."

F.response_text: "Find any gremlins, Dysmas Maximus?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.001!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Your memory is better than most, it seems..."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.0010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "But as for the nature of my visit, I don't suppose you'd believe me if I said I was afraid of low places and sought some relief up high?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.0011!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "No? Well, perhaps you might just consider letting me off with a warning; you see, my family is expecting me home for supper..."

A.response_text: "I'm afraid we'll have to let the guards and Pakahron decide, Dysmas."

B.response_text: "You can conceal your reasons from me, but what about Pakahron?"

C.response_text: "Fine. Leave, as long as I won't be involved."

D.response_text: "Surely me turning a blind eye must be worth something, old friend?"

E.response_text: "I'll just have to kill you and go find out for myself."

F.response_text: "Heights are majestic! For they're the domain of Roostor!"

C.response_text: "Fine. Leave, as long as I won't be involved."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.200!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Magesight can peer into all but the Unseen's minds, and I'm no Unseen... though that has no bearing on my current situation as it is Khlutt who conducts the trials in Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.2000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I wonder, though if I could trade some information with you in exchange for my freedom..."

A.response_text: "This is for Pakahron to decide, not me. Guards!"

C.response_text: "I have no dog in this fight. Just leave."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.300!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Thank you, generous host! I shall not forget your leniency!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.400!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well then, perhaps it'd interest you to know that this spire hides more than the 'benevolent' mage of Tambul would like for anyone to know..."

D.response_text: "Go on."

E.response_text: "That'll do! Guards!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.101!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "You, wretched woman! Believe me when I say that I will not forget this!"

A.response_text: "Remembrance is the first step to atonement."

B.response_text: "Your actions brought about this result; blaming me is pointless."

E.response_text: "Where you're going, you're better off remembering not to drop the soap."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.401!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Not a fan of subtlety, I see."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.4010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, okay then, how's this: Pakahron has been up to no good, and this tower contains evidence of his misdeeds..."

C.response_text: "I see no point in continuing this conversation. Leave now."

D.response_text: "What evidence did you find then?"

E.response_text: "Speak no more! Guards!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.601!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "You're quite the... peculiar... woman. But I thank you for the lovely chat. I'll be on my way now!"

F.response_text: "May the Feathered One's caw, keep you safe from gremlins. Buck-awk!!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.302!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Then I bid you farewell, milady. I won't forget your leniency!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON KEEP!1.402!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "For one a strange crystal - though I know not what it contains. There were also several interesting documents and records here and there."

C.response_text: "Leave now and I don't want to see you again."

D.response_text: "Leave? Yes, of course; let me call your escorts. Guards!"

E.response_text: "Allow me to send you off... this cliff and into the canyon."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.X001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: One hand on the rope, the other reaches up to grab hold of the windowsill. Pulling herself up and over the sill feels just as difficult as the entire climb had up to that point. Eidos breathes slowly, smoothly and relaxes her tensed muscles. She then quickly surveys the room and notices that among the myriad crystals and various whatnots is a shelf, packed with tomes. Then, scanning for the person she pursued up this spire, she sees him replacing a crystal in among a whole wall of them. Sensing her presence, the man turns and looks right at her, sizing her up, evaluating how much of a threat she may pose.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos hurls the crystal at the ground. As it leaves her hand, time fragments into seemingly infinite, discreet intervals.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text:
The sound of shattering fills the air.

		A blinding light is released from within.

		A crackling.

		Intense heat.

		More crystals fall from the lattice.

		A chain reaction.

		A shock wave.

		Eidos is cast out through the window.

		Over an archway.

		Into the gargantuan canyon below.

		Falling.

		The spire falls.

		Hitting the gate.

		Both follow in her wake.

		The impact.

		White.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.302!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Instinct becomes will, will then becoming thought. An image slowly forms, burning out lines from the void. A circle manifests, weaving an intricate tapestry of lines, never crossing, as they traverse dimensions linking paths among them. And soon, the Glyph of Fenrir is fully formed, completing the reaction.\n\n\t\tThe red, crystalline energy begins to seep in through the veins in her hands, crawling, spreading like some volatile disease. When the slithering ooze reaches her mind, it seizes her in its grips, flashing images of past putrefaction before her mind's eye.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.303!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text:
A massive sphere of light.

		A union with its twin.

		Their separation.

		Men, women, bearded, wizened, youthful, tall, short, fat, thin... rotting.

		Bones dissolving.

		Kambesh.

		Pakahron.

		Water.

		Fathom.

		Khaa...

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.305!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As the visions wane, her awareness of a new Glyph waxes. At her whim, all would disintegrate.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.306!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The assimilation complete, she now observes her surroundings. All Eidos sees are numerous crystals, both empty and charged, and a shelf practically bursting with tomes.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.X500!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Eidos searches through the writings, and finds one on the topic of Redgrain that catches her eye.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.500!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos but glances at the writings, and finds the memories of the nefarious Redgrain flood to the forefront of her consciousness. She need not be reminded of the case of Zebh and his unfortunate family.\n\n\t\tBut then, the sound of footsteps fast approaching breaks the silence and signals her to leave the Moon Tower.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.501!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos quickly extracts the information from the tome, committing it to memory.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.503!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Suddenly, the sound of footsteps fast in their approach breaks the silence and signals her to leave the Moon Tower.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.550!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Eidos examines the crystalline array, one in particular stands out to her. It is not quite as the others are, slightly misaligned to the left. Picking it up, she feels a revolting sensation of corruption course through her. Her stomach twists itself in knots, as though attempting to wring out the vile impurity of the Glyph.\n\n\t\tWithout a shadow of a doubt, this crystal contains something nefarious.

F.response_text: Destroy the crystal

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.900!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: A door-like panel in the wall begins to fold in on itself, halving again and again until no door remains. Standing outside the portal is Tambul's mage-leader, Pakahron. In no mood to chat, he rushes in and scrutinizes the surroundings, easily surmising what Eidos has been up to. Now he appears as though he is in no mood to even let Eidos leave... He begins to move...

A.response_text: Try to persuade Pakahron to let you go

E.response_text: Fight the goat-licking jinnspawn!

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.901!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Unlike the reticent Eidos, Pakahron wastes no time, calling to mind a Glyph. Within the space of a thought, Eidos begins to feel a searing pain ripping her apart from the inside out. She collapses to her knees. An eternity passes before the pain subsides, only doing so because nearly all of her Falseflesh has already disintegrated. Only her bodiless head remains. Yet, as her eyes melt away from her Falseflesh, she catches a final glimpse of Pakahron smirking smugly.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Surveying the room, Eidos notices that among the myriad crystals and various whatnots is a shelf, packed to bursting with tomes.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!2.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Not needing to be told twice, Dysmas flips soundlessly and effortlessly towards the window. Then, just as though he were swimming through the very air, he dives through the window, presumably catching his rope as he falls.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!2.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: After the brilliant acrobatics the mysterious Dysmas performed, Eidos finds herself unwittingly applauding. Recovering from her momentary awe, she now takes a moment to survey the room, noticing that among the myriad crystals and various whatnots is a shelf, packed to bursting with tomes.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!5.000!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Dysmas finishes his sentence, he flings the crystal in an arc towards Eidos, while simultaneously darting towards the window.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!5.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As Eidos focuses on catching the crystal, Dysmas steals away toward the window. Juggling the fragile crystal in her hands, she finally manages to secure it with both hands. By the time she can give chase, Dysmas has already vanished through the window and is now nothing but a memory.

F.response_text: Destroy the crystal

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!5.100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos hurls the crystal at the ground. As it leaves her hand, time fragments into seemingly infinite, discreet intervals.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!5.101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text:
The sound of shattering fills the air.

		A blinding light is released from within.

		A crackling.

		Intense heat.

		More crystals fall from the lattice.

		A chain reaction.

		A shock wave.

		Eidos is cast out through the window.

		Over an archway.

		Into the gargantuan canyon below.

		Falling.

		The spire falls.

		Hitting the gate.

		Both follow in her wake.

		The impact.

		White.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!5.900!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Eidos gives chase. A terrified Dysmas looks back to see she has let the crystal fall. He picks up speed. The crystal comes ever closer to the hard, metal flooring. Time fragments into seemingly infinite, discreet intervals.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!5.901!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text:
The sound of shattering fills the air.

		A blinding light is released from within.

		A crackling.

		Intense heat.

		More crystals fall from the lattice.

		A chain reaction.

		A shock wave.

		Eidos is cast out through the window.

		Over an archway.

		Into the gargantuan canyon below.

		Falling.

		The spire falls.

		Hitting the gate.

		Both follow in her wake.

		The impact.

		White.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!10.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Walking along the outside edges of the city walls, Eidos arrives at a precipice. She can see the silver spire towering above the ramparts of the keep surrounding it. Shifting her gaze downwards, she notices that there appears to be a path of questionable safety leading down into the canyon below. Such a reckless path could only lead to ruin...

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!10.001!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Having scaled the craggy path, Eidos attains the summit and the safety of the Tambulan walls.

F.response_text: Descend the path... again

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0099.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly towards her. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!999.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.X000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Now what brings you to a place like this..?"

B.response_text: "Why'd you climb the tower through the window?"

C.response_text: "I heard nothing and saw even less. Just leave please."

D.response_text: "I wonder what the guards would have to say about your acrobatics..?"

E.response_text: "I ask the questions here! What are you up to?!"

F.response_text: "Find any gremlins, Darling?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.001!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Oh, nothing much... Say, I don't suppose you'd believe me if I said I was afraid of low places and sought some relief up high?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.0010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "No? Well, perhaps you might just consider letting me off with a warning; you see, my family is expecting me home for supper."

A.response_text: "I'd just look like an accomplice if I called the guards now."

B.response_text: "You can conceal your reasons from me, but can you from Pakahron?"

C.response_text: "Fine. Leave, as long as I won't be involved."

D.response_text: "Surely me turning a blind eye must be worth something?"

E.response_text: "I'll just have to kill you and find out for myself."

F.response_text: "Heights are majestic for they are the domain of Roostor!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!0.002!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I'm sure they'd be impressed by this itinerant acrobat's feats of climbing, just as you surely are!"

D.response_text: "Wait!"

E.response_text: "Stop now or I'll tear you limb from limb!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Fancy meeting you in a place like this..."

A.response_text: "You're Dysmas, right? What brings you to the tower?"

B.response_text: "I remember you. What were you doing inside the tower?"

C.response_text: "I heard nothing and saw even less. Just leave please."

D.response_text: "What would the guards have to say about your acrobatics, Dysmas, was it?"

E.response_text: "I remember you from Dazir, you ape. Tell me why you came in here!"

F.response_text: "Find any gremlins, Dysmas Maximus?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.001!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "But as for the nature of my visit, I don't suppose you'd believe me if I said I was afraid of low places and sought some relief up high?"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.002!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "No? Well, perhaps you might just consider letting me off with a warning; you see, my family is expecting me home for supper..."

A.response_text: "I'd just look like an accomplice if I called the guards now."

B.response_text: "You can conceal your reasons from me, but can you from Pakahron?"

C.response_text: "Fine. Leave, as long as I won't be involved."

D.response_text: "Surely me turning a blind eye must be worth something, old friend?"

E.response_text: "I'll just have to kill you and go find out for myself."

F.response_text: "Heights are majestic for they are the domain of Roostor!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.100!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Undoubtedly so! I suppose your best bet is to simply let me be on my merry way, then..."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.200!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Magesight can peer into all but the Unseen's minds, and no Unseen... though that has no bearing on my current situation, as it's Khlutt who conducts the trials in Kabu."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.2000!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "I wonder, though, if I could trade some information with you in exchange for my freedom..."

C.response_text: "I have no dog in this fight."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.300!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Thank you, generous host! I shall not forget your leniency!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.400!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Well, then perhaps it would interest you to know that this spire hides more than the 'benevolent' mage of Tambul would like for us to know..."

D.response_text: "Go on."

E.response_text: "Good enough, now leave or learn firsthand what 'defenestration' is."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.401!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Not a fan of subtlety, I see. Pakahron has been up to no good and this tower contains evidence of his misdeeds."
