C.response_text: "I see no point in continuing this conversation. Just leave."

D.response_text: "What evidence did you find then?"

E.response_text: "Good to know. Now leave or you'll get a free flying lesson."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.601!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "You're a... peculiar... woman. But I thank you for the lovely chat."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.6010!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Now, if you'll excuse me, I'll be on my way!"

F.response_text: "May the Feathered One's caw, keep you safe from gremlins. Buck-awk!!"

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.402!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "For one, several interesting documents and records referencing Pakahron's unethical experimentation with Red Grain..."

KABU!TAMBUL!MOON TOWER!1.4020!DYSMAS!.dialogue_text: "Oh yes, and this crystal is mighty suspicious as well. Here have it."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.000!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: As Eidos alights at the top of the stairs, she arrives at another, smaller courtyard, this one covered with a thatch roof. In the shade stands a man, decked out in a heavy leather apron and matching leather gloves, both with dark splotches splattered all over. At the center is a blanketed object resting upon a table. The man, walks over towards the table and begins to peel off the covering, revealing a rather grim sight.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.001!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text:
The bloated corpse of a dead man lies there, wan and motionless. Though miraculously the stench of death is absent. Hung upon the walls are numerous concoctions, some bubbling absent fire, others constantly shifting color, but not a single unremarkable one among them.

		The man attending the body is in his middle years. Heavyset and mustachioed, he looks more butcher than mortician. He performs his chores with the utmost precision and detachment, cleaning the cadaver and then rubbing ointments all over it.

		Large gashes made in the neck indicate the body has been drained of blood prior to this treatment ritual. Several corpses strung upside down over a vat at the far end of the area serve to confirm this suspicion.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X002!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Looking down from this vantage point, Eidos sees that these walls overlook another ghastly sight, for in the canyon, far below, lies a veritable mountain of bones. She can also make a pair of minuscule, fuzzy points near the pile and another one next to the grisly mound.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.003!DESCRIPTION!.dialogue_text: Standing in this charnel loft, Eidos looks down upon the mountain of bones on the canyon floor. In death, all are equal here. Perhaps that is their only consolation.

B.response_text: Talk to the body preparer again

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0099.000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly up the stairway towards her. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.X000!DESCRIPTIO.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.001!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.100!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.101!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.102!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.103!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.104!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.105!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!999.106!DESCRIPTION.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "What in the name of the Obsidian Jinn's black arse are you doin' up here, outlander?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You some kind of necrophile? That means death-lover, in case you're as dumb as you look."

A.response_text: "I'm sorry if I offended you. I'm simply exploring."

D.response_text: "Yes, clever. Now tell me, what do you do up here?"

E.response_text: "If I were, there's little you could do about it."

F.response_text: "Did want to be a nec-romancer once, but my college didn't offer the major."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.1000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Why, I remember meetin' a Jeran from a caravan back in the days of Kambesh who was horrified that we cast our dead into the Crescent Canyon."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.1001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "These bones are nothin' to us but a reminder of the weakness of the Falseflesh. So not much to explore here."

A.response_text: "What are those people doing down there?"

E.response_text: "Some flesh is weaker than others."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.200!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I'll admit that the Moon Tower is indeed fascinatin'. However, I can't quite say the same of this corpse."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.2000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "These bones are nothin' to us but a reminder of the weakness of the Falseflesh. "

A.response_text: "What are those people doing down there?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.300!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Well, see to it that your purpose doesn't send you fallin' over the ramparts into the canyon, or you'll find yourself becomin' personally acquainted with the bones."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.3000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "And worse yet, I'd have to explain to Pakahron how I let a clueless visitor kill her own fool self."

D.response_text: "Why is that man guarding the bone pile down there?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.400!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "What does it look like? I'm preparin' a corpse to be catapulted over the ramparts!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.4000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Y'know what? I'll bet you a jug of Jinn-Liquor I hit those Tacribian oafs guardin' the bone pile."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.4001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I'd wager more, but this poor lard-sack is too fat for me to have much confidence."

D.response_text: "Why guard bones? There must be something of value down there..."

E.response_text: "I'd wager you're too weak to even lift that body."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.500!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You're right 'bout that, friend; I'm not so skilled in combat."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.5000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Though the same can't be said 'bout those guards down in the keep."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.5001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "But in any case, there's no reason to get all jinncrazed 'bout this body."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.5002!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "The bones you see down there are nothin' to us but a reminder of the weakness of the Falseflesh."

A.response_text: "What are those people doing down there?"

D.response_text: "If this is so, why is that man guarding worthless bones?"

E.response_text: "Some flesh is weaker than others."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.600!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Necromancer? Oh, wait a jinnpickin' minute, so you hoped to find some kind of death magic here? Not gonna happen, sweet cheeks!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.6000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Look, I've also read the works of Torma the Wayfarer that spoke of foreign mage frauds who claimed to use Techne without the Path of Awareness. Blood Wizards, Shadow Walkers and Jinn Speakers."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.6001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "But trust me, I work with bodies all the time, and there's 'bout as much power in them as there is in my stool."

E.response_text: "I doubt there's even any power in your entire body."

F.response_text: "Great! May I have a sample? I can be an excremancer!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.101!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Well, my best guess is that the guards down there are guardin' and the mourner is mournin'."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X1010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Though, maybe they're just awaitin' my dramatic re-enactment of Archmage Ark vs. the Jinnwraith Rikharr. Y'know, their fateful descent into the canyon!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.201!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "It's part of Pakahron's economic renewal program. He needed to make more jobs so he decreed that all bodies, metal surfaces and arses needed cleanin' by proper specialists such as myself."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X2010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Just so you know, I'm just as good at washin' live bodies as I am dead ones, if you have need of my services."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.301!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Lost? Well, let me be your tour guide then - it's not like I have a job or anythin'!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.3010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Right, so that big metal thin' is the Moon Tower, the main attraction of Tambul. And Tambul itself is the greatest and oldest of Kaban settlements, the very center of culture, life and prosperity in the Kabu region."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.3011!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Outside of these walls are the followin': sand, dust, more sand, truth-blind savages, sand, learned savages... sand, rocks, mountains, dry riverbeds, and, you guessed it, plenty of sunshine!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X3012!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "However, Tambul is my homeland so, perhaps I'm a little biased. Maybe you'd like slummin' it somewhere else."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.401!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Biracul steal your eyes! You uncovered our evil plan!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.4010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "How did you discover that we were hidin' the fabled Turd of Famlaz under the bones of our deceased!?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.4011!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You must surely be the chosen one!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X4012!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Make haste from this place and claim your prize, great hero!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X501!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Not to worry, my sweet! While I may not have the physique of a Tacribian, I'm sure my love muscle is plenty strong for you! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!0.X601!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Come back after I've eaten my bran bread and we'll talk."

F.response_text: "Or I could just reach in and get it myself, if you prefer!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls! You're as curious as the Emerald Jinn himself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "What is it you want, outlander? Don't tell me you need some company from old Boz?"

A.response_text: "You're quite an irreverent tender of the dead."

B.response_text: "Why do you throw bodies from the walls?"

D.response_text: "Why are those guards down there?"

E.response_text: "I want to stitch that festering wound you call a mouth."

F.response_text: "I'm looking for loot. Any gold or magic items buried down there?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.1000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Reverence towards the dead is a mistake made by heathens and superstitious fools. Else, it's just an affectation by the learned to exploit those superstitious fools."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.1001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I myself prepared Archmage Kambesh's body when folk demanded he be buried as one of them - a testament to how well he controlled the hearts and minds of the truth-blind."

A.response_text: "Then why's that person down there mourning the dead?"

B.response_text: "Do all the folk of Kabu practice this rite?"

E.response_text: "Why not simply destroy the bodies?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.200!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Reverence towards the dead is a mistake made by heathens and superstitious fools. Else, it's just an affectation by the learned to exploit those superstitious fools."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.2000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I myself prepared Kambesh's body when folk demanded he be buried as one of them - a testament to how well he controlled the hearts and minds of the truth-blind."

A.response_text: "Then why's that person down there mourning the dead?"

B.response_text: "Do all the folk of Kabu practice this rite?"

D.response_text: "Why not simply destroy the bodies?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.400!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Well, one of them is a run of the mill Tacribian warrior, just there because he was told to be."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.4000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "The other is a Valvorthr, she may be here to make sure the dead don't come back to life... Or maybe it's to warn us if the Jinnwraith returns... I guess it could even be to alert the Kaban people if Ark returns..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.4001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Difficult to say what truly motivates a fanatic."

B.response_text: "Do all the folk of Kabu practice this rite?"

D.response_text: "Why not simply destroy the bodies?"

E.response_text: "Yet they or I could tear you to shreds."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.500!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You see? So easy to set you off into a rage! The inevitable result of livin' a life governed by emotion."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.5000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You see those fools down there in the Valley of Bones? The guards and the mourner? They're all leadin' emotional lives!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.5001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "The warriors think the bone pile gives them purpose, while the mourner thinks he gains a connection."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.5002!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "None of them know anythin' of the Path of Awareness!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.5003!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "So you see my annoyance, as my efforts are fallin' upon blind eyes... Ha! Fallin'."

A.response_text: "Then why's that person down there mourning the dead?"

D.response_text: "Why not simply destroy the bodies?"

E.response_text: "Yet they or I could tear you to shreds."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.600!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Why would we throw valuable treasure into a pile of worthless bodies?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.6000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Is it your custom to keep diamonds and jewels in your latrine?"

F.response_text: "Well, duh! Keeps the weirdos away! Obviously - what an idiot..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.101!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "What you see reflects a human need, not a truth."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.1010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "The Tacribians burn their dead because they fear death; believin' that corpses might suffer the wraithglow like the very draugnir the spend their lives fightin'."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.1011!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "The Dazirans generally send their dead to us to be cast out into the canyon as a reminder of Ark's sacrifice, but they keep the corpses of their magi. And there's really no tellin' what becomes of those bodies - though, I'm sure the Daziran Artisans know, at least."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.X1012!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Y'know that rumor has it they crack open the skulls and preserve the brains... Wouldn't surprise me, given that they worship their magi like they were Biracul returned!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.201!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "No, only Tambul is faithful to the old ways."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.401!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Can't contemplate death without some hard evidence you yourself are gonna die, now can you?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.4010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "All rites reflect a need, not a truth."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.501!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I don't doubt it, stranger! But your desire to hurt me reflects a need, not a truth; so, can't say I fear you, kid."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.X5010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You'd best be on your way then.."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!1.X601!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Well, I'd give my left nut to learn how your people got you to leave their village - it'd certainly come in handy right 'bout now."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!2.X000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I'd rather not chat anymore, kid; gotta job to do!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "No more chat, sweetness; I'm up to my balls in corpses these days it seems."

D.response_text: "I imagine you learn much from these dead."

E.response_text: "I wonder who'd wash your corpse if you called me that again."

F.response_text: "You're welcome for the business!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.100!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Kambin. A singin' cultivator with a wife and a kid on the way."

E.response_text: "I'd kill myself too if I were born a Tambulan."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.200!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "...I guess you haven't met this corpse's former co-worker, a Daziran named Reba."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.2000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Thank Biracul - AND all the Jinns in the Graylands - that she didn't choose to apprentice here, else I'd be the one tyin' a rope 'round my neck!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.300!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "And a fine job it is too!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.3000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "So fine, in fact, that I haven't taken on an apprentice..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.3001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Though, I suppose I should count my blessin's; I mean, if I had an apprentice like Reba, I'd dive over these walls straight into the bone pile."

C.response_text: "You think Reba drove Kambin to his death?"

D.response_text: "I wonder who'll be next..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.400!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "You could say that. Though, I suspect even without ever cleaning the crap out of Kambin's arse crack I'd have known that workin' with Reba is bad for your health..."

C.response_text: "You think Reba drove Kambin to his death?"

D.response_text: "I wonder who'll be next."

E.response_text: "I feel the same way about you..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.500!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Oh, you don't have to kill me if you want to give me a good washin', my figpie!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.5000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "But if you did want to do me in, my guess is that they'd send Reba to be the next body preparer..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.5001!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Not that she'd do a good job mind you. Just, that I suspect it's her that drove poor Kambin to opt for early residence in the bone pile - anyone would rather that than live on in the misery of her company."

A.response_text: "I might be responsible in part for Kambin's death."

D.response_text: "I wonder who'll be next."

E.response_text: "I'd kill myself too if I were born a Tambulan."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.600!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Wow! That's too dark a jest even for ol' Boz!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.6000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Even so, Kambin killed his own fool self; Pakahron was very clear on that."

E.response_text: "I'd kill myself too if I were born a Tambulan."

F.response_text: "Might not have stabbed him, but I gave him the knife!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.101!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Ha! You're not the first pair of legs that thinks they've crushed a man! Don't be too proud of yourself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.X1010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Kambin was on his own path before you wiggled your arse his way. So remember that you can pour a man some Jinn-Liquor but he's got to raise the cup!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.X201!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "We're all killin' ourselves, my little honeysuckle! It's just that some of us seem to have a talent for it!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.301!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Kambin was no deep thinker; someone must have put that idea in his head... So, I suppose it could've been you, outlander."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.3010!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Least, that's what some folk are sayin' - though, I doubt there's any truth to it."

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.X3011!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "After all, talkin' to you doesn't make me want to hang myself... just makes me want to show you how 'hung' I am! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.X401!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Who indeed? If trends continue, I wouldn't doubt that it'd be another one of those Cultivators - they've been droppin' like flies lately - and if there's any justice in the universe, it'll be Reba!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!3.X501!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "Oh? Well, I'm sure we'll all catch up with him some time. But for now let's just enjoy ourselves, okay sweet cheeks?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RAMPARTS!4.X000!BOZ!.dialogue_text: "I'd rather not chat anymore, honey buns; gotta use this time on my sacred duties and if you stay 'round too long, I'll be stiff as this corpse! Ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos enters a veritable forest of multi-tiered buildings, its depth unknowable from here. Walking among the houses, she runs her hand along the rough surface of their walls, fingers catching where layered bricks peek out from cracks in the adobe.\n\n\t\tThough mostly monochromatic and uniform, the residences distinguish themselves by simple yet colorful placards framing what could well be names and occupations. Dary, Loremaster. Dysron, Cultivator. Kagesh, Guardian. But then, she reaches one with the name defaced. Scratched through with a single line, Zebh, Cultivator was once written upon it.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.001!DES.dialogue_text: But such simple buildings make for poor companions. She soon realizes she will gain nothing from vacantly fondling the walls and decides to...

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.00100!D.dialogue_text: Scanning the area, Eidos takes note of the peculiar cast of characters dawdling here. In truth, the quality of companionship seems to have drastically degraded in this area of undesirables. The closest approximation to normal is a woman who is frantically pacing back and forth, cutting a nervous rut into the cobblestones beneath her feet.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X00101!.dialogue_text: But having come this far, Eidos is now set on speaking to someone. Thus, she deliberates on who her interlocutor will be...

A.response_text: The oddly-dressed fellow standing as still as a statue

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.00110!D.dialogue_text: Scanning the area, Eidos takes note of the peculiar cast of characters dawdling here. In truth, the quality of companionship seems to have drastically degraded in this area of undesirables. The closest approximation to normal is a woman who is frantically pacing back and forth, cutting a nervous rut into the cobblestones beneath her feet.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X00111!.dialogue_text: But having come this far, Eidos is now set on speaking to someone. She deliberates on who her interlocutor will be...

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.00120!D.dialogue_text: Scanning the area, Eidos takes note of the peculiar cast of characters dawdling here. In truth, the quality of companionship seems to have drastically degraded in this area of undesirables. The closest approximation to normal is a woman who is frantically pacing back and forth, cutting a nervous rut into the cobblestones beneath her feet.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X00121!.dialogue_text: But having come this far, Eidos is now set on speaking to someone. She deliberates on who her interlocutor will be...

A.response_text: The oddly dressed fellow standing as still as a statue

C.response_text: The woman who appears to predate Tambul itself

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.00130!D.dialogue_text: Scanning the area, Eidos takes note of the peculiar cast of characters dawdling here. In truth, the quality of companionship seems to have drastically degraded in this area of undesirables. The closest approximation to normal is a woman who is frantically pacing back and forth, cutting a nervous rut into the cobblestones beneath her feet.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X00131!.dialogue_text: But having come this far, Eidos is now set on speaking to someone. She deliberates on who her interlocutor will be...

B.response_text: The woman who appears to predate Tambul itself

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.002!DES.dialogue_text: The conversation at its end, Eidos stands idly pondering her next course of action.

C.response_text: Go towards one of the unique areas

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X003!DE.dialogue_text: Nearby she spots a building similar in shape and construction to the Temple. People enter and exit freely, many carrying leatherbound tomes to and from it. Then, to the west is the hustle and bustle of the Atrium. Further east, the silver spire looms over Tambul like a derisive overseer, glowering with unseen eyes. And to the north, a building unlike the others in both hue and architecture peeks above the tops of the residences. The building appears as though honeycombed with light or reflections thereof, but only on its northern side.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.0030!DE.dialogue_text: Of note is the missing Tambulan Archive, replaced by thick billows of dust and smoke. A sea of onlookers now floods in its direction. The once austere and sturdy symbol of stability against the tempest of time is now nothing more than a testament to ephemerality, a reminder of the futility of humanity's struggle against the waves of entropy as they crash and break at order's shores.\n\n\t\tBut not all has been so drastically altered, the familiar lanes leading north towards the Hydroponic Farm yet remain, as well as a path leading westward directly to the conspicuous Moon Tower.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0099.000!.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly through the streets towards her. The retreating mob of panicked Tambulans parts to admit his passage, like a school of fish before a shark. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.X000!.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.001!D.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.100!D.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.101!D.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.102!D.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.103!D.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.104!D.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.105!D.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!999.106!D.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.000!AKK.dialogue_text:
"Hearken, my friends as I begin the tale.
		It starts with a horrible, Jinn-born wail.
		A storm of blood, a storm of crime,
		A ghastly, ghoulish, ghost-filled time!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.001!AKK.dialogue_text:
"First, came ol' Famlaz, dread Jinn king of red,
		Lies dripping - oozing! - from his brain-filled head.
		Pay attention! Listen now and listen well!
		His squawking bird-voice with effect most fell!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.002!AKK.dialogue_text:
"It is I, CAW! Famlicus, the Lord of Lies!
		Scorpions and buzzards, my myriad spies.
		I turn the father 'gainst the son,
		Concoct despair for everyone!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.003!AKK.dialogue_text:
"Then came the brutal brothers Amethyst,
		Whom you would do well to detest.
		Most strong in body, yet quite weak in brain.
		For gifts, they brought man tears and pain!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.004!AKK.dialogue_text:
"Call our names, fools! Konki and Nerius!
		Twinned Jinns and brothers most nefarious!
		First, we strike and smash, then whip and lash!
		We'll dispose of you like filthy trash!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.005!AKK.dialogue_text:
"Next, came Vanargand, fabled Man of Green,
		With his emerald eyes and ghelblade most keen.
		Worse still are his children, death born in three.
		A curse for Biracul, for you and... ME!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.006!AKK.dialogue_text:
"I shall strike with both my sword and my spear.
		My first's deadly poison will burn and sear.
		My second's crushing jaw will mash and bite.
		My third's grisly face will wither and blight!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.007!AKK.dialogue_text:
"Of these roles, nary a one can compare,
		To the unseen Jinn of night and despair!
		Indeed! The very worst was Melinoe,
		Obsidian dowager of shadow!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.0070!AK.dialogue_text:
"Yes! Sister Midnight, neither found nor sought,
		Her most wicked weapon, her silent thought.
		No respite in sleep! Just nightmares galore!
		Beckon ye enter through Night's charnel door!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.0071!AK.dialogue_text:
"Each and every evil deed sows the seeds
		For the almighty Dread Spiral's return.
		Begging please, every man, each magi pleads,
		Make this festering world... BUR-UR-UR-URRRRrrrrrnnn..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.013!AKK.dialogue_text: "I can't believe it! You watched my whole performance! Even the lengthy, silent outro - included for dramatic effect! No one has ever watched my play in its entirety!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.014!AKK.dialogue_text: "You are thus bestowed with the highest honor of being my most loyal and supportive fan!"

A.response_text: "It was truly special and incomparably unique!"

D.response_text: "I've some suggestions for improvement..."

E.response_text: "I wanted to see how bad it would get."

F.response_text: "Well, I am a patron of the arts."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.100!AKK.dialogue_text: "Long have I searched for a person who would understand my art - and by extension, my very heart! But now, she stands before me, Biracul sent!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1000!AK.dialogue_text: "As beautiful as she is strange. As captivating as she is wild. Who is this untamed creature of the desert that stands before me? Me! Lonely, lowly master poet laureate Akkeber. Speak to me your name, wonderful you."

B.response_text: "Sure, but only after you tell me what it's based on."

D.response_text: "I recommend you get some help."

E.response_text: "Eidos, Poetslayer."

F.response_text: "Stalphos Gremlinsbane, Hero of Tomorrow!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.101!AKK.dialogue_text: "Shhhhh! No, no, no, no! Do not spoil it!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1010!AK.dialogue_text: "Name unknown - unspoken! - you are as mysterious as the dawn meeting the sea!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1011!AK.dialogue_text: "You alone are my muse. You enigmatic bumblebee! Seeking to pollinate the flower of my mind!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1013!AK.dialogue_text: "I shall call you Bootia, girl of my dreams, woman of my waking nightmare!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1014!A.dialogue_text: "My next oeuvre - my magnum opus! - will be dedicated to you and you alone!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.102!AKK.dialogue_text: "Fret not! Iron the wrinkles from your worried brow! For I will soon finish my new play, my dearest Bootia!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1020!AK.dialogue_text: "Return here sometime soon, and I shall perform it for you..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1021!A.dialogue_text: "Then, you and I shall craft a romance beyond any wordsmith's reckoning! Our bodies the brushes, our fluids the ink!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.103!AKK.dialogue_text: "Fairer than a polished gem,\n\t\tMore robust than an egg-laying hen..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1030!AK.dialogue_text: "Hmm... needs more vivid imagery... I know!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1031!A.dialogue_text: "Love deeper than a Suyuti's for their goat,\n\t\tWant to memorize your every bit by rote!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.104!AKK.dialogue_text: "More idle than the unemployed,\n\t\tHotter than an asteroid..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1040!AK.dialogue_text: "...Or perhaps 'Closer to me than my hemorrhoid,' instead..?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1041!AK.dialogue_text: "Gah! I need the brutal cruelty of the Dawn Fortress to move my pen beyond this writer's block!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1042!AK.dialogue_text: "Yes! Only by submerging my seed into manure can it blossom into the most beautiful stalk of grain!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1043!A.dialogue_text: "When next we meet, you will have been immortalized in song, my sweet!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.105!AKK.dialogue_text: "Lah dee dah dai, dee tum tum,\n\t\tIt's off to see the savage dum-dums!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.000!ENT.dialogue_text: "Why hello, outlander! You enjoyin' the ancient township of Tambul? I daresay, we're the envy of all Kabu!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.0000!EN.dialogue_text: "While the folk of the Dawn Fortress may have full muscles and the Dazirans might have full brains, I'd take a full belly over those any day! Tee-hee, ha ha!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.0001!EN.dialogue_text: "How 'bout you, child? You given any thought to settlin' here permanently?"

D.response_text: "How would that profit me?"

E.response_text: "Do I look like a farmer to you?"

F.response_text: "The only farmer I serve is the Turnip King!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.100!ENT.dialogue_text: "Of course you would! We're an open, friendly folk, and we delight in what other cultures may teach us."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1000!EN.dialogue_text: "There's many a young Tambulan lad, but scarcely a prospective wife; and now, I'm sad to say, even a child without a mother... Oh poor little Arghavan, it breaks my heart just thinkin' about it. You see, our mage-leader was forced to adopt Zebh's little girl, on top of all his other duties."

E.response_text: "I have no interest in tending to your spawn."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.200!ENT.dialogue_text: "We've great need of all folk, but especially lovely young women like yourself."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.2000!EN.dialogue_text: "There's many a young Tambulan lad, but scarcely a prospective wife; and now, I'm sad to say, even a child without a mother... Oh poor little Arghavan, it breaks my heart just thinkin' about it. You see, our mage-leader was forced to adopt Zebh's little girl, on top of all his other duties."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.300!ENT.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you should! We're certainly an open, and friendly folk! Oh, and we delight in what other cultures teach us."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.3000!EN.dialogue_text: "But truth be told from Biracul's lips to mine, there's another reason as well. You see, there're many young suitors without wives and even a child without a mother, Biracul bless her heart."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can put this idle child to use..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.400!ENT.dialogue_text: "Oh, well, you'd have meanin' and a community in your life! We're an open and friendly folk, delightin' in what other cultures teach us and all."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.4000!EN.dialogue_text: "But truth told from Biracul's lips to mine, there's another reason as well. You see, there're many young suitors without wives and even a child without a mother, Biracul bless her heart."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can put this idle child to use..."

E.response_text: "I have no interest in tending to your spawn."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.500!ENT.dialogue_text: "We don't just do farmin' here! This here is a crossroads of culture!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.5000!EN.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you could be a schoolteacher, educatin' our youths of foreign ways!"

E.response_text: "I have no interest in tending your spawn."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.600!ENT.dialogue_text: "Oh? Is he the leader of your country? Bein' a leader's a real difficult task with many demands."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.6000!EN.dialogue_text: "Our mage has even been forced to adopt a motherless child, on top of his other duties - man's as selfless as they come, I'll tell you that."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can put this idle child to use..."

E.response_text: "I have no interest in tending to your spawn."

F.response_text: "I fear your lax farming practices have sparked the King's ire."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.101!ENT.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you've seen her 'round the Atrium. A little red-haired girl. Arghavan's her name. Not long ago, her whole family joined the bone pile - was a terrible accident with plenty of hearsay, and next to no facts."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1010!E.dialogue_text: "And while Pakahron is a good man - Biracul smile upon him! - I'm sure little Arghie would be much happier livin' with a proper lady like yourself!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.201!ENT.dialogue_text: "Well, not long ago, her whole family joined the bone pile - was a terrible accident with plenty of hearsay, and next to no facts."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.301!ENT.dialogue_text: "Well, don't think too long! Arghavan won't be young forever, y'know!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.401!ENT.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, though right now she's anythin' but idle, what with Pakahron givin' her plenty of tasks around the township."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X501!EN.dialogue_text: "Though I'm not sure why you're so hostile towards us, I'll respect your decision, young lady. Biracul be with you."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X601!EN.dialogue_text: "Sorry to hear that! But I'm sure if he makes a strong case with sound arguments we'd be happy to listen to his grievances!"

F.response_text: "Well, the King has just sent me a message through underground network..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.000!ENT.dialogue_text: "Oh my! Well if it ain't the lovely young lady from before!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.001!ENT.dialogue_text: "You given any thought to what I said earlier?"

A.response_text: "I'd like to hear more about Arghavan."

B.response_text: "I want to learn more about Arghavan's situation."

D.response_text: "You sound suspicious of Pakahron..."

E.response_text: "Even death is preferable to becoming one of you."

F.response_text: "Hark! The Turnip King has a message!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.100!ENT.dialogue_text: "Poor Arghavan! She's all alone now. It was very strange, really. One night her whole family went to bed and never woke up..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.1000!EN.dialogue_text: "Even her father Zebh - such a strong and intelligent Cultivator that one! Yes, even he was taken by the disease. Only Arghavan slipped through the Obsidian Jinn's bony clutches."

A.response_text: "What did Arghavan say about that night?"

E.response_text: "No doubt you fools judged it a coincidence."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.200!ENT.dialogue_text: "Poor Arghavan! She's all alone now. It was very strange, really. One night her whole family went to bed and never woke up..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.2000!EN.dialogue_text: "Even her father Zebh - such a strong and intelligent Cultivator that one! Yes, even he was taken by the disease. Only Arghavan slipped through the Obsidian Jinn's bony clutches."

A.response_text: "What did Arghavan say about that night?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X300!EN.dialogue_text: "While your mind may be still, the world outside it is not. Time stops for no one, and you'd do well to remember that before it's too late."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.400!ENT.dialogue_text: "What? No! Pakahron is a great man to take in that girl! Especially in light of the circumstances."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.4000!EN.dialogue_text: "One day they were here and the next down in the Valley of Bones. Only lil' Arghie is left now."

D.response_text: "Why did she survive?"

E.response_text: "No doubt you fools judged it a coincidence."

F.response_text: "Hard to say: I don't speak Turnip. But he looked angry!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.101!ENT.dialogue_text: "The poor thin'! She hasn't been able to bring herself to speak 'bout what happened."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.1010!EN.dialogue_text: "Thank the Shinin' One we have such a talented mage in Pakahron! He was able to peer into her thoughts and learn what happened."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X1011!E.dialogue_text: "While he can't heal her, at least he can bear with Arghavan in her sufferin'. May Biracul guide that poor child."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.201!ENT.dialogue_text: "Well, I didn't see it personally, but some say they all bled to death! Ghastly, ain't it?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.2010!EN.dialogue_text: "Blood seeped out of their eyes, ears, mouths, even the pores in their skin! I for one suspect jinncraft, I do."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X2011!E.dialogue_text: "Arghavan must've been blessed by the Shinin' One himself to have avoided the same fate. May Biracul guide that poor child."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.401!ENT.dialogue_text: "Arghavan must've been blessed by the Shinin' One, that's why! I heard talk of her bein' punished that night and sent to her room with no dinner."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X4010!E.dialogue_text: "And while I didn't see it personally, I heard that they all bled to death - blood seepin' out of their eyes, ears, mouths, even the pores in their skin! Ghastly. I suspect jinncraft, I do."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.501!ENT.dialogue_text: "You suspect Arghavan?! I think I may've been too hasty in sayin' you'd be welcome here!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.5010!EN.dialogue_text: "Such depraved accusations ain't necessary when we've a mage like Pakahron! He was able to peer into her thoughts and learn the truth of what happened!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X5011!E.dialogue_text: "The folk of Kabu don't hold innocent children responsible for the deaths of their parents."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.601!ENT.dialogue_text: "...Then you don't have a message from the Turnip King after all?"

F.response_text: "Oh, I do. You'll be getting an earful! ...Soon."
"Oh, you will. Don't worry about that..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.603!ENT.dialogue_text: "...But I already do look forward to it."

F.response_text: "Yes, all of you will see what the Turnip King is really about..."
"...Is that some kind of turnip insult?"
"Because the Turnip King hates being insulted!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.606!ENT.dialogue_text: "Well, I wouldn't dare to insult the Turnip King!"

F.response_text: "Good... Very wise..."
"Yes... Wait, cleared what up?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.608!ENT.dialogue_text: "You know, about my insultin' the Turnip King."

F.response_text: "What?! How dare you insult the Turnip King?!"
"Too late now! You've already made an enemy of him... er... it!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.610!ENT.dialogue_text: "But how?! It's only been us here! Unless... are you the Turnip King?!"

F.response_text: "And now you mock ME! Do I look like a turnip to you?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.611!ENT.dialogue_text: "Please! I'm just a simple Tambulan! I wish for peace! I don't wanna offend you, your leaders or your gods!"

F.response_text: "Oh, you better pray you don't offend Roostor, or it's ON!"
"...I'll think about it."
"Just do me one favor."

E.response_text: "Close your trap before I go insane!"

F.response_text: "Accept this new message... from the Mushroom Duke."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X615!EN.dialogue_text: "I think I'm unworthy to take such a message! Perhaps you should go tell Pakahron directly about the Mushroom Duke, deary."

F.response_text: "Tally Ho! I shall!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!3.000!ENT.dialogue_text: "Well, hello again, young lady! Had you a change of heart, have you?"

E.response_text: "And live with the shame of being called a Tambulan? No, thanks."

F.response_text: "Hark! The Turnip King has a message!"
"Wait, did you just silently ask a question?!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!3.X100!EN.dialogue_text: "Nothing to worry 'bout, child! Just remember you're welcome here!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!3.X500!EN.dialogue_text: "I see, well, may Biracul free you from the Jinn's embrace, child."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.000!FAR.dialogue_text: "...Hmmm? Oh, excuse me, I'm afraid I'd make for poor conversation at the moment, stranger. But I hope you enjoy your stay."

D.response_text: "But I'm in need of your help..."

E.response_text: "You have no choice in the matter. Speak or suffer the consequences."

F.response_text: "Couldn't be a worse partner than the voices in my head."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.100!FAR.dialogue_text: "Oh, it's nothing! It's just... well, maybe you can help me. Biracul knows, no one else can."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1000!FA.dialogue_text: "My husband has been in ill health of late - from working on the farms too much, I suspect. And for the past month, he's rambled and raved in his sleep."

A.response_text: "Mind telling me a little more about your husband?"

E.response_text: "Do I look like a doctor?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.200!FAR.dialogue_text: "Just out for a walk to clear my head. You see... well, maybe you can help me. Biracul knows, no one else can."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.2000!FA.dialogue_text: "My husband has been in ill health of late - from working on the farms too much, I suspect. And for the past month, he's rambled and raved in his sleep."

A.response_text: "Mind telling me a little more about your husband?"

C.response_text: "I can't help you or your husband."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X300!FA.dialogue_text: "No, I suppose not. Well, good luck to you, stranger... Good luck to us all."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.400!FAR.dialogue_text: "You are? Then perhaps we can help each other!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.4000!FA.dialogue_text: "My husband has been in ill health of late - from working on the farms too much, I suspect. And for the past month, he's rambled and raved in his sleep."

C.response_text: "I can't help you or your husband."

D.response_text: "And what can I expect in return?"

E.response_text: "Do I look like a doctor?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.500!FAR.dialogue_text: "Okay, I'm sorry. Please don't get angry!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.5000!FA.dialogue_text: "I was just thinking about how my husband has been in ill health of late - from working on the farms too much, I suspect. And for the past month, he's rambled and raved in his sleep... You wouldn't be able to help, would you, outlander?"

A.response_text: "Mind telling me a little more about your husband?"

D.response_text: "And what can I expect in return?"

E.response_text: "Do I look like a doctor?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.600!FAR.dialogue_text: "Voices? Perhaps you suffer from a kindred ailment as my husband!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.6000!FA.dialogue_text: "You see, he's been in ill health of late - from working on the farms too much, I suspect. And for the past month, he's rambled and raved in his sleep."

F.response_text: "Sounds like a swell guy!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.101!FAR.dialogue_text: "His name is Kambin, but you'll immediately recognize him by his singing! Poor Kambin, always singing to distract himself these days, just like his mother used to."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1010!F.dialogue_text: "Oh stranger, if there's anything you can do to help him, I'd so greatly appreciate it."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.201!FAR.dialogue_text: "He often speaks of death, bodies, diseases. And then he cries out the name of the Ruby Jinn! But he worse of all, he also mutters a name I don't recognize: Mifas'cul."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.401!FAR.dialogue_text: "I'm afraid a poor woman such as myself could only offer her eternal gratitude."

C.response_text: "I can't help you or your husband."

D.response_text: "Then I see no reason to do it."

E.response_text: "Do I look like a charity?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X501!FA.dialogue_text: "No, I suppose not. Well, good luck to you strange one... Good luck to us all."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X103!FA.dialogue_text: "Please help my husband! Help chase away his nightmares, I beg you."

D.response_text: "I did as you asked..."

E.response_text: "I spoke to your fool husband."

F.response_text: "I busted some phat rhymes, beeyotch!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.002!FAR.dialogue_text: "Because of your jinnwhispers, my sweet Kambin is dead!"

A.response_text: "Farrin, I was attempting to help him."

D.response_text: "But... But I had no part in his death!"

E.response_text: "Then, shouldn't you be more careful about how you speak to me?"

F.response_text: "First Tupac, and now Kambin! NOOOOOOOooooo....!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.100!FAR.dialogue_text: "He took his own life! What did you say to him, you jinncursed foreigner!?"

E.response_text: "I rebuked him for his weakness."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.200!FAR.dialogue_text: "He took his own life! What did you say to him, you jinncursed foreigner!?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.400!FAR.dialogue_text: "You drove him to it! You must have used some foreign Techne to drive him to take his own life! What did you say to him, you jinncursed foreigner?!"

D.response_text: "It was your request! Blame yourself, not me."

E.response_text: "I rebuked him for his weakness."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.600!FAR.dialogue_text: "He took his own life! What did you say to him, you jinncursed foreigner!?"

F.response_text: "Perhaps the bombs I dropped were too potent for his mortal soul..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X101!FA.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry... Yes, I know it was the nightmares. I'm sorry, stranger... Oh Kambin!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X201!FA.dialogue_text: "He ate something called Redgrain, said it would end his bad dreams. And now... Now he's.... He's..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X301!FA.dialogue_text: "Curse you, Kharrspawn! By all the Jinns of the desert, the Wasteland and the towers of Night, I curse you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X401!FA.dialogue_text: "I know! It's all my fault he ate the Redgrain! But he said it would end his bad dreams. And now... Now he's.... He's..."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X501!FA.dialogue_text: "Curse you, Kharrspawn! By all the Jinns of the desert, the Wasteland and the towers of Night, I curse you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.X601!FA.dialogue_text: "Curse you, Kharrspawn! By all the Jinns of the desert, the Wasteland and the towers of Night, I curse you!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!1.899!FAR.dialogue_text: "Please, foreigner. Just... just leave me alone."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!2.000!FAR.dialogue_text: "Stranger!! I don't know how you did it, but you brought my Kambin back to me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!2.X001!FA.dialogue_text: "I'm eternally in your debt! Oh, I'll pray for your well-being to Biracul till the day I abandon the Falseflesh!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!3.000!FAR.dialogue_text: "You're in my prayers, stranger. I simply can't thank you enough!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.000!SOR.dialogue_text: "Have you heard the words of the Prophet yet?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.001!SOR.dialogue_text: "The bandaged seer travels from place to place, so I don't know if he's here right now, but you should really hear him speak if you get the chance!"

D.response_text: "What evidence do you have that he is genuine?"

E.response_text: "Do I look like an idiot to you?"

F.response_text: "I dunno. Maybe he's just a run-of-the-mill time traveler."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.100!SOR.dialogue_text: "His popularity has been growin' - 'specially since he predicted the sickness a few months back!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.1000!SO.dialogue_text: "And what with this comin' war with Tacriba, it's really only a matter of time before the world ends, just as he predicted!"

B.response_text: "Any specific information about when or why this'll happen?"

E.response_text: "You're a fool to think your destruction heralds the world's end."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.200!SOR.dialogue_text: "I doubt I could do them justice! But the gist of what he describes is the comin' of a great sickness that'll nearly purge the land of life, and then a massive conflict that'll destroy the survivors."

A.response_text: "Why would people be so infatuated in such a dismal prediction?"

B.response_text: "Any specific information about when or why this'll happen?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.300!SOR.dialogue_text: "Indeed, you should. You won't regret it if what he says comes to pass!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.3000!SO.dialogue_text: "I'd already begun preparin' for the end before this business with Tacriba because I listened!"

B.response_text: "The end of the world? Why'll this happen?"

D.response_text: "What does he say about surviving this apocalypse?"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.400!SOR.dialogue_text: "Predictin' the sickness from a few months passed and this business with Tacriba is evidence enough for me!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.4000!SO.dialogue_text: "The Prophet foresaw long ago that there'd be a devastatin' sickness and then a war that'd destroy the world!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.4001!SO.dialogue_text: "He's right: doom comes for us all."

D.response_text: "What does he say about surviving this apocalypse?"

E.response_text: "You're a fool to think your destruction heralds the world's end."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.500!SOR.dialogue_text: "I wouldn't be so dismissive if I were you. The Prophet already predicted the sickness that passed through here a few months passed!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.5000!SO.dialogue_text: "Now, it seems the war he spoke of - 'the war to destroy the world' - now seems to be startin' right here in Kabu!"

D.response_text: "What does he say about surviving this apocalypse?"

E.response_text: "You're a fool to think your destruction heralds the world's end."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.600!SOR.dialogue_text: "Are you tryin' to insult me? See here stranger, this's serious business!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.6000!SO.dialogue_text: "He's already correctly predicted the sickness from a few months passed. What's more, he also foretold of the war that'll end the world! What else do you think this business with Tacriba is?"

F.response_text: "Time travel is serious business, too! Lots of profit in that field!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.101!SOR.dialogue_text: "There was a plague or somethin', durin' the harvest a few months back. Most were taken by surprise, but we followers of the Prophet already knew it was the beginnin' of the end!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1010!S.dialogue_text: "I tell you, stranger, the teachin's of Biracul have brought us nothin'! Soon all'll be swept away to make room for the Dread Spiral, a god more powerful than Biracul and the Jinns combined! Prepare your Trueflesh for death, stranger!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X1011!S.dialogue_text: "The old religion has proven false and the teachin's of Biracul have brought us nothin' but failure and ruination! Prayin' to him does no good anymore, and why should it? Even HE will join the bone pile in the comin' war... to make room for the Dread Spiral! Prepare your Trueflesh for death, stranger."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X201!SO.dialogue_text: "When? Soon, that's all I know. As to why, who can fathom fate? Should we even be here in the first place? We could just as easily have never existed! And we can also just as easily join the bone pile! Believin' in the necessity of existence, is true folly."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X401!SO.dialogue_text: "There's nothin' one can use to thwart fate - not even Awareness! The Prophet teaches us that Biracul himself'll join the bone pile in this war. So if it's your destiny to survive, then you will. Best of luck to both of us, stranger!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X501!SO.dialogue_text: "It's just the beginnin', stranger. We'll see how smug you are when war spreads and consumes your homeland! Nothin' can protect you! The weapons of this conflict'll even destroy the Graylands themselves!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X601!SO.dialogue_text: "I don't have time to deal with lunatics!"

F.response_text: "I get it; you're busy with your own brand of crazy."

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X800!SO.dialogue_text: "Hear the Prophet's warnin's and prepare yourselves for the awakenin' of the One!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X801!SO.dialogue_text: "Hear the Prophet's warnin's and know the Sa'Ma!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X802!SO.dialogue_text: "Beginnin' from a single point and to a single point returned, the demons of Urugh birth their own destruction!"

KABU!TAMBUL!RESIDENCE DISTRICT!0.X803!SO.dialogue_text: "The Mother of all Glyphs will resurrect the Red Tower, compressin' time back to the origin!"

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!0.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos steps into the diminutive chamber, swimming through a crimson haze. Giving the room its reddish hue is a shining crystal, offered up by the hands of a statue kneeling in supplication, a look of ecstasy etched upon its stony face.\n\n\t\tEidos sees that, even in spite of the crimson filter, the frescoes in this small room stand with all the clarity those outside must have once possessed. They depict a great number of folk sitting at the feet of a violet-robed figure, orbs of light hovering above his palms. Deep within the orbs themselves, fiery Glyphs float as if in a viscous fluid.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!0.X001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: In an inadvisable acquiescence to her baser nature, Eidos casts the crystal to the ground. It shatters, releasing its energetic contents, and ripping Eidos' ghost straight from her Falseflesh.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!0.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: In an inadvisable acquiescence to her baser nature, Eidos casts the crystal to the ground. It shatters, releasing its energetic contents. Luin, true to its word, envelops her with his diamond skin.\n\n\t\tUnfortunately for Eidos, the collapsing ceiling pins her against one of the walls. Crackling fires and screaming survivors punctuate the confusion of the aftermath. Then the mephitic fumes of burning tomes start to worm their way through the rubble towards her, leaving Eidos to die of asphyxiation. She persists for a time before apoxia's effects overwhelm her desire to live. She sleeps and her ghost succumbs to the magnetic pull of the Graylands.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!0.002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: With the Techne of Extraction, she absorbs the crystal into her Trueflesh, intertwining itself with her very essence, an image seared into her ghost. Its contents: another tome, this time related to Farcasters.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!1.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos now stands in this chamber bereft of light. The frescoes have been consumed into darkness, like a fading memory. The ecstatic smile engraved upon the statue, lost in the shadows.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!2.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Returning to the secret chamber, Eidos notes that the frescoes and the statue have dissolved into the shadows. Groping about the air as she advances in the dark, she happens upon the cold forearms of the supplicant statue and traces them up to its hands. The crimson crystal remains intact.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!3.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Returning to the secret chamber, Eidos notes that the frescoes and the statue have dissolved into the shadows. Groping about the air as she advances in the dark, she happens upon the cold forearms of the supplicant statue and traces them up to its hands. The crimson crystal remains intact.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!3.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos tenderly pours her essence into the crystal, as a mother feeding her child. A memory - beyond time, beyond logic - sets itself into the crystal for someone to discover anew.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!3.002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Drinking deeply from the crimson source, Eidos imbibes knowledge of the cycle, unyielding and unending. She recalls the Red Tower as it will be when she offers up the sacrifice to birth it into existence.\n\n\t\tSo intense are these visions, that she drops the fragile crystal allowing it to slowly careen towards an indifferent and unmoving floor. The impact rings clearly into her ears, an alarm returning her to the present moment from whatever future reverie she had been trapped in.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!4.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Eidos has returned to the secret chamber. The frescoes and the statue bathe in the crimson rays of the crystal. Imbued with Eidos' essence.

KABU!TAMBUL!SECRET CHAMBER!5.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Returning to the secret chamber, Eidos notes that the frescoes and the statue have dissolved into the shadows. Groping about the air as she advances in the dark, she happens upon the cold forearms of the supplicant statue and traces them up to its hands. The crimson crystal is gone, the crunch of glass under her footbindings reminding her of its fate.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos regards the building she has entered, estimating it to be a square of some hundred paces in width and of equal length. Bereft of roof - only barely covered by the end of the aqueduct - this space generously hosts the sun's falling rays. The center of the room flickers as sunshine contacts the large metallic disk abiding there, elevated upon a three-step dais. This disk bears a great resemblance to the one where she awoke.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.0000!DES.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the walls, Eidos notes that the dark sandstone of the temple miraculously seems carved from a monolithic block. Stairways and upper areas around the perimeter have been fashioned from the lighter stone materials prevalent in its neighboring structures, by all appearances as an afterthought. However, all masonry and supports here are meticulously crafted and the entire layout designed with expert ability.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.0001!DES.dialogue_text: Crashing water muffles the sound of idle gossip and rowdy children. It is here that the great aqueduct pours itself as a cascade into a massive reservoir. The folk of Tambul fill their emptied vessels at the opposite end of the waterfall where calmer waters reign.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos regards the building she has entered, estimating it to be a square of some hundred paces in width and of equal length. Bereft of roof - only barely covered by the end of the aqueduct - this space generously hosts the sun's falling rays. The center of the room flickers as sunshine contacts the Farcaster disk abiding there, elevated upon a three-step dais.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.0010!DES.dialogue_text: Turning her attention to the walls, Eidos notes that the dark sandstone of the temple miraculously seems carved from a monolithic block. Stairways and upper areas around the perimeter have been fashioned, seemingly as an afterthought. All masonry and supports are meticulously crafted and the entire layout designed with expert ability.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.0011!DES.dialogue_text: Trickling water muffles the sound of idle gossip and rowdy children. It is here that the great aqueduct empties itself as a cascade into a massive reservoir. The folk of Tambul fill their emptied vessels at the opposite end of the waterfall where calmer waters reign.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.000!DESC.dialogue_text: A localized beam of energy precedes Eidos' reformation onto a familiar metallic disk. She regards the building, estimating it to be a square of some hundred paces in width and of equal length. Bereft of roof - only barely covered by the end of an enormous aqueduct - this space generously hosts the sun's falling rays. The metallic disk beneath Eidos' feet steals the light, reflecting it in a pale imitation of its source - though it certainly is bright enough to irritate her eyes.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X001!DES.dialogue_text: Stepping from the platform, Eidos sees the crowd of dumbfounded people staring her way. She hastily walks away from them, yet they continue to chase her with their collective gawking.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Stepping from the platform, Eidos cannot help but notice she is yet again the focus of the surrounding people's silent attention. Even as she walks away from them, they mercilessly chase her with their collective gawking.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!99.X00!DES.dialogue_text: Stepping from the surface of the Farcaster, guards immediately point their spears at Eidos and summon Pakahron. Racing into the temple, he seems less than pleased with her arrival. Not wasting any time, he immediately begins to summon a destructive Glyph from the Graylands...

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!99.X01!DES.dialogue_text: As Eidos begins to materialize, a searing pain seizes her as all bodily functions begin to shut down. Poison has slowed her breathing to a halt and she is now suffocating. The guards regard her with extreme discomfort, some mixture of empathy and ecstasy vaguely written on their faces.\n\n\t\tThen, the pain fades away, her body having nearly disintegrated completely. Eidos is not welcome in Tambul, it seems.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!99.02!DESC.dialogue_text: As Eidos begins to materialize, a searing pain seizes her as all bodily functions begin to shut down. Luin erupts from its rest, creating a protective shield around her bones, sinews, skin and everything it can touch. But this attack on her Falseflesh seeks not destruction through coarse blows, rather through decomposition of the very matter she is composed of. The ruinous Techne has slowed her breathing to a halt, suffocating her. She gasps for air to fill her absent lungs. The guards regard her with extreme discomfort, some mixture of empathy and ecstasy vaguely written on their faces.\n\n\t\tThen the pain fades along with the rest of her disintegrating body - a final parting gift from the slain mage of Tambul, it seems.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0099.000!D.dialogue_text: Before even a drop of spilled blood has fallen upon the ground, Eidos sees Pakahron waddling gracelessly into the darkened Temple towards her. While his face is a stoic mask, his eyes burn with unambiguous intent. His displeased, yet calm demeanor belie a preternatural awareness of what has transpired. Without a break in his step, he advances forward to engage the threat that now menaces his people.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.X000!D.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.001!DE.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. Stabbing until there is little left unstabbed, they leave her to join Pakahron in his departure from the mortal coil. Little do they know...

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.100!DE.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.101!DE.dialogue_text: The guards inspect the body of the fallen mage and mournfully shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. Suddenly, they begin to gather around her and wordlessly, like a hive-minded machine, they pull back their spears and attempt to perforate Eidos' Falseflesh. But Luin disagrees with their plans and destroys their each spear upon impact.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.102!DE.dialogue_text: Not unresourceful in the least, they fetch a gray liquid they proceed to pour down her throat. It hardens almost instantaneously. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.103!DE.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.104!DE.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.105!DE.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.106!DE.dialogue_text: Her slayers look upon her dying form, downtrodden and uncertain. With their mage dead, the acrid stench of panic permeates the air, its effects written clearly on their faces. Then...

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.000!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, she hears the thundering steps of an army headed west toward Dazir. To the east, a thick column of smoke rises skyward from the broken Moon Tower. Surrounding her is the despair of inconsolable people caught in the middle of a bloody conflict. Those who opposed the march now rest impaled on pikes in the Atrium - a persuasive warning not to interfere, as among the skewered victims is Pakahron's limp body .

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.X001!D.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Eidos notices someone perched right next to her. The figure dons dusty robes, patched and mended so many times that the original fabric is hard to discern. Yet every stitch of thread or scrap of cloth is dyed some shade of red. At first it features remain hidden under a blood-red hat, until its head jerks up to regard her.\n\n\t\tIt simply stares, cocking its head side to side, tracking her every motion, like a vigilant bird eying its prey. Then, clutching a large wooden staff, it disinterestedly etches a Glyph into the dirt and begins to speak.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.050!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, she hears the thundering steps of an army headed west. To the east, a thick column of smoke rises skyward from the broken Moon Tower. Surrounding her is the despair of inconsolable people caught in the middle of a bloody conflict. Those who opposed the march now rest impaled on pikes in the Atrium - a persuasive warning not to interfere, as among the skewered victims is Pakahron's limp body.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.051!DE.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Eidos notices a red-robed figure perched right next to her...

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.X053!D.dialogue_text: His features hide beneath his wide-brimmed hat, until his head jerks up to regard her. At first, he simply stares, cocking his head side to side, tracking her every motion, like a vigilant bird eying its prey. Then, clutching a large wooden staff, he disinterestedly etches a Glyph into the dirt and begins to speak.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.500!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, she hears the thundering steps of an army headed west toward Dazir. To the east, a thick column of smoke rises skyward from the broken Moon Tower. Surrounding her is the despair of inconsolable people caught in the middle of a bloody conflict. Those who opposed the march now rest impaled on pikes in the Atrium - a warning of what awaits those who interfere.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.X501!D.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Eidos notices someone perched right next to her. The figure dons dusty robes, patched and mended so many times that the original fabric is hard to discern. Yet every stitch of thread or scrap of cloth is dyed some shade of red. At first it features remain hidden under a blood-red hat, until its head jerks up to regard her.\n\n\t\tIt simply stares, cocking its head side to side, tracking her every motion, like a vigilant bird eying its prey. Then, clutching a large wooden staff, it disinterestedly etches a Glyph into the dirt and begins to speak.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.550!DE.dialogue_text: As Eidos reforms atop the Farcaster, she hears the thundering steps of an army headed west. To the east, a thick column of smoke rises skyward from the broken Moon Tower. Surrounding her is the despair of inconsolable people caught in the middle of a bloody conflict. Those who opposed the march now rest impaled on pikes in the Atrium - a warning of what awaits those who interfere.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.551!DE.dialogue_text: Suddenly, Eidos notices a red-robed figure perched right next to her...

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.X553!D.dialogue_text: His features hide beneath his wide-brimmed hat, until his head jerks up to regard her. At first, he simply stares, cocking his head side to side, tracking her every motion, like a vigilant bird eying its prey. Then, clutching a large wooden staff, he disinterestedly etches a Glyph into the dirt and begins to speak.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!101.000!DE.dialogue_text: The air around Famlicus appears to distort, causing his form to scatter left and right layer-by-layer until there remains no trace of him.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!101.001!DE.dialogue_text: The Tacribians now receive their long-awaited vengeance on Dazir, at the cost of dooming all peoples of Kabu. Nothing will ever be the same. Yet Eidos somehow feels a detached calmness. Drawing upon the strength of her Trueflesh, she realizes that all is inconsequential. All is temporary. All is uncontrollable. All possibilities will manifest themselves within the fullness of time. But more than this...

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!101.002!DE.dialogue_text: All is, was and ever shall be as it should be.

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!101.003!DE.dialogue_text: This is not her end. Eidos knows this. She is surer in this truth than in any other. With this epiphany, her ghost begins gently drifting off into the sea of infinity, carried by violent and dispassionate currents. She merges with the chaotic spiral of being, disintegrating and reforming until she is no longer able to distinguish herself from the surrounding Void...\n\n\t\tEven still, the Self knows something else lies beyond this world of illusions.

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.000!FA.dialogue_text: "Care to look upon the carnage you've created, daughter of Viracocha?"

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.001!FA.dialogue_text: "Whether consciously or unconsciously, you seem to have looked favorably upon the Tacribians..."

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.002!FA.dialogue_text: "But, it's of no consequence to me which side lives... Either way, my goal is achieved."

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.003!FA.dialogue_text: "And with yet another Great Awakening avoided, your role in my little play is over."

KABU!TAMBUL!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!100.004!FA.dialogue_text: "You are now free to do what you wish with what remains of your life, Eidos."
